story:
Due to overwhelming demand for The Sausage Pan and Breakfast Pan, we are reevaluating our perks and will be relaunching our campaign soon. Visit sausagepan.com for more details. Thank you to everyone for your amazing support!
-The Sausage Pan Team

story:
Short Summary

Unwind Subscription Box is a subscription service that delivers relaxation right to your front door. For about $25 a month (shipping included!), The concept behind Unwind is introducing people to different versions of the things they already enjoy. This subscription box will include music from indie artists, literature from self-published authors, drinks and snacks from small-batch & artisanal companies around the globe. Unwind is an amazing way to enjoy new realms of relaxation. Let’s all getaway!

Our story: I love subscription boxes and there are so many wonderful boxes out there, but what about one that directly makes an impact on the lives of every individual that needs a breaks sometimes? & that is how Unwind was created.

Stress is linked to heart disease, depression, obesity and can complicate other existing illnesses. Anyone who works, have children, or bills could use an occasional "unwinding." Millennials [those ages 18 to 33] are growing up at a time where society has such high expectations of them. This kind of pressure has made it hard to accept failure because so many individuals expect you to achieve without making any mistakes. This is why our target audience is 18 to 33 years young.

I am reaching out to Indiegogo fans hoping you'll join my journey as I dive into the subscription box world to make a difference. Be one of the first to sign up for Unwind Subscription Box! The website is set to launch early December so in the meantime I am looking for you to be a part of our product development team. I want to hear your ideas. What helps you relax? After the first shipment, I will follow up with you to get some feedback. What did you like and dislike about your first box? What would you like to see in future boxes? You'll have exclusive access to different events, contests, giveaways, and a whole community of people that just need to uplifting. 

The first box will ship out in January. I am soOOO passionate about this new business venture and I aim to making relaxation a part of everyone’s everyday life. I want to help stop mental illness one box at a time! Wouldn’t it be great to explore new realms of life? You will have constant mind escapes every month!

What We Need 

Break down of funds

What You Get

  • Handwritten Card + Follow on Social Networks
  • Unwind Subscription Box(es)
  • 2016 Unwind Wall Calendar
  • T-Shirt with names of all contributors
  • Choose an inspirational quote that will go in the box
  • A trip to NYC to spend the day with the founder (me =)

The Impact

So many people are out there fighting through depression and nobody knows, but what if there was something that let them catch a break from time to time to get them back motivated and inspired.

  • Bring happiness to the doorsteps of the people who need a mental break!
  • Bring ALL entrepreneurs together! Musicians! Authors! Cooks! Bakers! Artists! 

Risks & Challenges

If this project is not successfully funded we won't be able to spread love and happiness around the globe! Unwind Subscription Box will not be able to introduce you to other entrepreneurs every month!

Other Ways You Can Help

Every contribution counts!

  • Get the word out and make some noise about Unwind Subscription Box Campaign on your social networks!
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Short Summary

We are bringing fiber to the home in Covered Bridge Estates. We plan to offer speeds of up to 1 Gbps in the future with initial speeds of up to 500 Mbps. This will cost a couple hundred thousand dollars. Ouch! We need your help to get going.  

Once we are up and going, 100 Mbps will be $95 per month. 500 Mbps will be $125 per month, 1 Gbps is estimated to be $135 per month once it is available. Home phone will be $30 per month. All prices include fees and taxes. 

What We Need & What You Get

We need to know who wants the service before we get started. It will cost a lot less to bring fiber to your home if we can do it during the initial build out. 

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Tell your friends and neighbors
  • Share on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Snapchat or via smoke signals.

story:
Pleasure Distillery is a craft distiller in Laguna Beach, California. Pleasure is friends, purity, adventure, independence, & discovery in a bottle. Each of our spirits are created entirely from fresh California coastal homegrown ingredients. Our agave, rum, and absinthe recipes are classics combining tradition and innovation. We have three generations of distilling in our blood and a lifetime of vintner experience. Our distillation runs are done in single small batches each with precise family secret "cuts" to remove harmful congeners for your drinking Pleasure. With your help, we are just months away from having our bottles on shelves.


"In the midst of a Renaissance for careful crafted spirits, artisan distillers have boomed across the nation...California has been a pioneer in this expansion."

                                                                                      

 "In the midst of a Renaissance for carefully crafted spirits, artisan distilleries have boomed in California and across the nation. California has been a pioneer in this expansion. These pricier artisan spirits are a growing niche of the $60-billion US spirit market, with 2% of sales last year. The volume of craft spirits produced has nearly doubled in the least two years. A new law signed last week by Governor Jerry Brown could push California craft distillers even more mainstream. The craft Distillers act of 2015 allows spirit makers to sell up to three bottles [per person, per day] of their alcohol from tasting rooms and operate an on-site bar and restaurant for the first time. The industry has changed dramatically over the last two decades as consumers preferences changed. Momentum continued to build as more customers turned to local sources for food and expected the same from their spirits, leading to greater demand for craft distillers. Orange County is the last frontier, just because there isn't anybody. There definitely is a need." 


About Us

Constantine (Gus) Samios II first learned the art of distilling with his great grandfathers fire-bombed still when he was 12 years old. He's been boiling mash and wine ever since. After graduating from the University of San Diego, Samios launched a string of successful California businesses that each played a significant part in spawning entirely new industries. With a three generation background in distilling and a clear vision of new industry development, Gus (and Cheryl!) have proudly poised Pleasure Distillery both domestically and internationally to move the world from chemical heavy industrial alcohols to smooth local field-to-bottle fine spirits.

  

Joining Samios in botanical pairing is California Culinary Institute graduate, Michelin rated chef, and Zagat rated fine California cuisine restaurant owner, Nick Difu. Nick is a master chef featured in publications including the San Jose Mercury News and The New Yorker magazine. Nick's unique talent for pairing fresh California ingredients has allowed us to create classic spirit recipes with the smoothest finish.

Council for Pleasure is managed by Michael Parson. Parsons is a graduate of UC Santa Barbara with extensive legal and operational background as Council and Chief Operations Officer at multiple food and medical related businesses featuring all natural base ingredients. Mike also lets Pleasure grow our own blue agave on his 50 acre seaside California ranch. Pleasure blue agave is the ONLY California grown pure agave spirit in the world.


About You

With your backing, you can know the impact you'll have on us, our community, all small businesses, and the future of the clean farm-to-bottle movement is bigger than words can explain. And, the world will see your name posted, burned, or carved on our distillery walls forever to prove it.

We follow the more-than-you-expected policy. Each of our backers, big or small, will be a permanent part of our distillery whether it be a DISTILLER tee shirt, a signed 1st batch bottle, a personal bar stool, your name etched on one of our fermentation tanks, or even the experience of being Master Distiller for a Day.


The Products You're Helping Us Make

                        

We make what we are.  Our lives have been spent living in small surf towns along the California coastline. Our roots are deepest in Laguna Beach, La Jolla, Santa Barbara, and Santa Cruz. Our minds are always on close friends, adventure, independence, and discovery. The ocean and the sky are our playgrounds. Pleasure Spirits are all this in a bottle.
Our Pearl Street Rum is made from fresh cut California sugar cane. Our Pacific Sea Grass Absinthe is an innovative smooth high proof version of the mystic spirit. Our California Blue Agave is home grown right here at our central California seaside ranch - we are one of the first and only California agave producers. Consider the best wines in the world shifted from France and Italy to our west coast. The best beers in the world shifted from Germany to the US. With your help, we aim to bring the best agave spirit production to California. This goal is an industry changer. 
Each of our spirits is designed to be a classic created entirely from the California coastal area plants we love the most. Our hearts know there are no short cuts to perfection. We don't buy commercially distilled bulk alcohol and we don't infuse our spirits with flavoring to mask harmful congeners (impurities). Our stills are hand made in the US entirely of copper for a cleaner more pure taste than the steel stills commonly used. Our distillation runs are done in single small batches each independently tested & tasted with precise family secret "cuts" to remove toxins. Our water is fresh high sierra snow melt brought down direct from Lake Tahoe. These are just some of the critical measures we live by to make our clean smooth spirits. Tradition & Innovation. We are the next generation of distillers.


What's Different About Pleasure?

Pure central California coast grown agave, fresh valley sugar cane, Santa Cruz mountain grapes, Pacific sea grass, meticulous fermentation, hand made copper stills, maximum toxin removal, precise small batch distillation technique, and lots of drop-by-drop love.
If you're wondering what kind of harmful chemicals we've all been drinking all these years and wishing your spirits could be smooth and stripped of toxins, then you've come to the right place. We apply both the old school taste, smell, & texture method taught to us from a century of family distilling tradition combined with the refined fermentation techniques we grew up with in coastal wine country. This allows us to make cleaner and smoother spirits with minimal toxicity. To do this it takes innovative time consuming steps [and a few family secrets] that the old mass production booze manufacturers will not even consider.
We love tradition. The funny thing about California is that our tradition is innovation.

      

            


Our Distillery

The notion of Pleasure Distillery started in a modified outdoor shower at Pleasure Point, California back in 1976.
Decades later, we took our passion for underground R&D inside a retired yacht building hanger outside a small outlaw section of town soaked in surf, sailing, smuggling, and adventure roots just up the coast from the Baja border. Our neighborhood was steeped in classic surf history and the original home to both The Surfers Journal and Surfer Magazine. Not to mention surf visionary Hobie Alter and adventure film producer Bruce Brown. Our direction was inspired by our neighbors of world class boat builders, Catalina island sailors, channel crossing watermen, and infamous surf board shapers. All indy adventurers using the natural resources around them to create perfection.

             

       

      

As we grew into being a licensed distillery, we moved our hand made copper still to our home town of Laguna Beach. Our expanded factory has space to hold our new fermentation tanks, boiler, chiller, barrels, and soon our second 250 gallon US made copper production still (this is where you come in!).
Pleasure Distillery is now permanently located on hidden Laguna Canyon Road - an old windy two lane stretch into Laguna Beach. Our small surf town hosts several renown destination bars and restaurants. While privately nestled along the coast behind a web of canyons, Pleasure Distillery is centered directly in the middle of the three most populated counties in California (Los Angeles, Orange, & San Diego).

  


Here's Where We Are Now

Over the past 16 months we've boot-strapped together our California LLC with three DBA's, three trademarks, all municipal permits, all California permits (ABC), all federal permits (TTB-DSP pending), a three year expandable lease, and a solid web and social media presence. We own a custom US made copper agave still, stripping column, 4-plate column, 2-plate extender, copper botanical basket, copper primary and secondary condenser system, 3 stainless steel collection tanks, and have a larger copper production still in the works. Our three initial spirit recipes have been perfected and (with your help!) ready to bottle. Pleasure Distillery has zero debt.

Where Is Your Money Going?

The home stretch. We are just months away from having our bottles on the shelves. With your help, we are raising $57,000 to bring us to production and sales! Here's the break-down of where your money is going:
Distillery Equipment
  • 500 gallon mash cooker  ($4,000)
  • Four 132 gallon fermentation tanks ($6,000)
  • Hoses and support equipment ($1,000)
  • 250 gallon stainless steel stripping tank ($3,500)
  • 250 gallon stainless steel proofing tank ($3,500)
  • Aging barrels ($2,000)
  • Bottling/Labeling machine ($2,000)

Production

  • Agave saplings and initial mash ingredients ($10,000)
  • Initial bottles & labels ($5,000)
Operations
  • Facility plumbing, drain, & electrical improvements ($6,000)
  • Facility build-out, expansion & permits ($14,000)


Will Your Investment Make a Difference?

YES!  Some of the best world changing ideas happened between two friends with adventurous hearts sharing a drink. So really, your help in launching our distillery will make you the catalyst for this idea incubator for years to come. 

We are passionate patient distillers and resourceful business folks who love what we do. We are not a corporate subsidiary or part of a large single family fund. Pleasure Distillery is funded by YOU. Every dollar you put towards Pleasure will leave a mark on the next generation of distillers, small business, and US made products. Plus, you'll be able to tell your grandkids that you were a founder of one of the best distilleries on the planet way back in 2016.


Risks & Challenges

Even though craft distilling is at the cusp of a world-wide boom steadily capturing shares of the $60+ billion market, it is a relatively new business model with limited historic information to draw from. This is where we thrive. Innovation & Tradition. We are resourceful, we have generations of distilling experience, we've successfully build industry changing businesses, we know a great product ultimately prevails, and we never give up.


Other Ways You Can Help

Now you're talkin'! That you've read this is huge to us. You can help most by spreading the word about Pleasure Distillery  to your friends, family, & co-workers. Ask your bartender for Pleasure or just pass our story on to the stranger sitting on the bar stool next to you. And, please share this campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and Email using the Indiegogo tools at the top left of this page.

To a spirited 2016.


Enjoy!

story:
LAST ORDERS MIDNIGHT SUNDAY 20th DECEMBER!!!

Email us to order combos, or multiple cases info@etchedcocktails.com


We’re Etched Cocktails - 

Personalised, ready to drink cocktails for extra-groovy events.

Our intentions are clear and simple: to combine the experience of delicious ready to drink cocktails with your very own bespoke label, tailored specifically for you.

We’re looking to raise funds to evolve Etched Cocktails into something bigger and better!

Because 'tis the season, we have based our Indigogo packages on 5 (now 6!) sample festive label designs to give you the idea of what we offer. Remember that the full Etched service is completely personalised to any style of event or design.

From weddings to birthdays to product launches and gifts, Etched adds the unique edge to any occasion.

Everyone who helps will become a lifetime Etched Founding Hero - making you first in line to taste our new recipes and hear our latest news. Each membership comes with a thank you selection of cocktails (check out the Perks)!


Our Sample Christmas Labels


And because it's Christmas...


Check Out Our Website

Etched Cocktails


Everything Else You Need To Know

story:
Introdução

Acha que cafés, estações de serviço, espalhadas, receções de hotel são o local certo para reuniões? Consegue separar o seu horário de trabalho do seu horário de lazer? Consegue crescer e obter novos clientes a um ritmo gratificante? Estes são alguns dos problemas que encontro enquanto trabalhador a partir de casa.

O Outpost pretende ser um local de networking, sala de reuniões em Vila do Conde para empresas e trabalhadores independentes da área das novas tecnologias. Projetado para pequenas empresas e profissionais pretendemos oferecer um espaço de luxo e profissional com Wifi de cortesia, bebidas, chá e café. A nossa equipa conta com 2 profissionais, ligados ao comércio internacional, que irão ajudar a rede de talentos do Outpost a captar novas oportunidades de negócio.

O nosso objetivo é simples: fazer com que os nossos membros e os seus negócios tenham mais sucesso proporcionando um espaço de trabalho e networking de qualidade sem os seus custos elevados associados. Pretendemos ser uma grande equipa internacional. Iremos apresentar o Outpost internacionalmente como uma equipa recheada de talentos disposta a oferecer os seus serviços.

Pretendemos que os membros do Outpost sejam brilhantes, bem-sucedidos, pessoas inspiradas e que inspirem ao seu redor. Pretendemos todo o tipo de profissionais TI com qualquer nível de educação. Outpost não será apenas um escritório mas sim um lugar onde podem compartilhar ideias e projetos. Ao fim do dia queremos que todos deixem o Outpost inspirados e felizes.

No Outpost iremos ter inúmeros eventos orientados em ajudar as pessoas a aprender a ser melhores empresários e para se conectar com outros, tais como workshops, sessões de brainstorming, grupos de discussão, formações e muito mais.

Ajude-nos a criar o Outpost, porque somos esforçados, entusiastas e sonhadores. Ao apoiar Outpost estará a apoiar a comunidade e a comunidade é algo mais do que negócios.

Uso do capital

Dos recursos captados, vamos abrir o 1º Outpost em Vila do Conde (bem próximo da Póvoa de Varzim) com parque de estacionamento, estação de metro a menos de 200m, CTT e bancos a 500m.

Marketing: iremos investir uma parte em marketing internacional e captar projetos para o Outpost e toda a sua rede de Talento.

Aqui está uma lista do algumas coisas que necessitamos desde já:

  • Aluguer do primeiro mês
  • Ativar internet de alta velocidade
  • Impressora laser de grupo
  • Mesas para escritórios privados
  • Ilhas para escritorio
  • 1 projetor
  • Prateleiras / armários
  • Frigorifico
  • Máquina café

Para os escritórios virtuais identificamos alguns potenciais clientes:

Apresentações e receções:

Pequenas empresas ou profissionais independentes com necessidade de receber clientes num espaço profissional.

Trabalhadores independentes que trabalham a partir de casa:

Estes trabalhadores querem sair do seu ambiente familiar e integrar um ambiente de trabalho profissional. Também pretendem conhecer pessoas com interesses semelhantes.

Basecampers:

Trabalhadores que precisem de ter um local de trabalho localizado no centro da sua base de operações um local entre reuniões, clientes, fornecedores e a sua casa;

Networkers

São trabalhadores que usam o “Outpost” para criar ligações de negócio com o intuito de fazer crescer o seu próprio negócio.

Poupados

São pessoas ou empresas que estão à procura de economizar dinheiro fechando o seu escritório mas que têm a necessidade de ter um espaço onde possam ter reuniões e um local para receber os seus clientes.

Startups

Startups e empresas e fase inicial que necessitam de um escritório económico durante o seu processo de crescimento

Virtual

Para quem pretende continuar em casa iremos também oferecer os serviços de escritório virtual: gestão de correio, endereço comercial, atendimento telefónico, escritório virtual.



Introduction

Do you think cafes, service stations, hotel receptions are the right place for meetings? Can you separate your work time from your recreation time? Can you grow and get new customers at a satisfying pace? These are some of the problems you encounter while working from home.

The Outpost is intended as a networking site, meeting room in Vila do Conde for businesses and self-employed in the area of ​​new technologies. Designed for small businesses and professionals aim to offer a luxurious and professional space with complimentary Wifi, drinks, tea and coffee. Our team has two professionals related to international trade, which will help the network talent Outpost to capture new business opportunities.

Our goal is simple: to make our members and their businesses more successful providing a workspace and quality of networking without its high costs. We intend to be a great international team. We will present the Outpost internationally as a team full of talent willing to offer their services.

We want bright, successful, inspired members at the Outpost to inspire people around them. We want all types of IT professionals with any degree of education because every project has the need for every IT worker. Outpost is not only an office but a place where they can share ideas and projects. In the evening we want everyone to leave the Outpost inspired and happy.

The Outpost will setup numerous events to help entrepreneurs and to connect with potential clients. Workshops, brainstorming sessions, discussion groups, trainings and much more.

Help us create the Outpost because we are hardworking, enthusiastic and dreamy. By supporting Outpost will be to support the community and the community is more than just business.

Capital use

Of the funds raised, we will open the 1st Outpost in Vila do Conde (right next to Povoa de Varzim) with parking, metro station less than 200m, CTT and banks at 500m.

Marketing: we will invest a part in international marketing and attracting projects to the Outpost and its entire network of talent.

Here is a list of some things that we need right now:

• the first month of tental

• Enable high-speed Internet

• Group Laser Printer

• Tables for private offices

• 1 projector

• Shelves / cabinets

• Fridge

• Coffee

For the Outpost  we identified some potential customers:

Presentations and receptions:

Small businesses or independent professionals need to receive customers in a professional space.

Self-employed working from home:

These workers want to leave their familiar environment and integrate a professional work environment. Also intend to meet people with similar interests.

Basecampers:

Workers need to have a workplace located in the center of their base of operations a place between meetings, customers, suppliers and your home;

Networkers

They are workers who use the "Outpost" to create business links in order to grow your own business.

Thrifty

These are people or companies who are looking to save money by closing your office but who have the need to have a space where they can have meetings and a place to welcome guests.

Startups

Startups and early stage companies and in need of an economic office during their growth process

Virtual

For those who want to continue at home we will also offer virtual office services: mail management, business address, telephone answering, virtual office.

story:
Three years ago, we were a 15-year-old boy and his dad standing in the back room of a hardware store.  

We had a dream of opening a bike shop. Honestly we didn't think it was possible. But thanks to Indiegogo and many of you who are reading this now, we raised $3,660 in eight days. Thank you!!!

Local newspapers wrote stories about it (click here for an example). UNC did a short film about us (see "World of Bikes" embedded in this fundraiser). We got great reviews on Yelp and Google, and over 500 likes on Facebook! 


Today we are a real, legit, locally-owned bicycle repair shop.

In three years we have served over 500 customers, repaired and renewed almost a thousand bicycles including an 1800s penny farthing, a unicycle, a bunch of strollers, an Elf, and a few tricycles, too.  People come in all the time with all sorts of different requests and needs. We've even repaired cartwheels for some of our local farmers. ALSO, last summer, three neighborhood boys started coming in almost every day to help out, work on their own bikes, learn the trade.

So we've grown, expanding to a second room. We recently got a Macbook Pro and Quickbooks 2015 to keep track of everything. 


Next, we want to expand to retail.

And we need to do it before some chain store swoops in and beats us to it.  We want to be THE SHOP that serves Hillsborough with new bikes and accessories as well as continuing to keep our customers' bikes in good nick. 

This expansion will take two phases of growth, but we think we can do them relatively quickly. Phase one includes four things. . . 

  1. Expand our space by 300 sq. ft. ($2800) occupying the room between where we are now and the room with the windowfront.
  2. Buy a used pickup truck ($4500), 90's Nissan or Toyota, because we are constantly moving bikes, parts, stuff, etc.  Constantly.
  3. Hire a business consultant ($2000) to help us look at REAL numbers and make a REAL business plan, locate investor sources, so we can make a beautiful store with a manageable inventory.
It's vital for us to get this current phase of growth completed by mid summer so we can explore planning and funding our retail store.  This is the bridge, and we hope you'll be kind enough to support it and to share it with others. 
We've made good on our initial fundraiser.  We promise to make good on this one, too!

story:
Short Summary

Hey there, my name is Jon Hayes and I and the owner of UpDrop Farms LLC, an indoor hydroponic vertical farm.  I have always loved building things and designing systems for different tasks, and a few years ago I discovered my love for gardening.  There's just something about the process of growing a plant from nothing that is just fascinating to me.   I really enjoy using the soil, nutrients, and the sun to create fresh food for myself and the people I know.  But then I decided to take it one step further when winter came along and shut down my gardening.  A friend and I built a passive solar greenhouse in my backyard and I took everything inside to play with hydroponics, or the growing of plants without soil.  With hydroponics and controlling the environment, my role as the grower was even more important to the plants than with traditional gardening. The less nature you have involved, the more systematic and precise I am allowed to be so that I can grow the plants in the best way possible, and this is where the business idea originated.

What I Need & What You Get

I am currently looking to scale this business to a size that can handle farmer's markets, home delivery, monthly subscriptions, and restaurants, with wholesale being down the road.  I plan to start production flat in greenhouses, and moving to the vertical indoor locations as business grows.

With this Indiegogo campaign I will be able to hit the ground running with 3 greenhouses in different locations.  Each will be around 1000 sq ft and in different parts of Louisville so that delivery and pickup can be just minutes from production.  I already have one up and running, but needs hydroponics inside.  The other two I plan to buy used frames, put new plastic and end walls, and fill with hydroponic equipment as well.  By doing all the labor myself I will save a lot of the construction costs.  With about $7,000 of my own funds I have already built an experimental passive solar greenhouse in my backyard with my vertical rack system inside, and have purchased the hydroponic channels for all three greenhouses, totaling around 4,500 plant sites.
What I still need is the money for:
Frames for greenhouses: $3,000
End walls, fans, plastic, and ground cover: $3,000
Nutrient dosers, drains, and reservoirs: $4,000
Any amount we go over the goal will go directly into these locations, or be used to start towards the indoor location.  The more that's raised, the quicker I can scale, which in turn means the more I can grow!

The Impact

I would like for you to fund this project because of the limitless possibility this technology has in our community today and for the future.  With the exponential growth of the human population, traditional farming will need support with an infrastructure of hyper local micro farms so we can get fresh food to everyone.  This is especially important in places that are food deserts, or urban areas that are heavily populated, but have no access to fresh food.  These systems can go anywhere and be operated by trained people very quickly.  I am starting small, and plan to grow with demand as it reaches my business.  We have the information at hand that proves demand for fresh, local produce is real and growing rapidly.  This business solves many of the issues people have which causes them to currently not buy local: seasonal changes, not enough supply, or lack of consistency, which is important to consumers and businesses alike.  I don't want to think of buying local as doing the right thing to make you feel good, I want it to be the best decision from a business perspective.

Risks & Challenges

There are always risks when it comes to starting a new venture, but I have thoroughly tested this idea with many people I know and people I don't.  I believe that starting small in a couple of greenhouses and then moving to a larger centralized location lowers any kind of risk and keeps my upfront costs extremely low, without sacrificing production.
I know there are other businesses similar to mine out there but they won't be able to have the multiple, hyper-local locations like I will.  I want people to be able to walk down the street for fresh food any time of year and it be available to them.  The market size for fresh produce has more than enough room for a new player like myself and I am excited to get in the mix.
I take this venture very seriously and haven't been more passionate about anything else in my life.  I've always been using my array of skills and abilities to do things for others but this is by far my most impactful.  Getting fresh food to people and they know where it comes from is extremely satisfying to me and I would love to do it for a very long time.

Other Ways You Can Help

So what can you do even if you don't contribute?  Get the word out, check out my Facebook page, share the website, and just tell anyone know who wants to know where their food comes from to talk to me!  As soon as people know about what I'm doing, they will see the potential and hopefully want to bring this idea to a reality as well.

story:
Verdant Ground

Verdant Ground Organic Garden Co-op is a collection of members that garden together and share in the harvest. For 40 years, Shirley has lived on these 70 acres of land near the Grand Traverse Bay.  Sue joined her in 2001 and together, they founded Verdant Ground Organic Garden Co-op in 2005.

Shirley and Sue are the caretakers of this land and have built a beautiful life, living close to the earth and frequently hosting gatherings and growing organic food.  They both maintain full time occupations, off the land, to support the growth of and their vision for bringing Verdant Ground to its full potential.

The Vision - from Shirley & Sue

The 45th parallel, where we live here in Northern Michigan, is a vacation destination and we plan to renovate our small cottage, that overlooks the gardens, into a seasonal rental. We are confident that we can generate the income we need to further our goal once the cottage is fully upgraded. We intend to do this with our knowledge, skills, ingenuity and community labor.

Your contributions will buy the materials:

·  1st phase : external renovations - $8,000

o  New roof

o  Complete the cedar siding

o  Re-build deck/porch

o  New skirting around perimeter

o  New window screens

·  2nd phase : internal renovations - $6,000

o  Renovate kitchen

o  Replace shower unit

o  Renovate water system

You may be wondering how we are going to pull this off for only $14,000.  We re-use, recycle, and there will be no expenses for labor because we will provide that with our own blood, sweat and tears.

The creation of the cottage business will enable Sue and Shirley to continue to realize their goals. The projects and events that happen on this land both nourish and sustain those who participate.

Thank you so much for being a part of making this dream a reality!

Shirley and Sue are the caretakers of this land
and have built a beautiful life, living close to the earth and frequently
hosting gatherings and growing organic food.  They both maintain full time
occupations, off the land, to support the growth of and their vision for
bringing Verdant Ground to its full potential.
The Vision - from Shirley & Sue
The 45th parallel, where we live here in
Northern Michigan, is a vacation destination and we plan to renovate our small
cottage, that overlooks the gardens, into a seasonal rental. We are confident
that we can generate the income we need to further our goal once the cottage is
fully upgraded. We intend to do this with our knowledge, skills, ingenuity and
community labor. 
Your contributions will buy the materials:
· 
1st
phase : external renovations - $8,000
o 
New
roof
o 
Complete
the cedar siding
o 
Re-build
deck/porch
o 
New
skirting around perimeter
o 
New
window screens
· 
2nd
phase : internal renovations - $6,000
o 
Renovate
kitchen
o 
Replace
shower unit
o 
Renovate
water system
You may be
wondering how we are going to pull this off for only $14,000.  We re-use, recycle, and there will be no
expenses for labor because we will provide that with our own blood, sweat and
tears.
The creation
of the cottage business will enable Sue and Shirley to continue to realize
their goals. The projects and events that happen on this land both nourish and
sustain those who participate.
Thank you so
much for being a part of making this dream a reality!

story:
I was born to care for others!

But I didn't always know that...
You see, I grew up in Detroit, Michigan, the daughter of a single mom who earned her living as a school teacher.  My mom always encouraged me to study hard, earn good grades, and work hard so that I could get a good job.  So, that's what I did.  I earned an appointment to West Point, and graduated as a Second Lieutenant in 1987.
I spent five years in the Army, attaining the rank of Captain before resigning my commission in 1993 to start a new life and family with my husband Tim, also a West Point grad.  I became pregnant with our first child, Marcus, and started my career as a pharmaceutical sales rep.  Life was great!  Then it wasn't.
My precious son Marcus was born with cerebral palsy, which meant gross developmental delays, and a lifetime of medical intervention and therapy.
In 2000, my husband died after an 18 month long battle with Non-Hodgkins lymphoma., My mom passed away the following year.  After regrouping, I decided to earn my MBA in order to accelerate my career.  I thought making more money was the best way to care for my children Marcus, and his little sister, Mariah.
When Marcus passed away after a prolonged illness after surgery in 2007, all the money in the world couldn't have healed the gaping hole in my heart. The search for meaning resumed but I still wasn't quite sure where I was being led.
Like before, I got back on the corporate path and resumed my career in account management.  Once again, life was great! Then it wasn't. In Feb. of 2013 our home burned to the ground, with Mariah and I losing almost everything we owned, including four pets - Sandy, Leo, Lily and Sterling.  We were devastated but determined to move forward, just had we had many times before.
We began again, I went back to work, but I wanted more.  The longing in my heart to find meaning tugged at me until I finally left my corporate job in 2014 and began working as a nanny and pet sitter.  My love of children and animals has driven me for the past year and a half.  I am content and satisfied knowing that I am making a real difference in the lives of those I care for - both the humans and fur babies. People I touch are able to have a better quality of life knowing that their children, or pets are in my loving care.
At this point in my life's journey, I am starting my own pet sitting business, which will also include house sitting, personal errands, and other concierge services.  I will do what I have been designed to do - provide hands on care and support to others, while using my business talents to create a successful life for myself and my daughter Mariah, now a freshman at Southern University in Dallas.  I am determined to be a successful businesswoman as well as a good human being to be an example for her life and that of others.

I am seeking to raise $3000 for startup costs for a pet sitting business.  This will cover:

LLC formation - $350

Attorney fees - $200

Website development - $600

Bonding and insurance - $550

Marketing materials - $200

Supplies - $200

Pet First Aid - $130

Professional Membership Fee - $140

Professional Certification - $600

The remainder will help fund our business checking account and first month operating costs.  In the pet sitting industry, payment is made upon completion of services.

Other Ways You Can Help

I know that not everyone can contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Please consider sharing my campaign with your networks, perhaps there is someone you may know who would be interested in helping me get launched! (Be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools!)
  • As you are led, say a prayer (or send good thoughts) for me, my new partner, and our new business

Please accept my heartfelt appreciation for your help!

story:
I built a robot to talk to telemarketers! And I will soon provide it to the USA for an extremely reasonable cost of $6 per year. 

But I need your help to fund my voyage through the murky waters of Telecommunications Law!

I was getting so many telemarketer calls at home that I built a robot to talk to them. It has been so effective at wasting telemarketer time, that I am offering the service to protect anyone's phone in the USA at only $6/year! Several examples of the robot in glorious action are on my YouTube channel at https://www.youtube.com/channel/UC3OxCWLEmoIhNMm-hnvBm9Q

Interesting facts about the telecommunications industry:

  • It has been around for 140 years. 
  • The Federal Communications Commission was created (in part) to regulate it, starting with AT&T and its "natural monopoly".
  • Every state has a Utilities Commission (or equivalent) to regulate it.
  • There are many law offices devoted to Telecommunications law. 
  • All levels of government have created laws affecting it.
Despite all of the above, I am doing something that has never been tested in court. I am providing a bot to speak with telemarketers to waste their time. This bot protects your home and mobile telephones by consuming the most precious resource in the unsolicited telemarketer industry - human agents.

Most unsolicited telemarketers are breaking the law. But a small percentage are barley skirting the borders of legality. This small group of "legal" unsolicited telemarketers have deep pockets and lots of lawyers. I fully expect this industry to come crashing down upon my head. I am just a normal guy who works on telephones and do not have the legal resources to defend myself from frivolous lawsuits designed to stop this telemarketer bot.

The Jolly Roger Telephone bot protects your home or mobile phone by engaging with scammer telemarketers. Some figure out it's a robot and will actively work to get your number removed from their system. This is the only way I have found to actually get a telemarketer to stop calling you. It's in THEIR best interest to stop calling your bot. And if they don't, it's extremely satisfying to hear a recording of these guys going round-and-round with this bot.

In no particular order, Here are some featured articles about the way this bot protects consumers from unsolicited telemarketers:

  • Gizmodo http://gizmodo.com/todays-hero-made-an-ai-that-annoys-telemarketers-for-as-1756344562 
  • NPR's All Things Considered http://www.npr.org/2016/02/25/468149405/jolly-roger-telephone-company-uses-software-to-entrap-telemarketers
  • The New York Times http://www.nytimes.com/2016/02/25/fashion/a-robot-that-has-fun-at-telemarketers-expense.html?_r=0
  • The San Francisco Chronicle http://www.sfchronicle.com/business/article/Computer-program-turns-the-tables-on-telemarketers-6847774.php?t=f5b072421b7d4f3860&cmpid=email-premium
  • Consumer's Union (Consumer Reports) http://consumersunion.org/campaign-updates/end-robocalls-speaks-to-the-jolly-roger-telephone-company/
  • Fortune http://fortune.com/2016/02/24/robot-telemarketers-jolly-roger/
  • Computerworld http://www.computerworld.com/article/3038879/personal-technology/have-you-aggravated-a-telemarketer-today.html
  • CBC News http://www.cbc.ca/news/canada/calgary/robot-tricks-telemarketers-1.3469906
  • Metro.co.uk http://metro.co.uk/2016/02/03/this-absolute-champ-made-an-ai-just-to-waste-cold-callers-time-by-keeping-them-on-the-phone-5659709/
  • Sydney Morning Herald http://www.smh.com.au/technology/technology-news/phone-robot-keeps-annoying-telemarketers-talking-for-as-long-as-possible-20160201-gmj83u.html
  • Radio New Zealand http://www.radionz.co.nz/national/programmes/thiswayup/audio/201788232/fighting-the-telemarketers
  • Many radio interviews both in the USA and internationally including BBC World!
  • Many international sites, and publications, and TV channels
  • Search for news about "Jolly Roger Telephone" and you will see the global interest in this service.

This campaign is for a legal defense fund that will provide resources to fight the unsolicited telemarketing industry as they use their deep pockets to try to stop me.

story:
Our Story

I have lived in Crown Heights in Brooklyn for three years now and I truly love this neighborhood.  It's a vibrant mix of West Indian and Jewish populations and is now one of the major centers, for better or worse, of the gentrificaiton trend in New York.  With this you get trendy stores and new restaurants but also higher rents and long term residents being forced from their homes.  A productive micro urban farm is a small but impactful step whereby we can provide low cost organic produce to the community and lessen the financial burden of eating healthy.  It is our goal to grow as much food as possible in this small space, and to give away as much of that food as possible to low income residents in the area for low to no cost.

My name is Garrison and my partner in this endeavor is Alvin.  

I have been growing food my entire life and spent two years in Senegal as a Sustainable Agriculture volunteer in the Peace Corps.  Alvin is a long term resident of the neighborhood who has been gardening here for many years.  We have the experience and the connections in the area to make this a success.  There's just one problem...

THE SOIL IS FULL OF LEAD

After growing a small garden together in the summer of 2015 we decided to do some testing on the soil to check the situation.  CUNY Brooklyn did the test, which revealed extremely high levels of lead.  Approximately 900ppm.   The space is wonderful, the community is in need of this resource, but the soil is toxic.  Our only option is to invest in constructing substantial raised beds and bring in completely new organic soil.  

Our Plan!

  • We will build twenty 3x10ft raised beds on two fenced in spaces on Union St. This will provide 600 square feet of growing space which we will intensively cultivate to grow substantial amounts of organic food.  
  • We will hold a weekly market where the community can have access to this produce.
  • We will hold classes at the garden in order to teach the basic principles of urban gardening and organic agriculture.  
Funds will be used to purchase wood for the raised beds and soil to fill them.  We are investing personal funds for all garden equipment and the initial stock of seeds. We will save seeds and maintain soil fertility through composting and crop rotation so there should be no future need for financial input. We hope to become a self sustaining resource for the community.  

$4,000 sounds like a lot of money for a small micro farm, but this space can be extremely productive.  Our initial plan for the beds has the potential to yield over 700lbs of produce:

Tomatoes: 180lbs
Peas: 20lbs
Beans: 20lbs
Leeks/Onions 60lbs
Peppers: 40lbs
Butternut Squash: 50lbs
Sweet Potatoes: 35lbs
Potatoes: 35lbs
Beats/Radishes: 70lbs
Eggplant: 35lbs
Carrots: 70lbs
Celery: 25lbs
Strawberries: 25lbs
Greens: 40lbs

Cost Per lb: $5.67

That doesn't include yields over the course of the entire season, or multiple crops of fast growing varieties.  In one season we could justify the entire cost and provide more than $4,000 of value for the community.  


Risks & Challenges

Agriculture is always a risky endeavor, especially small scale urban agriculture.  It is entirely possible that we could lose crops to disease or pests, or simple theft from people in the area.  Alvin and I are both experienced gardeners though and have dealt with these challenges before.  The community is also extremely supportive and has a strong pride in maintaining its local resources.  There are many iconic small businesses in the area which have become positive sources for jobs and local products.  We hope to join the ranks of these valuable entrepreneurs and earn our place here as well.  

How You Can Help!

We would value ANY donnation you can make.  Every dollar counts!  If you can't contribute please share our campaign with family and friends.  

Alvin and I are passionate about creating a resource for the community.  There is a real need here for quality organic food and as the neighborhood changes and people are increasingly forced from their homes due to rising cost of living, this is a small way that we can fight for social justice and show respect to our neighbors.

story:
Our School, Your School 

Martial arts and meditation can change lives. Helping regular people to foster a sense of strength, tranquility and self confidence. 

Since the beginning it has been our goal to provide training to anyone and everyone with the desire to study and grow through the martial arts. We have done our best to never turn away a student because they couldn't pay. Instead, we have tried to offer work trade and scholarships whenever possible. Our instructors have offered free seminars and workshops throughout the north east, dedicated simply to the love of our art. 


Draining Wave, Piercing Wind 


We study the art of Nagasu Nami, or "Draining Wave". Our concentration is on functional technique usable by anyone, regardless of size or stature. With it's roots in Aikido and Chinese Kung Fu, Nagasu as an art focuses on inner strength and development. Each of our classes end with a dedication to our personal sense of Mercy, Compassion and Our Highest Selves. 

We strive to teach to each and every student, be they large or small, experienced or green, in shape or not... We believe that the art itself is made whole by the students involved. 

It is important to emphasize the personal and subjective quality of the martial arts, understanding that the "art" portion comes from a practitioner's deeply personal relationship with their own bodies and minds. By refining our relationship with ourselves, every other interaction in our lives can improve. By becoming stronger inside, we see wonderful changes outside. 

The Rope Dart 


Along with self defense and meditation, we teach the Rope Dart. Our art focuses deeply on the insights and strengths that can be attained through studying this graceful and powerful weapon. Study of the Rope Dart requires a sense of fluidity and flow. To work with the Rope Dart, you must become one with it in every moment. It's movement resembling the wind, or the ebb and flow of the tides. 

 As a member of the Rope Dart Academy network of schools, we are dedicated to helping to revive the practice of this beautiful, ancient and incredibly fun weapon form!


What We Need & What You Get

From the beginning this school has been built from the grass roots up. We have built a modest yet dedicated body of students, only ever advertising via word of mouth. Together we have learned to find great strength and grace with minimal training equipment and resources. We have grown simply by our great reputation and the work of our students and teachers to spread the word.

Our root is strong and it is now time for us to grow. We desperately need new equipment such as: Kick Pads, Focus Mitts, Training Rope Darts, Crash Pads/Gym Mats. 

We also need to be able to market and advertise this school locally. While we have grown well through word of mouth,  we have never had the funding to do any type of advertising. Choosing instead to spend available dollars on equipment and space in which to train. We need to be able to print business cards and fliers to grow, along with running a small ad campaign on Facebook and in local neighborhood news papers. 

It is our goal to rent our own place by this fall season. Currently we are teaching at JP Crossfit, the owner and staff of which have been endlessly good to us. However to expand we need to be able to have our own, rooted home. While raising the student body now and coming into the spring, we intend to continue to teach at JP Crossfit while also bringing some of our day classes into the Arnold Arboretum during the summer. This will allow us to expand our schedule and offer more training to more students. With a larger, stronger student body we will be able to rent a space in which we can continue to train at all hours throughout next winter and beyond. As the weather warms up we will be offering 11-14 class blocks per week! 


                                 Proposed Late Spring/Summer Schedule:

                              One Hour Classes of Empty Hand, Rope Dart and Qigong

                                               Sunday: 4:35pm, 5:35pm and 6:35pm

                                             Monday-Thursday: 6:35pm and 7:45pm


In exchange for your awesome support, we are offering varying levels of discounted memberships, private lessons and class drop in packs at an incredible discount. Because you are awesome and we not only want to say thank you, but also because we want to train with you: We have taken all of our available training packages and dropped the price way down only for this campaign!

Any of these training packages can be given as a gift, used by you or you can choose to sponsor a new or existing student in need. 

In a short period of time we have already proven that we can DO A LOT with very little. This campaign's boost is exactly what our school needs to be able to continue to take off. 

Here is how we intend to spend the money:

  • Focus Mitts, Kick Pads, Targets, Punching Bags and safe Sparring Gear
  • Crash Pads and Gym Mats
  • Training Rope Darts
  • Local Advertising, Fliers, Cards
  • Scholarship tuition for students struggling to pay
  • General Operations costs (rent etc.)

Picture Courtsey of Lindsay Lambert and WuDao Kung Fu and Tai Chi from a workshop that we did there. Kids seem to love rope darts!


The Impact

With this funding we will have the help that we need to really take off. We are confident that given a modest marketing budget and new training equipment we will be able to easily add to the size of our student body. With a larger body of members, we can begin to look at getting our own studio this coming fall. Your contribution will help us solidify our presence in the community and continue to teach high quality self defense and movement art classes. 


Other Ways You Can Help

If you want to help but can't contribute financially please share this page with as many people as you possibly can! Remember we are offering online lessons so people from anywhere can take advantage of some of these perks. 



Our deepest thanks to 

Photography: Bryan Adams, Lindsay Lambert

Videography: Mark Wise, Imagewise 

Ropedarts.com and the whole RDA Crew

JP Crossfit and all their caring support

YOU!
story_txt:
Our School, Your School 
Martial arts and meditation can change lives. Helping regular people to foster a sense of strength, tranquility and self confidence. 

Since the beginning it has been our goal to provide training to anyone and everyone with the desire to study and grow through the martial arts. We have done our best to never turn away a student because they couldn't pay. Instead, we have tried to offer work trade and scholarships whenever possible. Our instructors have offered free seminars and workshops throughout the north east, dedicated simply to the love of our art. 


Draining Wave, Piercing Wind 




We study the art of Nagasu Nami, or "Draining Wave". Our concentration is on functional technique usable by anyone, regardless of size or stature. With it's roots in Aikido and Chinese Kung Fu, Nagasu as an art focuses on inner strength and development. Each of our classes end with a dedication to our personal sense of Mercy, Compassion and Our Highest Selves. 
We strive to teach to each and every student, be they large or small, experienced or green, in shape or not... We believe that the art itself is made whole by the students involved. 


It is important to emphasize the personal and subjective quality of the martial arts, understanding that the "art" portion comes from a practitioner's deeply personal relationship with their own bodies and minds. By refining our relationship with ourselves, every other interaction in our lives can improve. By becoming stronger inside, we see wonderful changes outside. 

The Rope Dart 




Along with self defense and meditation, we teach the Rope Dart. Our art focuses deeply on the insights and strengths that can be attained through studying this graceful and powerful weapon. Study of the Rope Dart requires a sense of fluidity and flow. To work with the Rope Dart, you must become one with it in every moment. It's movement resembling the wind, or the ebb and flow of the tides. 
 As a member of the Rope Dart Academy network of schools, we are dedicated to helping to revive the practice of this beautiful, ancient and incredibly fun weapon form!



   What We Need & What You Get From the beginning this school has been built from the grass roots up. We have built a modest yet dedicated body of students, only ever advertising via word of mouth. Together we have learned to find great strength and grace with minimal training equipment and resources. We have grown simply by our great reputation and the work of our students and teachers to spread the word.
Our root is strong and it is now time for us to grow. We desperately need new equipment such as: Kick Pads, Focus Mitts, Training Rope Darts, Crash Pads/Gym Mats. 
We also need to be able to market and advertise this school locally. While we have grown well through word of mouth,  we have never had the funding to do any type of advertising. Choosing instead to spend available dollars on equipment and space in which to train. We need to be able to print business cards and fliers to grow, along with running a small ad campaign on Facebook and in local neighborhood news papers. 
It is our goal to rent our own place by this fall season. Currently we are teaching at JP Crossfit, the owner and staff of which have been endlessly good to us. However to expand we need to be able to have our own, rooted home. While raising the student body now and coming into the spring, we intend to continue to teach at JP Crossfit while also bringing some of our day classes into the Arnold Arboretum during the summer. This will allow us to expand our schedule and offer more training to more students. With a larger, stronger student body we will be able to rent a space in which we can continue to train at all hours throughout next winter and beyond. As the weather warms up we will be offering 11-14 class blocks per week! 

                                 Proposed Late Spring/Summer Schedule:
                              One Hour Classes of Empty Hand, Rope Dart and Qigong
                                               Sunday: 4:35pm, 5:35pm and 6:35pm
                                             Monday-Thursday: 6:35pm and 7:45pm

In exchange for your awesome support, we are offering varying levels of discounted memberships, private lessons and class drop in packs at an incredible discount. Because you are awesome and we not only want to say thank you, but also because we want to train with you: We have taken all of our available training packages and dropped the price way down only for this campaign!
Any of these training packages can be given as a gift, used by you or you can choose to sponsor a new or existing student in need. 
In a short period of time we have already proven that we can DO A LOT with very little. This campaign's boost is exactly what our school needs to be able to continue to take off. 
Here is how we intend to spend the money:  Focus Mitts, Kick Pads, Targets, Punching Bags and safe Sparring Gear
Crash Pads and Gym Mats
Training Rope Darts
Local Advertising, Fliers, Cards
Scholarship tuition for students struggling to pay
General Operations costs (rent etc.)    

Picture Courtsey of Lindsay Lambert and WuDao Kung Fu and Tai Chi from a workshop that we did there. Kids seem to love rope darts!

The Impact
With this funding we will have the help that we need to really take off. We are confident that given a modest marketing budget and new training equipment we will be able to easily add to the size of our student body. With a larger body of members, we can begin to look at getting our own studio this coming fall. Your contribution will help us solidify our presence in the community and continue to teach high quality self defense and movement art classes. 

    Other Ways You Can Help If you want to help but can't contribute financially please share this page with as many people as you possibly can! Remember we are offering online lessons so people from anywhere can take advantage of some of these perks. 


Our deepest thanks to 
Photography: Bryan Adams, Lindsay Lambert
Videography: Mark Wise, Imagewise 
Ropedarts.com and the whole RDA Crew
JP Crossfit and all their caring support
YOU!

story:
It's not a "get out of jail free" card

....but it could be.

Social media, mass media and the flood of controversy surrounding police brutality, law enforcement scandal, the thankless job of being a cop, etc. is polluting our communities.

It's time for POSITIVE ACTION.

The violence, mistrust and flames that are being fanned that is clearly creating more division between the cops and their community. 

Not since the civil rights movement has there been more controversy surrounding racism, law enforcement and the widening gap of mistrust. 

Unfortunately, bad news always travels faster and is shared more often than the good deeds that cops are doing. Which brought us to a radical and time-tested solution. More about that in a minute...

Randy Sutton is a retired law enforcement officer, best selling author, sought after speaker and advisor. In past few months, like all of us, he watched the country become more divided as cops and citizens were both being wrongfully accused and even killed.

While most people shake their head, voice an opinion or share a politically edited video on Facebook, Randy knew the truth...The propaganda enflaming this issue is not only ineffective, but the videos, memes and reports are often edited to advance a political agenda & incite more distrust, fear and violence.

No matter which "side" you are on, there are powerful forces pushing our country into the direction of fear and illusion...the illusion that all police are out to "get us" or are that all police jack booted thugs with an axe to grind.

The negative propaganda has to stop.

Angel Shields does not choose between cops and victims....in the spirit of all great leaders and movements, the foundation of Angel Shields is unity.

The spirit, intent and actionable items supporting Angel Shields is built on a foundation of truth, fairness, honor and community.

It's Time to Unite the People and Their Police

This campaign is more than a membership card that cops nationwide will soon recognize and support. A citizen's membership will do more than help send a cop's kid to college or pay for uninsured medical expenses.

Angel shields will rebuild our country.

This is a grass roots effort and your support will do more than simply give you a "Get out of jail free" card (It's not designed for that). What your membership WILL do, however, is let law enforcement know you are one of the good guys...a citizen who cares.

What We Need & What You Get

Basic membership will give you a bumper sticker, window sticker and membership card. Recognized by law enforcement, you'll be known as a supporter of the truth, fairness, honor and community. (It may even get you out of a speeding ticket! .... no guarantees though!)

Basic membership ($10) will do the following:

  • Community education and outreach programs
  • A general fund to help cops with uninsured medical expenses
  • A local fund so cops can give out gift cards to homeless or people in need
Premium membership ($97) will give you the above benefits PLUS you'll get access to our private Facebook community and discounts on all products, upgrades, services, firearm training, apparel and more by Angel Shields.
VIP membership ($497) will give you the above benefits PLUS you'll be featured as a contributor for our "Police Plus" program where we help cops with emergency funds. You will be a co-sponsor of local events (great PR for you or your company) and your support will be showcased on FOX, ABC, NBC and other news channels.
Patron membership ($997) will give you the above benefits PLUS you'll be recognized locally by Angel Shields and be invited to participating precincts. You can sponsor group events, defense training and you will get a "Platinum" badge honoring your commitment to peace, honor and service. In addition, patrons will get "Back stage" access to events, community and political contacts.


BONUS: You'll be invited to a group video chat with Angel Shields founder, Randy Sutton.

If we fall short of our crowdfunding goal, all funds will continue to support the Angel Shields initiative. But, with your support, we expect to meet and exceed our funding goals.

The Impact

Imagine a world where the people...ALL of the people in ANY community look at their police as faithful servants-not bullies. It's not a dream, it's our unyielding goal.

Imagine a country where the police...ALL of the police in ANY community work with their citizens and encourage community involvement, trust and service above self.

We know this all may sound a bit "woo-woo", but big ideas always start that way. Dr. Marin Luther King said it and was the seed that motivated a nation. Gandhi believed in freedom for his nation and brought down the British empire with his grass roots movement.

You don't have to be a historical figure or die for this cause...you simply have to believe in peace more than violence.

You can keep nodding or shake your head no matter which side you fall on. But if you want to see our nation become one of peace and trust, it's time to be the change you want to see.

It's time to stop thinking and start doing.

...It's time for Angel Shields

Risks & Challenges

A movement to create peace is not without challenges. There are entire industries and political powers that feed off the fear, violence and turmoil that this issue has become.

Don't feed the fear.

Stop believing the meme's you see on the internet.

Start taking positive, community-based action to do what you KNOW is the right thing to do. It's time to click on a reward on the right and become part of the solution.

The only risk we face is apathy.

Invest a few dollars and 2 minutes to be part of something good and great.

Join Angel Shields today.

Other Ways You Can Help

Basic membership is only $10. Annual VIP membership is less than a nice dinner out. Even a $2 or $5 donation will move the project and our country closer to peace, safety and most importantly... a new community of trust.

story:
Our first campaign has ended but Part 2 is here , please follow this new link 

https://igg.me/at/engineershouse/


The Engineer's House needs restoring - and then we can all use it!

The Cambridge Museum of Technology is the old Pumping Station for the City of Cambridge - the Engineer's House was built in 1898 to house the engineer who worked at the Pumping Station.  It was taken back by the council in 1970 and now unfortunately, it's fallen into disrepair and been vandalised.  The good news is that the Cambridge City Council, rather than sell it off to private investors, has decided to lease it to the Cambridge Museum of Technology, bringing the whole site back together. The catch is that we have to restore the House, and we need money and volunteers to do that.

When it's restored, it'll be part of the Museum, which is going through a major redevelopment.  As part of the Museum, the House will be open to the public and will provide meeting space, an archive/library, a space for education and  outreach to the people of Cambridge via exhibits and talks by local engineering companies and educational institutions.  That's a lot better than luxury flats!

What We Need

The house needs about £120K worth of work and we are involved in different kinds of fundraising and are also getting volunteers to help us.  On Indiegogo, we are looking for people to sponsor different repairs.  Can you fund part of a 

  • A new window? 
  • A new door? 
  • Two hours of plastering work and materials? 
  • More? Opt for 'Mega Help' - there are some good perks

A public asset, instead of a private good

The Cambridge City Council has been bold in choosing to lease this, rather than sell it and we should grab the opportunity to save the House.

The Museum Trustees provide oversight and guidance for the project, which is a real chance for community involvement and activism.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you can't give cash, can you give time?  Please let us know if you have skills in restoring buildings or in fundraising that could help us meet our goals.

    Our registered charity no. is 1156685

story:
...........................................................................................................................
  • Whаt іѕ unіԛuе аbоut Myfoodisgood®? The fооd уоu rесеіvе іѕ always fresh and never frozen.

  • One оf thе mаіn rеаѕоnѕ fоr uѕіng our fооd bоx dеlіvеrу ѕеrvісе іѕ that уоu gеt tо trу nеw chеf-іnѕріrеd recipes wіthоut paying a premium of ѕресіаltу fооdѕ аnd wasting time looking for uncommon ingredients.

  • Thеѕе ѕеrvісеѕ allow you to choose ѕеvеrаl mеаlѕ each wееk that best fit your lifestyle so you and your family can dесіdе what to try next.

How it works: 


The "You Cook" concept

  • Our ingredients are delivered to the comfort of your home and ready for you to prepare the next perfect home-cooked meal.

                                             

                                                        

The "We Cook concept:

  • All meals are prepared at our kitchen by our chef and delivered to your home ready to heat 'n eat.



Ready to try our chef-inspired recipes?


                                            

We have successfully created a program that solves a simple daily problem: what’s for dinner? 
This is the classic example of the mother of invention being necessity. With our flawlessly designed website and innovative solution we have simplified a process that is as essential as the meals we provide. We believe our dedication to quality will differentiate ourselves and make us something you are proud to have in your home.



“What’s for dinner?” is the age old question, but it is so important to feed your body the nutrition it needs to take on the long week ahead. But getting the fresh food to your table is not always an easy task. That is where we come in. 
Our meal delivery services gives you the nutrition you need in a seamless process. All you have to do is choose what you would like shipped - ready-to-cook or ready-to-ear - and when you want it ready. It's really that simple!


About Us

We are Thierry and Marie and we are here to tell you about “Myfoodisgood®”. 
As you can probably relate, getting dinner on the table every night is not always easy. And getting a delicious home-cooked meal is even tougher. You should be excited about the food you are eating and chances are it is nothing but a hassle. That is why I have created “Myfoodisgood®” and now anyone can get home cooked meals delivered to their house with ease. 
Enjoy cooking instead? Well we have something for you too! You have the option to buy the food cooked or ready-to-cook. So you can choose to cook yourself or have a ready-made meal. Either way you will have delicious food delivered to your home, ready for dinner. 

  Thierry ZANON President

Thierry grow up in Lyon, France, home to some of France's best restaurant. Following his firm's success in Europe, Thierry decided to hop over the Atlantic to seize new exciting project and to open a restaurant in Siesta Key.


  Marie BALDI Executive Chef

Marie is Executive Chef with a particular focus on promoting good cooking. Not only in terms of great flavors but in all-around meal quality. She is in fact passionate about health and nutrition, and she is a fervent proponent of fresh quality ingredients above all, bridging the gaps between tradition and innovation in the kitchen.

Our story is our team

Cook. Prep. Service. That's what we are all about.

Your generous funding will help us get things started in order to realize our concept. It will assist us with the cost of further development, manufacturing and production of the website. More importantly you get the chance to be one of the first users of the “Myfoodisgood®”. We will also use our funding to test our concept and make it better. 
We are committed to continuous improvement so we are always giving people the best possible solutions. We will also be using the funding to:

Myfoodisgood® needs pledging, but above all it needs your attention and interest! If you love this product as much as we do, please take a second to share this campaign on social media and help us spread the word and get things started.

If you aren't able to make a monetary donation but would like to contribute to the campaign mission, there are plenty of other ways to help!

Teach someone else about the need for change

At its core, this campaign is about helping people through the use of meal delivery services. If you're in a position to teach someone else how this service can help them - please do it! You are contributing to this campaign by passing on the awareness.

You can contribute your popularity by telling your friends and family about this campaign. The success of this campaign is directly correlated with the number of people who view this page. If you can increase that number, you are making a tangible contribution to the mission and we appreciate it very much :)

We feel so grateful to everyone who has taken the time to read out campaign and for those who contributed what they could to make a difference and helping us spread the word. 
We have spent the last few months working hard to bring our vision to life in this campaign and it was worth every minute, thanks to all our generous supporters. Please know your efforts - even the smallest - don’t go unnoticed. We will continue to keep you posted on what your donation helped us achieve. You are part of our Myfoodisgood® family - welcome!


For those of us who don't like making donations over the Internet, please feel free to contact us via email and we will provide you with a mailing address to send a check or money order. 
We will post your contribution on the campaign with your name and deliver the perks you choose. Myfoodisgood® is an online food delivery servce that provides fresh healthy meals to your doorstep. Our company is passionate with creating an unmatched solution that’s easy to use and enjoyable for your whole family. The business will be run based on our mission statement of providing a nutritious and delicious meal solutions to help people optimize their life and keep fresh. So far all of our feedback has been over the top, everyone from professionals “on-the-go” to busy moms are enjoying the many useful benefits of Myfoodisgood®. Together with our team we take our passion for innovation beyond our home made meals and in every decision we make. In our meal and menu development process, simplifying peoples lives always drives us at every stage. Simple meal options that can help people eat. 

About Us

What’s the difference between You Cook and We Cook? 

With We Cook you will receive a freshly-prepared meal by our chef ready to heat up and eat. With We Cook You cook", you will receive a box with all the fresh ingredients and step-by-step recipe.

Do you provide nutritional and calorie information?
Yes. However, the exact nutritional facts and calories will depend on how much of certain ingredients is added (salt, pepper, olive oil, sauces,etc.).

Where did you find your recipes?
We are a team of in-house chefs, headed by our Executive Chef Marie who has been in the restaurant and food nutrition industries for over 30 years. All recipes are tested to have the best nutrition and taste.

Where is the service available?
We offer a delivery in all US states, with the exception of Alaska and Hawaii. You will receive all of your order in an insulated box at home or at your office.  

Restrictions

This campaign and all Perks are only available for the Continental U.S..

We are the real deal! 

Myfoodisgood was born out of the vision of our Executive Chef and Thierry Zanon, both with years of experience in the industry.



 If you have thoughts or would like to discuss a collaboration or sponsorship, we would love to hear from you. Feel free to contact us at press@myfoodisgood.com
