If you love this product as much as we do, please take a second to share this campaign on social media and help us spread the word and get things started.If you aren't able to make a monetary donation but would like to contribute to the campaign mission, there are plenty of other ways to help!
Teach someone else about the need for change
At its core, this campaign is about helping people through the use of meal delivery services. If you're in a position to teach someone else how this service can help them - please do it! You are contributing to this campaign by passing on the awareness.

You can contribute your popularity by telling your friends and family about this campaign. The success of this campaign is directly correlated with the number of people who view this page. If you can increase that number, you are making a tangible contribution to the mission and we appreciate it very much :)

We feel so grateful to everyone who has taken the time to read out campaign and for those who contributed what they could to make a difference and helping us spread the word. We have spent the last few months working hard to bring our vision to life in this campaign and it was worth every minute, thanks to all our generous supporters. Please know your efforts - even the smallest - don’t go unnoticed. We will continue to keep you posted on what your donation helped us achieve. You are part of our Myfoodisgood® family - welcome!

For those of us who don't like making donations over the Internet, please feel free to contact us via email and we will provide you with a mailing address to send a check or money order. We will post your contribution on the campaign with your name and deliver the perks you choose. Myfoodisgood® is an online food delivery servce that provides fresh healthy meals to your doorstep. Our company is passionate with creating an unmatched solution that’s easy to use and enjoyable for your whole family. The business will be run based on our mission statement of providing a nutritious and delicious meal solutions to help people optimize their life and keep fresh. So far all of our feedback has been over the top, everyone from professionals “on-the-go” to busy moms are enjoying the many useful benefits of Myfoodisgood®. Together with our team we take our passion for innovation beyond our home made meals and in every decision we make. In our meal and menu development process, simplifying peoples lives always drives us at every stage. Simple meal options that can help people eat. 




About Us
What’s the difference between You Cook and We Cook? With We Cook you will receive a freshly-prepared meal by our chef ready to heat up and eat. With We Cook You cook", you will receive a box with all the fresh ingredients and step-by-step recipe. Do you provide nutritional and calorie information? Yes. However, the exact nutritional facts and calories will depend on how much of certain ingredients is added (salt, pepper, olive oil, sauces,etc.). Where did you find your recipes? We are a team of in-house chefs, headed by our Executive Chef Marie who has been in the restaurant and food nutrition industries for over 30 years.
All recipes are tested to have the best nutrition and taste.

Where is the service available?We offer a delivery in all US states, with the exception of Alaska and Hawaii. You will receive all of your order in an insulated box at home or at your office.  
RestrictionsThis campaign and all Perks are only available for the Continental U.S..We are the real deal! 

Myfoodisgood was born out of the vision of our Executive Chef and Thierry Zanon, both with years of experience in the industry.



If you have thoughts or would like to discuss a collaboration or sponsorship, we would love to hear from you. Feel free to contact us at press@myfoodisgood.com

story:
Who We Are:

Reconsidered Goods is a non profit creative reuse center located in Greensboro, North Carolina that will serve the surrounding Piedmont area. We will collect donated materials from local industries and personal donations that were headed to the landfill and reclaim them to a life of reuse. We will be a cultural retail entertainment location that promotes creativity, community, and environmental education.

What's the Plan?

We will be opening a retail location to be able to offer these materials to the public as inexpensive supplies to reuse and be creative with, rather than purchasing new.   Our facility will offer a retail store, workshop space, a maker's lab, gallery space, and a community room for artists to meet and create together.

$20,000

Our goal is raise $20,000 to launch this project. Or about 6 cents per person in Greensboro. Those pennies will go towards....

-Facilities and upgrades to be up to code
-Fees for non-profit status and incorporating
-Insurance
-Utilities
-Cash registers
-Misc supplies


Why you should help

When we are up and running at full capacity, we will have the potential to divert  tons of waste per year from a trip to the landfill. We will be a solid resource for teachers and offer outreach to local schools. We're business and environmentally friendly, and we will be an invaluable resource for the community. You can safely feel great about yourself if you help us.

WHAT ELSE DO I GET?

If you're more into material rewards, our incentives include...

$10- A Reconsidered Goods sticker
$25-A Reconsidered Goods tote bag
$100-A sticker, tote bag and 1 free workshop of your choice
$200- A free maker's lab party for up to 10 people. (For kids or adults)
$500- 3 free workshops and a swag bag of reusable goodies
$1000- You will be a guest of honor on opening night, we will serenade you with the song of your choice, and you will receive a swag bag.
$5000-We will name the community room in your honor and build a shrine to you out of reusable materials that will be on permanent display in the store.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute, that doesn't mean you can't help:

  • Get the word out and make some noise about our campaign.
  • Use the Indiegogo share tools to spread the word.
  • Contact us about volunteering.

story:
What is Street Pay ?


First and most important Street Pay is a financial system based on speed, reliability and  trust.

The vision of "StreetPay" is to emulate   true life  real time exchange experience  of cash  on the streets,  where if you do not know or a person you will not give them your money..."StreetPay" will be based on the same theory, If you do not know  the person you are sending money to then do not send it to them, the same way you would not just give money to just anyone on the street is the same way that "Street Pay"  will operate.

Street Pay is about financial character, but at a  more useful and forgiving scale  than credit scores, the reality is that some people will actually be able to go further in life financially with "Street Pay"  than with credit scores.

Why ? Because Street Pay will be totally live and always in real time

If an individual is proven to be trust worthy ? They will receive feedback that can never be changed, like a "street rep" or "street reputation". This way people will know that this is a person that can be trusted and relied on to deliver or keep to the agreement that was made before the money was exchanged  because this particular user has a "Good Reputation" ....

If an individual has a "Bad Reputation" with, welshing or  borrowing money and not returning it ? They will receive "Bad Reputation " marks.  After they tally up to a certain amount of "Bad Reps" ? The user may be banned forever or at least until they pay their debt to the user that initial gave them money from the system. When a user corrects an error that they made they will be reinstated and next to or in place of the "Bad Reputation"  mark will be the term "Made Right" with the time frame that it took for the user to correct the error

(example) "B.R Made Right 1/2015-9/2015"

This way even if someone made a mistake ? Other users will know that they corrected it, and other users of the system will know the time frame that  it took for them to correct it, from beginning to end. Which is honorable. The faster that a user corrects his error is the quicker that they can move along with business on the system. As no one would trust anyone who took 2 years to pay back $50 dollars, it will always be in a users best interest to move fast, in order to keep a "Good Reputation" .

A banned user will have no way  to re-enter the system, as the  system will be based on bio-metric identification.  One person will always only be allowed to own one SP  account, whether for business or personal use, users can add other users to their accounts but they will be responsible for their actions. So if you would not trust someone your wallet or purse ?, We would highly advise not giving them control or access over your "StreetPay" account..

Why do We Need Street Pay ?

Our economy needs to be stimulated, but not only by government stimulus packages but instead by a  way that money can be transferred around digitally, but in  a constant state of live motion ...

Presently costs continue to incur as money is frozen or stopped and opportunities to make more money are lost in the process. Many opportunities come around every once in a blue moon and one of the worst excuses to losing that money or opportunity is that it was being held by a corporation that merely wanted to falsely inflate its capital gain  holdings for stock and investment purposes.

Street Pay is a way for people to conduct person to person or business to business money transfers, without all of the stops, checks and fees that have been caused by corrupt banks and hedge fund investors.

Street Pay does not and will not  hold its users money  to gain interest on it  and beef up the company's value for stock purposes  at the cost of the users who use the online service.

We can guarantee this because unlike all other competitors ?  Street Pay will not have investors,  it will have users who are charged a small fee to transfer money, those fees will be deposited in a bank account and used  for maintenance of the "Street Pay" system which will include (CE) Compensation for employees and for insurance capital  in case any emergency issues  were to arise  that would require the company to have to compensate users who may have been compromised and incurred a loss directly caused by the system..

Street Pay is a self reliant fast paced, real time  money transfer system, that our global economy needs right now.  We need to sharpen the financial iq that is the norm among people now, most people are restricted and too relaxed with the restrictions 

We want all users to feel safe, secure and to always have a good experience with the SP system, we also want hedge fund investors and crooked bankers kicked out of the business of investing in banks and forced to have to invest in traditional businesses that create jobs and broaden the prosperity of our our global economy...

Street Pay has the potential to really speed things up economically in the U.S and abroad, the system will be simple enough for a five year old to use and their parents could actually use the system to give their children an allowance...

Unlike Bankers and Hedge Fund investors, the Goal of "StreetPay" is not about making money from People, it is about helping people to make Money for themselves and have a better opportunity to  live their lives without having worry or feel restricted by someone trying to make a personal profit from their dollar

If we eliminate what I call monarch investors from investing in money systems like loan sharks ? Then money can flow as it should and other ideas that people have can easily be made into realities, that will serve to make our global economy stronger and its work force multiply. 

Street Pay is about the World Investing in itself for itself, by buying and selling from itself...

  My name is O'Rane Mansolin and I am the creator of Street Pay which is an online banking subsidiary of my primary creation/idea which is Violence & Protest.com.

The Violence and Protest Network is a system based on personal security and the right of every human being on the face of the planet to protest oppression and crimes or injustices made towards humanity in an intellectual fashion on a platform specifically designed to me their protesting and security needs. My intention is to make Violence & Protest the biggest bullhorn for peace on the planet.  Our motto is "Getting the World to Agree on Peace" , I believe that global economics plays a major role in the pursuit of peace. Easy access to finances tremendously lowers the rates of poverty and crime..

In order to make "StreetPay" work we need a large sum of money,
 50% of what is raised will be put in the bank as insurance on users, the other 50%  will be used to publicize and finish the development of the system.

We need your support to get this accomplished, we do not want big donations, just small ones that can help us to reach our goal of turning our "StreetPay" software idea into an online banking system that really gives our global economy the push it needs , to make our world better for everyone on the planet..

We really hope that you choose to support  our  "StreetPay" campaign...

story:
My Story

Hello, my name is Ketura. 

I consider myself, somewhat, a "Jackie of all trades". Specifically, I have worked in some form or other in financial and data preparations, retrievals & applications, the computer sciences, and other technology-based positions at companies like IBM (was a process manager), Bank of America and the Meredith Corporation. However, the position which vastly honed my STEM skills - in addition to my "expertise" in art, craft & design - has been that of a Professional Nanny. Yes, I said nanny. It has been (and continues to be) my most IMPORTANT and most BELOVED out of all the interesting and rewarding positions I have held. 

The Inspiration

Since I have taken care of boys and girls, I have noticed a divide between how the latter are expected to learn (what, when & how), as opposed to that of the former. A lot of girls show an early interest in STEM, but are not encouraged to follow that path. And as we all know, certain encouragement comes from the toys with which one is allowed to play. Many of these girls are not exposed to technology-based toys idiosyncratic to their gender. 

It's a fact: most girls love DOLLS. And this is where ESTEAM-Girls come in. On account of being a gender-specific educational toy company, we will begin with DOLLS. The DOLLS will each have unique backgrounds with STEM-centered agenda and personas. The acronym ESTEAM is an extension on that of STEM, and each distinct persona is depicted in its spelling: Entrepreneur, Scientist, Technologist, Engineer, Architect, Mathematician. In addition to the DOLLS, the first offerings will include their STUDENT ID's and DOWNLOADABLE APP (for the ESTEAM.University platform), plus a personalized JOURNAL. 

(Check our website for additional details: http://www.esteam-girls.com/.

Your contributions will help bring to life the 1st THREE VINYL DOLLS of the series and their aforementioned ACCESSORIES. 

The Effect & Affect

Statistically speaking, and based upon the National Science Foundation's (NSF) 2012 & 2014 studies on the STEM-centered workforce, the following factors are prominent and precise:

    • American Indians/Natives, Black African Americans, and Hispanics/Latinas (non-White) make up a smaller share of the science and engineering workforce, with 10% of workers in science and engineering occupations and 13% of science and engineering degree holders in 2011, than their proportion in the general population, with 26% of U.S. population age 21 and older.
    • Asians work in science and engineering occupations at higher rates (19%) than their representation in the U.S. working-age population (5%). Asians are particularly highly concentrated in computer and information science occupations (22% Asian).*
    • Minority women comprise fewer than 1 in 10 employed scientists and engineers.
    • Within every S&E (science & engineering) occupation, more than half of all workers are non-Hispanic/Latina Whites. 
The importance of these statistics is not lost on the goal to manufacture the 1st THREE DOLLS, collectively, and expose their individual heritages to girls who may learn more about ethnic diversity, acknowledgement and acceptance. This, of course, in conjunction with absorbing and excelling at the STEM-based subjects. 

                                         

                                      1. ÉVARI Ana, The ENTREPRENEUR ...

              

                                      2. SHELBY Christine, The SCIENTIST ...


                                   3. TESSA Mei-Li, The TECHNOLOGIST ...

        * Although Asians, male and female, have a much stronger standing within this           particular workforce than Black African Americans & Hispanics/Latinas, we                feel it's important to include TESSA, so as not to exclude her based solely on              her positive positioning. And most importantly, even with the agreeable                        standing, there is still no mainstream Asian American doll on the market.                      We, at ESTEAM-Girls, want to be the first to fill in this gap.  

Rolling out the 1st THREE DOLLS at once will garner more selections from which to choose. The donor/contributor/customer and/or recipient/consumer may purchase one, two, or all three dolls, They won't have to wait long between acquiring their favorite(s).
After the 1st THREE DOLLS have a SUCCESSFUL run ;-), the 2nd SET will be manufactured more efficiently.

The Necessities

We need to raise $150,000 in order to produce the following:

  • A minimum of a 1,000 pieces for each doll must be met. Thus, a 3000-doll production run at $33/piece equals $99,000 in total for the dolls (to be made in Dongguan, China). 

  • Custom display boxes (also 3,000 pieces) will total $14,500 (to be made in California, USA).                                                   2D MOCK-UP
  • To build the ESTEAM.University infrastructure & APP, an approximate cost of $27,000 has been assessed, and this amount is extremely conservative (to be made in the USA or Western Europe). 

                               

  • The remaining $9,500 will be used for deliveries, and any unforeseen additional costs and expenses pertaining to manufacturing.
  • If the entire goal is not met, and depending on the amount that has been, the lower sum raised will be applied to producing at least ONE DOLL/PERSONA and her immediate ACCESSORIES (by popularity, your VOTE will determine which one that will be).

The Risks & Rewards

We are not blind to the fact that we have COMPETITION great, small, and all sizes in between. And it's not mistaken that our rivals are not just other doll, toy and education companies (ex: American Girl by Mattel). Those contenders are any company - mainstream, specialty, or otherwise - vying for discretionary income. 

However, optional or compulsory, our unique offerings will include a SUBSCRIPTION BOX MEMBERSHIP option - games, plushies, books, challenges, lessons, apps, arts & crafts, and of course, more dolls. With high-quality products, current and easy-to-use technology, unrivaled value, excellent service and superior support, the ESTEAM-Girls team of talented people and advisers will be able to provide our customer base with sectorial tools for cognitive thinking, the platform for expression, and the constituent for creation. 

And directly due of your support, you'll help us build a powerful foundation that no competitor can easily undermine. 

The Vision & Mission

With your monetary contributions,  ESTEAM-Girls (& ESTEAM.University)  will be taken from embryonic conception to absolute completion. We desire to make it a girl's go-to platform for STEM-centered playtime, learning and socializing. And with your generous donations, this possibility will become an actuality. 

Together, we will ENCOURAGE, ENLIGHTEN & EMPOWER a new generation of GIRLS to become the principal STEM, I mean, ESTEAM leaders of tomorrow! :-)

The Perfectly-Picked PERKS







                              (Your CHOICE of IMAGE - same print on FRONT & BACK) ...
                                         - Additional IMAGES in the GALLERY Section -

Helpful Hands

Helping comes in many forms, not just financially. If you are unable to make a monetary contribution at this time, but wish to support us is some capacity, PLEASE JOIN, FOLLOW, & SHARE on your social media (utilize the INDIEGOGO SHARE tools). In addition to giving virtual LOVE, spread the word about us to your colleagues, friends, family, neighbors, educators, and even the butcher down the street. We'll take all of the PRICELESS word-of-mouth advertising we can get. :-D 

THANK YOU very much for your interest, consideration, and hopefully, SUPPORT. Have an AWESOME day!

                                      2. SHELBY Christine, The SCIENTIST ...







                                   3. TESSA Mei-Li, The TECHNOLOGIST ...
        * Although Asians, male and female, have a much stronger standing within this           particular workforce than Black African Americans & Hispanics/Latinas, we                feel it's important to include TESSA, so as not to exclude her based solely on              her positive positioning. And most importantly, even with the agreeable                        standing, there is still no mainstream Asian American doll on the market.                      We, at ESTEAM-Girls, want to be the first to fill in this gap.  



Rolling out the 1st THREE DOLLS at once will garner more selections from which to choose. The donor/contributor/customer and/or recipient/consumer may purchase one, two, or all three dolls, They won't have to wait long between acquiring their favorite(s).

After the 1st THREE DOLLS have a SUCCESSFUL run ;-), the 2nd SET will be manufactured more efficiently.










The Necessities
We need to raise $150,000 in order to produce the following:


A minimum of a 1,000 pieces for each doll must be met. Thus, a 3000-doll production run at $33/piece equals $99,000 in total for the dolls (to be made in Dongguan, China). 

Custom display boxes (also 3,000 pieces) will total $14,500 (to be made in California, USA).                                                   2D MOCK-UP

To build the ESTEAM.University infrastructure & APP, an approximate cost of $27,000 has been assessed, and this amount is extremely conservative (to be made in the USA or Western Europe). 
                            

The remaining $9,500 will be used for deliveries, and any unforeseen additional costs and expenses pertaining to manufacturing.
If the entire goal is not met, and depending on the amount that has been, the lower sum raised will be applied to producing at least ONE DOLL/PERSONA and her immediate ACCESSORIES (by popularity, your VOTE will determine which one that will be).



The Risks & Rewards

 We are not blind to the fact that we have COMPETITION great, small, and all sizes in between. And it's not mistaken that our rivals are not just other doll, toy and education companies (ex: American Girl by Mattel). Those contenders are any company - mainstream, specialty, or otherwise - vying for discretionary income. 


However, optional or compulsory, our unique offerings will include a SUBSCRIPTION BOX MEMBERSHIP option - games, plushies, books, challenges, lessons, apps, arts & crafts, and of course, more dolls. With high-quality products, current and easy-to-use technology, unrivaled value, excellent service and superior support, the ESTEAM-Girls team of talented people and advisers will be able to provide our customer base with sectorial tools for cognitive thinking, the platform for expression, and the constituent for creation. 

And directly due of your support, you'll help us build a powerful foundation that no competitor can easily undermine. 

The Vision & Mission
With your monetary contributions,  ESTEAM-Girls (& ESTEAM.University)  will be taken from embryonic conception to absolute completion. We desire to make it a girl's go-to platform for STEM-centered playtime, learning and socializing. And with your generous donations, this possibility will become an actuality. 


Together, we will ENCOURAGE, ENLIGHTEN & EMPOWER a new generation of GIRLS to become the principal STEM, I mean, ESTEAM leaders of tomorrow! :-)




The Perfectly-Picked PERKS




















                              (Your CHOICE of IMAGE - same print on FRONT & BACK) ...                                         - Additional IMAGES in the GALLERY Section -Helpful Hands Helping comes in many forms, not just financially. If you are unable to make a monetary contribution at this time, but wish to support us is some capacity, PLEASE JOIN, FOLLOW, & SHARE on your social media (utilize the INDIEGOGO SHARE tools). In addition to giving virtual LOVE, spread the word about us to your colleagues, friends, family, neighbors, educators, and even the butcher down the street. We'll take all of the PRICELESS word-of-mouth advertising we can get. :-D 
THANK YOU very much for your interest, consideration, and hopefully, SUPPORT. Have an AWESOME day!

story:
You can still support the Cenotaph by donating or buying items through www.Ypres2016.com

We've raised nearly £5000 for the Cenotaph through the campaign, which will be a big help. We continue to raise funds through a number of other means including the sale of poppies which are available through our website.

We're delighted to have received in-kind support of over £10,500 this week of essential forging equipment for the event through our offline fundraising. As well as donating you can help through sharing information of the project with your networks. Together we can make it happen.


In September 2016 a striking new World War 1 Cenotaph is being created in Ypres, Belgium.

Hundreds of blacksmiths and farriers from around the world will come together to create the Cenotaph in a week-long event in Flanders.

In the War of 1914 -1918 blacksmiths and farriers were indispensable in sustaining the war effort on all sides and the blacksmiths of today are coming together once more to use their skill to craft the Cenotaph.

Standing 7m (23 feet) tall and weighing 12 tonnes (approx 13 US tons), the metal Cenotaph for the 21st century will feature the evocative image of a single Flanders poppy. At its base will be ‘planted’ a field of 2016 steel poppies handcrafted by blacksmiths and farriers worldwide.

£100,000 has already been raised by the project and we are launching our crowdfunding campaign to raise the further £80,000 needed to realise the Cenotaph.

The Cenotaph

The Cenotaph will consist of 3 elements. At the centre will be a steel structure depicting a Flanders Field Poppy. This will be surrounded by the individually crafted poppies. The petals for the poppies will have been forged by farriers and blacksmiths from all over the world and shipped to Ypres, ensuring that it truly is an international commemoration.

Finally, framing these will be 25 individually designed panels echoing the zig-zag formation of the trenches and depicting interpretations of the Great War. Designed by Master Blacksmiths worldwide, the panels will be forged during the week-long event by teams of blacksmiths and apprentices.


Project Background

Blacksmiths and farriers played an important part in the war.  They, along with soldiers, miners, medics and civilians of all nations made great sacrifices both on the battle field and at home. It's against this background that blacksmiths and farriers worldwide are using their skill and craft to remember all those who suffered.


Blacksmiths were required to make and repair a variety of vital equipment for the war effort both on the battlefield and at home. Over 8 million horses and countless mules and donkeys were used in the war.There are many distressing images showing the conditions which soldiers and their horses endured on a daily basis.

If not called to the battlefields farriers and blacksmiths who remained in their communities in Britain and across Europe were sent official requests to produce horseshoes by the hundreds as well as other essential items.

With the vast number of men being called to the Front, women stepped up to undertake what were previously considered to be male occupations, including blacksmithing.


The Event


Blacksmiths and Farriers from all over the world will gather in Ypres to create this unique Cenotaph. They will be coming from many countries including Belgium, USA, Germany, Wales, Canada, Ukraine, France, Scotland, England, Italy, Chile, South Africa, Russia, New Zealand, Australia and Japan.

Forging stations, tools, equipment and the infrastructure requirements of such an event will be set up in the beautiful Grote Markt (market square) Ypres to create the Cenotaph. The event will include blacksmithing and farrier demonstrations, a horse shoeing demonstration, a children's forging area, an exhibition of blacksmithing art and lectures.

Blacksmiths will be hammering hot metal throughout the week, making a spectacular sight and sound as teams of 6 smiths create the 25 individually designed panels which will surround the main structure of the Cenotaph.

School children across Europe have been having a great time forging poppies and there will also be an opportunity for children to forge them at the event.  These poppies are smaller than those which will form the Cenotaph and they will be made into a wreath to be placed at the Menin Gate.

The major international exhibition of contemporary forged metal design will consist of artistic interpretations the notion of ‘Transition’ and following the event, the exhibition will tour various locations culminating at a major London venue as part of the celebrations of the centenary of the Armistice in 2018.

Patrons and Partners

We are thrilled to have Michael Morpurgo and Sebastian Faulks as Patrons of the project. Michael is author of the novel War Horse which became a very successful theatre production and famous Steven Spielberg film. Michael has also been a great help in providing the supporting video for the campaign.

Sebastian Faulks is author of many novels including Birdsong,  which is set in Flanders in 1916 and is now described as a ‘modern classic’. The TV adaptation starred Oscar-winning actor, Eddie Redmayne.  On visiting the battlefields when researching Birdsong Sebastian said

"That trip introduced me to men who had actually fought there. I met about six of them and talked to them about their experiences. It helped to bring the war out of an area marked ‘history’ and put it under the heading of life. Here we were in the actual field; and they were the same men. Over there, by that tree, was where his friend had died."

We've secured considerable in-kind support from a number of organisations who are sharing their knowledge, equipment and materials to support the project. This includes the Flanders’ Chamber of Commerce and Industry and the Ypres and Langemark-Poelkapelle town councils.

How You Can Help


Over £100,000 has already been raised to fund the project through donations and in-kind support from individuals and organisations. A further £80,000 is required to enable us to create this unique commemoration.

Your contribution, be it large or small, will make a big difference in helping us fund the Cenotaph and remembering those who gave their lives or made sacrifices from which many never recovered.

You may simply wish to make a donation towards the project, you may like to sponsor items which will form part of the Cenotaph, or you may like to receive an item or experience in return for your contribution. There are some fantastic items available which we've listed below.

The money raised will be used to fund the 6 day event where 2 of the 3 elements of the Cenotaph will be created. This will include materials, infrastructure and logistics. Due to its size and the finish required, the 7m tall central structure is being created in advance and will be erected temporarily in the Grote Markt during the event for all to see, before being transported to its final location.

In the event that we do not reach our required funding goal we will reconsider the size of the event although we sincerely hope that this will not impact on the Cenotaph itself.


What Perks are Available

There are a range of perks available through the campaign, from affordable items which we hope will appeal to all, to top-end items for which we're requesting larger donations.

Some of the items can be personally owned by you whilst others will be incorporated into the Cenotaph itself. Donations can also be made without perks, so if you wish to simply make a donation it will be gratefully received.

The perks available include:

  • Regular copies of the project newsletter
  • Poppy key fob
  • Ypres 2016 T-shirt
  • Sponsoring a poppy at the Cenotaph
  • Handcrafted metal poppy
  • Beautiful hand crafted poppy brooch
  • Sponsoring a handcrafted panel at the Cenotaph


Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that you may not be able to make a financial contribution to support the project, but that doesn't mean you can't help.

It would be a real help if you could share information on the project with your friends and contacts, and let them know what's taking place.

And don't forget to use the Indiegogo tools on this page to share with your network on Facebook, Twitter and your other social media favourites.

Please help us raise the required funds to create this striking Cenotaph in Flanders to all who suffered during World War One.

Thank you

story:
--- Texto em português mais abaixo/portuguese text below ---
 
Helping the World Tree to grow!

Hi all, I am Joana and I've been a vegetarian cook for the past 5 years (besides previous occupations as a theater actress and Reiki therapist).
I am passionate about these three fields, and they have contributed to make me the person I am today. Even though I'm currently working mostly as a cook, I am strongly connected to them and they are present in my work and my relationship to people and food.
I became a vegetarian 8 years ago, when my son was born - and he's been raised by the same principles. 
The promotion of vegetarianism as a healthy and valid option, is a mission both on the personal and professional level. 

 

And now... after 5 years of working in various places around Porto, the opportunity to create my own personal space has come and I decided to take it! 

So, I gave up the security of my current job and followed both my heart and the challenge of friends and customers who are somehow moved by my work and always encouraged me to follow my own path.
I decided to take this gamble knowing that that encouragement translates into support: having no personal funds to draw upon, I managed to secure the rental of a commercial space thanks to loans from friends and family members who volunteered to help when they heard of the project.

Things are moving fast and Árvore do Mundo (portuguese for "World Tree"  - the element connecting the Underground, Terrestrial and Celestial worlds in mythology) is due to open in May (if everything goes as planned!).

 So far I have raised about half the amount necessary for repair works, six months' advance rent, gear, furniture, legal expenses (insurance, permits, etc), stocks of food and drinks... so I'm asking for your help with the other half!


What is needed?

So, for all the items listed above (and for unexpected expenses!), I need about 20,000€, of which I have raised around 9500€ so far thanks to loans from friends and family, so about 10,000€ are still needed to fulfill this dream!
*Note: the goal set for this campaign is 10,000€, but approximately 10% of that amount will be spent on processing fees, so in fact the project will get 9000€. 
So, feel free to continue contributing after the 10,000€ goal has been met :) 

I have considered a bank loan, but besides the huge amount of paperwork and gigantic interest rates, banks tend not to lend money unless you have it already, which is not the case :) ... and the time a bank would take to decide on a loan is time I can't afford to wait.

In fact, timing has been of the essence for this project: there were lots of people interested in renting the space, so I had to seal the deal very fast, believing that everything would fall into place afterwards... with help from all of you :) 


And what do I get in return for helping?

Since World Tree is located in Porto, Portugal and you might be somewhere else, there is no tangible reward I can offer you, besides the gratifying knowledge that you're supporting a project that is beneficial not just for you and me, but for the World. 

That's why I say "tangible reward", because intangible rewards and gratitude will always be present, since I believe that vegetarianism is a valuable and positive attitude we can take on behalf of the planet, by reducing the use of animal products.

But... if you are in Porto or you're planning to be, World Tree will be delighted to welcome you with a smile and a hug, and to nourish your body and soul with food straight from the Earth and the Heart :)
And if you wish to, you will be able to exchange your contribution to this fundraiser (10€ minimum) for a daily lunch menu!
Any contributions below 10€ will also be greatly and thankfully appreciated, of course :)


What's the concept behind World Tree? 

For the past 2 or 3 years, Porto has been developing as a place to be enjoyed both by locals and visitors, with a huge number of new food establishments opening every month; but there is still no place in the area like the one I envision...


Most vegetarian places here are classic restaurants, and I aim to create a space that combines snacks, books, exhibitions, music and poetry performances, workshops, theme dinners, and a store... A space that reflects my personal approach to life, integrating the worlds of art, nutrition and nature and working also with a network of collaborators, like a true World Tree, growing stronger roots every day and becoming a home where you can eat and drink, but also just be in the way you prefer: reading, talking, singing, hugging, breathing...
World Tree also aims at working with and for the community, helping to unravel some of the preconceptions about being a vegetarian; I'm looking forward to sharing my experience and knowledge in a place devoted to everyone (vegetarian or not!), where you can share information, stories, ideas and other things, and not only food.


Will this tree grow fast and strong?

So far, the people who know about the project have been very excited about the prospect of this kind of space opening in this part of town, so with a lot of hard work and a little help from all of you, World Tree will do its best to make a lot of people happy!
But of course, this kind of adventure has its risks :) Maybe I'm aware of only some of them so far, but as the project develops new obstacles will probably arise... that's why the amount this campaign aims to raise is directed at legal and bureaucratic issues, such as advance rent payments and insurance, and also unforeseen expenses, so that a safe ground can be established for this tree to grow on :)


Can I help without contributing with money?

Of course :) Any kind of help is welcome, like spreading this campaign among your contacts, or just by believing in this project and encouraging it!
Your energy makes all the difference!
This project has made me learn a lot about how far people will go to help you fulfill your dreams... there are no words to describe the feelings I've had since this journey began, and the gratitude towards everybody that has helped this tree grow collectively, as it should :)
The World Tree connects and supports all levels of existence, so this is not just about me and my dream, but also about each one of us and the way we give ourselves!

Also, if you want to contribute and you don't have a PayPal account, or if you prefer, please send your donation to my bank account (IBAN: PT50 0035 0160 0006 1269 30073) and let me know by email (luzdaindia@gmail.com) or Facebook (www.facebook.com/joana.esteves.5688). Thank you!

This campaign will be kept fresh with video updates, photos of the work's progress, news and more, so stay tuned!

I'M GRATEFUL TO YOU ALL!

 

 

 --- Português---
 
Ajudando a Árvore do Mundo a crescer!

Queridos amigos, o meu nome é Joana e sou cozinheira vegetariana desde há 5 anos (anteriormente trabalhei também como actriz de teatro e terapeuta de Reiki).
Estas três áreas são aquelas em que me movo, que me apaixonam e que juntas contribuiram para fazer de mim a pessoa que sou hoje. Embora actualmente trabalhe mais como cozinheira, mantenho forte ligação com cada uma delas e estão presentes também no meu trabalho e na minha ligação com as pessoas e a comida. 
Tornei-me vegetariana há 8 anos, quando o meu filho nasceu, estando portanto ele a crescer segundo os mesmos princípios.
A promoção do vegetarianismo como uma opção saudável e válida, é uma questão  importante para mim, e uma missão tanto a nível pessoal como profissional.

 

E agora... após 5 anos de trabalho em vários estabelecimentos na zona do Porto, surgiu a oportunidade de criar o meu próprio espaço, e decidi agarrá-la!

Abdiquei da segurança do meu emprego para seguir o meu coração, bem como o desafio de amigos e clientes que, de alguma forma, se sentem tocados pelo meu trabalho e sempre me encorajaram a seguir o meu próprio caminho.
Decidi também correr este risco sabendo que esse encorajamento se traduz em apoio: embora não tenha capital próprio, consegui assegurar o aluguer de um estabelecimento  na zona central do Porto (junto à Praça da Batalha e ao Jardim de São Lázaro) graças a empréstimos de amigos e familiares que, quando souberam deste projecto, se ofereceram para ajudar.
Tudo está a evoluir rapidamente e a Árvore do Mundo (o nome do símbolo mitológico que une o Mundo Subterrâneo, Terrestre e Celestial, e também o nome deste novo espaço!) irá abrir portas em Maio (a correr tudo como espero).
Até ao momento consegui reunir cerca de metade do capital necessário para seis meses de renda adiantados, obras, equipamento, mobiliário, despesas legais (seguros, licenças, etc), recheio de comida e bebida... e por isso venho pedir a vossa colaboração para reunir a restante metade!
 

Como posso ajudar?

Para corresponder às despesas que referi (e para outras despesas imprevistas!), são necessários cerca de 20 000€, dos quais já foram reunidos 9500€, por empréstimo junto de amigos e familiares, ficando a faltar cerca de 10 000€.
*Nota: o valor estabelecido para esta angariação é de 10 000€, mas cerca de 10% do total das contribuições será deduzido pela plataforma, em custos associados à própria campanha; por isso, mesmo que o objectivo de 10 000€ venha a ser atingido, as contribuições feitas para lá desse ponto também serão extremamente bem-vindas :) 

Ponderei a possibilidade de recorrer a um empréstimo bancário, mas para além da enorme quantidade de burocracia e das altas taxas de juros associadas, os bancos tendem a não emprestar dinheiro a não ser que já tenhamos algum, o que não é o caso :) e o tempo que um empréstimo demora a ser aprovado é tempo de que eu não posso dispor!
 Na verdade, o tempo tem sido essencial para este processo: havia muitos outros interessados em alugar o estabelecimento, por isso tive de fechar o negócio muito rapidamente, confiando que em seguida todas as peças virão a encaixar... com a ajuda de todos vós :)

 
O que recebo em troca da minha contribuição?

Uma vez que a Árvore do Mundo está situada no Porto e tu talvez estejas noutro lugar, não posso oferecer nenhuma contrapartida tangível ou palpável, mas terás certamente a gratificação de saber que estás a apoiar um projecto que é benéfico não apenas para ti e para mim, mas para o Mundo.
 Por isso falo em contrapartidas tangíveis, pois as intangíveis estarão sempre lá assim como a minha infinita gratidão.
 Acredito que o crescimento do vegetarianismo é uma atitude positiva e valiosa que podemos tomar em prol do planeta, reduzindo o consumo de produtos de origem animal!
 

 E ainda... se estiveres no Porto ou planeares passar por cá, a Árvore do Mundo terá o maior gosto em receber-te com um sorriso e um abraço, e alimentar o teu corpo e alma com comida directamente da Terra e do Coração :)
Se o pretenderes, poderás trocar a tua contribuição (num mínimo de 10€) por um menu do dia!
E claro, qualquer contribuição abaixo de 10€ será também recebida com toda a gratidão :)

 
Qual é o conceito na base da Árvore do Mundo?

Nos últimos 2 ou 3 anos, o Porto tem vivido um grande desenvolvimento, tornando-se mais do que nunca numa cidade de que tanto os habitantes locais como os visitantes podem disfrutar, com uma grande quantidade de cafés, restaurantes e outros estabelecimentos a abrirem todos os meses; no entanto, na parte da cidade em que estamos situados, ainda não existe nenhum local como o que eu imagino...


Desejo criar uma casa que, não sendo um restaurante no sentido clássico, combine petiscos, um espaço de leitura, exposições, apresentações de música e poesia, "workshops", jantares temáticos e uma pequena loja... Um espaço que seja um reflexo da minha forma de viver, integrando os mundos da arte, da alimentação e da natureza e que envolva uma rede de colaboradores, como uma verdadeira Árvore do Mundo, estendendo a cada dia raízes mais fortes e tornando-se numa casa onde possas comer e beber, mas também apenas estar da forma que desejares: lendo, conversando, cantando, abraçando, respirando...
A Árvore do Mundo também almeja trabalhar com e para a comunidade, ajudando a desmontar algumas ideias pré-concebidas sobre o vegetarianismo;  quero partilhar as minhas experiências e conhecimentos num local dedicado a todos (vegetarianos ou não!), onde se pode trocar informação, histórias, ideias e outras coisas para além de comida :)

  

Esta Árvore vai crescer forte e rapidamente?

Até agora, todas as pessoas que têm contactado com este projecto têm ficado muito entusiasmadas com a perspectiva de um espaço desta natureza vir a existir nesta parte da cidade, por isso confio que com muito trabalho e uma pequena contribuição de todos vós, a Árvore do Mundo vai dar tudo para fazer muita gente feliz!
Mas, claro, este tipo de aventura tem os seus riscos :) Talvez eu esteja consciente de apenas alguns desses riscos por agora, mas à medida que o projecto avance é possível que surjam novos obstáculos... por isso, o valor que esta campanha pretende angariar está direccionado para fazer face a questões burocráticas, obrigações contratuais (como rendas adiantadas e seguros) etc, e ainda despesas imprevistas, para que se possa estabelecer um chão sólido sobre o qual esta Árvore possa crescer :)
  

Posso ajudar sem dar uma contribuição monetária?

Claro que sim :) Qualquer ajuda é bem-vinda e agradecida, como por exemplo se divulgares esta campanha pelos teus contactos, ou apenas se acreditares neste projecto e o encorajares! A tua energia faz toda a diferença!
Este processo tem-me feito aprender muito sobre quão longe as pessoas são capazes de ir para ajudar a concretizar um sonho... não tenho palavras para descrever as emoções  que tenho sentido desde que esta viagem começou, e a gratidão para com todos os que têm ajudado esta Árvore a crescer com um impulso colectivo, tão lindo de se sentir :)
A Árvore do Mundo representa a união e sustento de todos os níveis de existência, por isso este projecto e esta história não são apenas sobre mim, mas sobre cada um de nós e a forma como nos damos!

 Se quiseres participar e não tiveres conta de PayPal, ou preferires, por favor envia a tua contribuição para a minha conta bancária (IBAN: PT50 0035 0160 0006 1269 30073) e avisa-me por email (luzdaindia@gmail.com) ou Facebook (www.facebook.com/joana.esteves.5688). Obrigada!

 Esta campanha irá sendo actualizada com um vídeo, fotos das obras de renovação, notícias e novidades, por isso fica ligado!

A TODOS, A MINHA GRATIDÃO!
story_txt:
--- Texto em português mais abaixo/portuguese text below --- Helping the World Tree to grow! Hi all, I am Joana and I've been a vegetarian cook for the past 5 years (besides previous occupations as a theater actress and Reiki therapist). I am passionate about these three fields, and they have contributed to make me the person I am today. Even though I'm currently working mostly as a cook, I am strongly connected to them and they are present in my work and my relationship to people and food.I became a vegetarian 8 years ago, when my son was born - and he's been raised by the same principles.  The promotion of vegetarianism as a healthy and valid option, is a mission both on the personal and professional level. 


 

And now... after 5 years of working in various places around Porto, the opportunity to create my own personal space has come and I decided to take it! 
So, I gave up the security of my current job and followed both my heart and the challenge of friends and customers who are somehow moved by my work and always encouraged me to follow my own path. I decided to take this gamble knowing that that encouragement translates into support: having no personal funds to draw upon, I managed to secure the rental of a commercial space thanks to loans from friends and family members who volunteered to help when they heard of the project.
Things are moving fast and Árvore do Mundo (portuguese for "World Tree"  - the element connecting the Underground, Terrestrial and Celestial worlds in mythology) is due to open in May (if everything goes as planned!).
 So far I have raised about half the amount necessary for repair works, six months' advance rent, gear, furniture, legal expenses (insurance, permits, etc), stocks of food and drinks... so I'm asking for your help with the other half!What is needed?


So, for all the items listed above (and for unexpected expenses!), I need about 20,000€, of which I have raised around 9500€ so far thanks to loans from friends and family, so about 10,000€ are still needed to fulfill this dream!*Note: the goal set for this campaign is 10,000€, but approximately 10% of that amount will be spent on processing fees, so in fact the project will get 9000€. So, feel free to continue contributing after the 10,000€ goal has been met :) I have considered a bank loan, but besides the huge amount of paperwork and gigantic interest rates, banks tend not to lend money unless you have it already, which is not the case :) ... and the time a bank would take to decide on a loan is time I can't afford to wait.In fact, timing has been of the essence for this project: there were lots of people interested in renting the space, so I had to seal the deal very fast, believing that everything would fall into place afterwards... with help from all of you :) And what do I get in return for helping? Since World Tree is located in Porto, Portugal and you might be somewhere else, there is no tangible reward I can offer you, besides the gratifying knowledge that you're supporting a project that is beneficial not just for you and me, but for the World. That's why I say "tangible reward", because intangible rewards and gratitude will always be present, since I believe that vegetarianism is a valuable and positive attitude we can take on behalf of the planet, by reducing the use of animal products.But... if you are in Porto or you're planning to be, World Tree will be delighted to welcome you with a smile and a hug, and to nourish your body and soul with food straight from the Earth and the Heart :)And if you wish to, you will be able to exchange your contribution to this fundraiser (10€ minimum) for a daily lunch menu!Any contributions below 10€ will also be greatly and thankfully appreciated, of course :)What's the concept behind World Tree? For the past 2 or 3 years, Porto has been developing as a place to be enjoyed both by locals and visitors, with a huge number of new food establishments opening every month; but there is still no place in the area like the one I envision... Most vegetarian places here are classic restaurants, and I aim to create a space that combines snacks, books, exhibitions, music and poetry performances, workshops, theme dinners, and a store... A space that reflects my personal approach to life, integrating the worlds of art, nutrition and nature and working also with a network of collaborators, like a true World Tree, growing stronger roots every day and becoming a home where you can eat and drink, but also just be in the way you prefer: reading, talking, singing, hugging, breathing...World Tree also aims at working with and for the community, helping to unravel some of the preconceptions about being a vegetarian; I'm looking forward to sharing my experience and knowledge in a place devoted to everyone (vegetarian or not!), where you can share information, stories, ideas and other things, and not only food.Will this tree grow fast and strong?So far, the people who know about the project have been very excited about the prospect of this kind of space opening in this part of town, so with a lot of hard work and a little help from all of you, World Tree will do its best to make a lot of people happy!But of course, this kind of adventure has its risks :) Maybe I'm aware of only some of them so far, but as the project develops new obstacles will probably arise... that's why the amount this campaign aims to raise is directed at legal and bureaucratic issues, such as advance rent payments and insurance, and also unforeseen expenses, so that a safe ground can be established for this tree to grow on :)Can I help without contributing with money?Of course :) Any kind of help is welcome, like spreading this campaign among your contacts, or just by believing in this project and encouraging it!Your energy makes all the difference!This project has made me learn a lot about how far people will go to help you fulfill your dreams... there are no words to describe the feelings I've had since this journey began, and the gratitude towards everybody that has helped this tree grow collectively, as it should :) The World Tree connects and supports all levels of existence, so this is not just about me and my dream, but also about each one of us and the way we give ourselves!Also, if you want to contribute and you don't have a PayPal account, or if you prefer, please send your donation to my bank account (IBAN: PT50 0035 0160 0006 1269 30073) and let me know by email (luzdaindia@gmail.com) or Facebook (www.facebook.com/joana.esteves.5688). Thank you!This campaign will be kept fresh with video updates, photos of the work's progress, news and more, so stay tuned!I'M GRATEFUL TO YOU ALL! 
 
 --- Português---
 Ajudando a Árvore do Mundo a crescer!Queridos amigos, o meu nome é Joana e sou cozinheira vegetariana desde há 5 anos (anteriormente trabalhei também como actriz de teatro e terapeuta de Reiki).Estas três áreas são aquelas em que me movo, que me apaixonam e que juntas contribuiram para fazer de mim a pessoa que sou hoje. Embora actualmente trabalhe mais como cozinheira, mantenho forte ligação com cada uma delas e estão presentes também no meu trabalho e na minha ligação com as pessoas e a comida. Tornei-me vegetariana há 8 anos, quando o meu filho nasceu, estando portanto ele a crescer segundo os mesmos princípios.A promoção do vegetarianismo como uma opção saudável e válida, é uma questão  importante para mim, e uma missão tanto a nível pessoal como profissional. 
E agora... após 5 anos de trabalho em vários estabelecimentos na zona do Porto, surgiu a oportunidade de criar o meu próprio espaço, e decidi agarrá-la!
Abdiquei da segurança do meu emprego para seguir o meu coração, bem como o desafio de amigos e clientes que, de alguma forma, se sentem tocados pelo meu trabalho e sempre me encorajaram a seguir o meu próprio caminho.Decidi também correr este risco sabendo que esse encorajamento se traduz em apoio: embora não tenha capital próprio, consegui assegurar o aluguer de um estabelecimento  na zona central do Porto (junto à Praça da Batalha e ao Jardim de São Lázaro) graças a empréstimos de amigos e familiares que, quando souberam deste projecto, se ofereceram para ajudar.
Tudo está a evoluir rapidamente e a Árvore do Mundo (o nome do símbolo mitológico que une o Mundo Subterrâneo, Terrestre e Celestial, e também o nome deste novo espaço!) irá abrir portas em Maio (a correr tudo como espero).
Até ao momento consegui reunir cerca de metade do capital necessário para seis meses de renda adiantados, obras, equipamento, mobiliário, despesas legais (seguros, licenças, etc), recheio de comida e bebida... e por isso venho pedir a vossa colaboração para reunir a restante metade!
 

Como posso ajudar?

Para corresponder às despesas que referi (e para outras despesas imprevistas!), são necessários cerca de 20 000€, dos quais já foram reunidos 9500€, por empréstimo junto de amigos e familiares, ficando a faltar cerca de 10 000€.
*Nota: o valor estabelecido para esta angariação é de 10 000€, mas cerca de 10% do total das contribuições será deduzido pela plataforma, em custos associados à própria campanha; por isso, mesmo que o objectivo de 10 000€ venha a ser atingido, as contribuições feitas para lá desse ponto também serão extremamente bem-vindas :) 

Ponderei a possibilidade de recorrer a um empréstimo bancário, mas para além da enorme quantidade de burocracia e das altas taxas de juros associadas, os bancos tendem a não emprestar dinheiro a não ser que já tenhamos algum, o que não é o caso :) e o tempo que um empréstimo demora a ser aprovado é tempo de que eu não posso dispor!
 Na verdade, o tempo tem sido essencial para este processo: havia muitos outros interessados em alugar o estabelecimento, por isso tive de fechar o negócio muito rapidamente, confiando que em seguida todas as peças virão a encaixar... com a ajuda de todos vós :)

 
O que recebo em troca da minha contribuição?

Uma vez que a Árvore do Mundo está situada no Porto e tu talvez estejas noutro lugar, não posso oferecer nenhuma contrapartida tangível ou palpável, mas terás certamente a gratificação de saber que estás a apoiar um projecto que é benéfico não apenas para ti e para mim, mas para o Mundo.
 Por isso falo em contrapartidas tangíveis, pois as intangíveis estarão sempre lá assim como a minha infinita gratidão.
 Acredito que o crescimento do vegetarianismo é uma atitude positiva e valiosa que podemos tomar em prol do planeta, reduzindo o consumo de produtos de origem animal!
 

 E ainda... se estiveres no Porto ou planeares passar por cá, a Árvore do Mundo terá o maior gosto em receber-te com um sorriso e um abraço, e alimentar o teu corpo e alma com comida directamente da Terra e do Coração :)Se o pretenderes, poderás trocar a tua contribuição (num mínimo de 10€) por um menu do dia!E claro, qualquer contribuição abaixo de 10€ será também recebida com toda a gratidão :)

Um espaço que seja um reflexo da minha forma de viver, integrando os mundos da arte, da alimentação e da natureza e que envolva uma rede de colaboradores, como uma verdadeira Árvore do Mundo, estendendo a cada dia raízes mais fortes e tornando-se numa casa onde possas comer e beber, mas também apenas estar da forma que desejares: lendo, conversando, cantando, abraçando, respirando...A Árvore do Mundo também almeja trabalhar com e para a comunidade, ajudando a desmontar algumas ideias pré-concebidas sobre o vegetarianismo;  quero partilhar as minhas experiências e conhecimentos num local dedicado a todos (vegetarianos ou não!), onde se pode trocar informação, histórias, ideias e outras coisas para além de comida :)

story:
Our Story

Inspired by the need for a community gathering space, the Whiteaker Community Market will act as an adhesive force which will bring together the diverse talents of our neighborhood. In an effort to support the Whiteaker Community Council to purchase the lot for future community space, it only makes sense to utilize the skills of the Whiteaker's very own small-scale entrepreneurs. We believe that a market founded by artists and local, organic food systems will create a sense of place and allow the spirit of the Whiteaker to thrive!

The Whiteaker Community Market will strengthen our community’s vitality by providing a space for our farmers, artisans, musicians, and neighbors to exchange local, well-crafted items.

The market will be held at the gravel lot near the intersection of 6th Avenue and Blair Street in Eugene, OR every Thursday from 4-8 pm, May through September.
 
We are hoping to raise $2,000 to help pay for the expenses of the market which include rent of the lot, porta-potties, insurance, site infrastructure, our own time in managing the market, and promotional materials.

Thank you for your contribution!

story:
The Story

Ghost Gallery was established in 2006, when Laurie Kearney began independently curating visual art & multimedia shows in the Seattle area - venues like Solo Bar, Pretty Parlor, Neumo's and Stylus Salon were among the first spaces Laurie worked with. In April of 2010, Laurie was able to move the gallery into a unique brick & mortar space in Capitol Hill. Tucked in a mossy courtyard at the crossover between E Denny Way & Olive Way, this hybrid gallery + boutique has steadily grown and refined its offerings of rotating visual art, handmade jewelry by local designers, gift items and prints. This campaign was created because Ghost Gallery wants to stay relevant within our ever-changing neighborhood, as well as cater to the growing online art collecting and shopping community. And so: 

Ghost Gallery is ready for an expanded, more comprehensive website that will:
A. Continue to offer a stellar collection of rotating Visual Art & Handmade goods, with worldwide shipping options.
B. Take things to the next level online by adding more artist-focused content and easier access to handmade goods that help support the small business economy.
C. Provide more online exhibiting opportunities for underrepresented artists; feature submission-based new media projects like video art; include artist-to-viewer discussion and Q&A's.

What We Need:

  • In order to focus our energy and resources on expanding the gallery's online presence (while streamlining our brick & mortar space and keeping the bills paid), financial support is a must. Pre-and-Post launch needs include hiring a web designer to upgrade & redesign the site, implementing a long term digital + brand marketing strategy, purchasing inventory, creating online content, upgrading the currently tiny gallery storage space and compensating staff.
  • There will be much love in return, including Ghost Gallery Memberships, Handmade Jewelry, Original Art, Personal In-House Curatorial services & much more...
  • Funds received would go to all of the above mentioned. Your support would help get us there much more quickly and efficiently. If our stretch goal of $20k is reached, we can very likely get launched by Fall 2016. If our initial goal is not met we will still move forward with our online expansion as funds allow.

The Impact

"I of course value the rewarding, face-to-face experience of connecting people with artwork and or handmade goods that they love and appreciate. Which is why the physical gallery space is remaining intact. As someone who has lived and worked in Capitol Hill for the past eleven years, I’ve experienced first-hand the many small business challenges within the neighborhood, including the shift in how people are shopping for original art and handmade items. So while maintaining our brick & mortar gallery is essential for providing hands-on opportunities for new and emerging artists, we also need to grow beyond the courtyard in order to thrive. With your support, creating a larger online presence would allow us to do this, by reaching out to a global audience, and continuing to nurture our community relationships here at home." ~ LK.

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Word of mouth is priceless, so even if you are unable to donate financially, please consider sharing this campaign with friends/family/colleagues. That action is worth so much and I thank you.
  • Follow our Facebook event for images of rewards, campaign updates & more https://www.facebook.com/events/1716565745269411

story:
Savor Cookies: Different From the Beginning


Savor Fine Foods came to life just over 5 years ago from the creative mind of Andre Kreft. He worked as a visual artist in the San Francisco Bay Area for 25 years, but returned to Connecticut to be closer to family, which included getting married. Andre and his husband bought a large house in Waterbury in order to spend more time with Andre's mother. But as we know, even the best laid plans can take a different turn, and fourteen months later both Andre's mother and husband had passed away.

At the time, Andre had began experimenting with baking. Not sure which direction this newfound passion would take him,  developing Savor gave him a way to move on. Andre used his skills as a visual artist to allow his sense of taste to heighten. He often mentions how he began to be able to “see” how different flavors rose on the tongue. 

From humble beginnings of baking in a friend's rented restaurant kitchen after hours, to now baking over 50,000 cookies a week, none of us could have imagined the growth and scope of Savor Cookies. We have outgrown our warehouse space in Watertown as well as our shared kitchen in New Preston, CT. Savor is now in need of your help to build a warehouse and kitchen, as well as a modest retail space.

One Cohesive Center for Savor Fine Foods!

Here are the details:

  • We currently travel 20 miles to and from our shared kitchen space, back to the warehouse in Watertown, and then pack up our cars and vans to go to different events. We have no storefront or retail space where customers are able to purchase cookies.
  • In Thomaston, CT, an area central to many of our customers, we have found a space that will perfectly suit our needs of a kitchen, warehouse, and storefront.
  • We currently have signed a lease on this space and have some funding already!
  • We need $30,000 in order to complete this endeavor! This funding will go towards building a kitchen and preparing the building to be the new home of Savor!

Eat Local, Eat Different

At Savor, we truly believe in the far-reaching benefits of eating, working, and supporting businesses locally. Aside from our charity work, we provide local jobs and use local ingredients in our cookies as much as we can. Some of the small, local ingredients we use include:

  • Salemme Hot Peppers, Chesire CT
  • Maple Syrup, Crowhill Sugarhouse, Northfield CT
  • Beets and Fennel, Falls Creek Farm, Oneco, CT
  • Birch Beer, Avery's Soda, New Britain, CT

We Need You!

Savor would not be where it is today without the support of our wonderful customers and people like you! With your help, we can triple our production, create local jobs, meet customer demand, and make our cookies more available both state- and nationwide!

We are offering exclusive perks for all donations over $10! Savor appreciates your help and support in this new adventure!

Other Ways You Can Help

Can't donate but still want to support Savor's new journey?

  • Like us on Facebook, invite your friends to like us too!
  • Share this page with your friends and family!
story_txt:
Savor Cookies: Different From the Beginning
Savor Fine Foods came to life just over 5 years ago from the creative mind of Andre Kreft. He worked as a visual artist in the San Francisco Bay Area for 25 years, but returned to Connecticut to be closer to family, which included getting married. Andre and his husband bought a large house in Waterbury in order to spend more time with Andre's mother. But as we know, even the best laid plans can take a different turn, and fourteen months later both Andre's mother and husband had passed away. At the time, Andre had began experimenting with baking. Not sure which direction this newfound passion would take him,  developing Savor gave him a way to move on. Andre used his skills as a visual artist to allow his sense of taste to heighten. He often mentions how he began to be able to “see” how different flavors rose on the tongue.  From humble beginnings of baking in a friend's rented restaurant kitchen after hours, to now baking over 50,000 cookies a week, none of us could have imagined the growth and scope of Savor Cookies. We have outgrown our warehouse space in Watertown as well as our shared kitchen in New Preston, CT. Savor is now in need of your help to build a warehouse and kitchen, as well as a modest retail space. 
  One Cohesive Center for Savor Fine Foods!  Here are the details:  We currently travel 20 miles to and from our shared kitchen space, back to the warehouse in Watertown, and then pack up our cars and vans to go to different events. We have no storefront or retail space where customers are able to purchase cookies. 
 In Thomaston, CT, an area central to many of our customers, we have found a space that will perfectly suit our needs of a kitchen, warehouse, and storefront.
We currently have signed a lease on this space and have some funding already!
 We need $30,000 in order to complete this endeavor! This funding will go towards building a kitchen and preparing the building to be the new home of Savor!
    Eat Local, Eat Different
 At Savor, we truly believe in the far-reaching benefits of eating, working, and supporting businesses locally. Aside from our charity work, we provide local jobs and use local ingredients in our cookies as much as we can. Some of the small, local ingredients we use include:  Salemme Hot Peppers, Chesire CT
 Maple Syrup, Crowhill Sugarhouse, Northfield CT Beets and Fennel, Falls Creek Farm, Oneco, CT
Birch Beer, Avery's Soda, New Britain, CT
    We Need You!
  Savor would not be where it is today without the support of our wonderful customers and people like you! With your help, we can triple our production, create local jobs, meet customer demand, and make our cookies more available both state- and nationwide! 
We are offering exclusive perks for all donations over $10! Savor appreciates your help and support in this new adventure!
  Other Ways You Can Help Can't donate but still want to support Savor's new journey?   Like us on Facebook, invite your friends to like us too!
 Share this page with your friends and family!

story:
***ALL CONTRIBUTORS RECIEVE A 10% DISCOUNT CARD AS A SPECIAL THANK YOU FROM US! 

Three friends come together to provide handcrafted, thoughtful holistic skincare.

Kalón, which means "beautiful thing" in the Ancient Greek lexicon, is a long-distance collaboration between three friends who at one point all called Brooklyn home. Jessica remains in Brooklyn, while Mary and Caroline live in Atlanta and Connecticut, respectively.

Mary and Caroline independently began making their own natural, holistic body care products to address their skin issues that commercially available and prescription products could not address or would make worse through the use of harsh chemicals and preservatives. Through their mutual bestie, Jessica, the two met and shared their love for essential oils, nourishing vegetable oils, ethical and holistic living, and the Ancient Greek lexicon and mythology. Jessica, the savvy marketer and forever tester of Mary's and Caroline's creations, suggested that the three embark on their own business adventure. Through the use of modern technology the three began having virtual meetings and collaborated on ideas remotely. They quickly established a vision of their ethical and holistic approach to body care and are currently carrying it out through their ETSY shop and website, kalonbotanicals.com.


Our Mission 
At KALON Botanicals, we constantly aim to provide all people with the best in holistic skincare.  We formulate our products with the whole person and the whole of nature in mind by carefully choosing natural botanical ingredients and sourcing our materials from companies that have similar ethical standards of fairness, transparency, and sustainability. We work to keep you and this earth beautiful! 

What We Need & What You Get

Why we need your help

Any business has start-up costs, but we want to do more than just have a basic brick and mortar shop that focuses on selling a product. Our desire is to educate, learn, and to be conscientious business owners, making products that are ethically sourced and created mindfully and patiently. This is not an inexpensive endeavor.  

We are hoping to raise $20,000 to help pay for: 

  1. Ethical, organic, natural, ingredients including essential oils, natural base oils, soaps, and herbs
  2. Sustainable packaging, including UV-blocking glass bottles, steel tins made in the USA, and biodegradable, recyclable, and reusable natural paper products 
  3. Production costs, including the space and the tools needed to make our products
  4. Legal licensing for wholesale and trademarking 
  5. Marketing, travel, and outreach to help build our brand 
  6. Website maintenance 


What you get out of it! 

With your support, we will be able to do many great things for our business and brand. You will be helping us work towards being an impactful presence in the skin care community, so we want to give you something back. We have an assortment of beautiful and exciting prizes, including our handmade balms, scrubs, and oils, as well as hand printed tote bags, handmade tarot cards, and many other goodies! Also, all contributors receive a 10% discount card to use on all Kalón items as a special thank you from us! 
For our largest contributors, we will meet with you and  customize a complete aromatherapeutic experience for your body and your home. 


If we do not reach our goal... 

While our goal is to raise the entire $20,000, we understand that this goal may not be reached. Regardless of the level of funds we raise, all proceeds will go towards the development and continued creation of ethically produced sustainable skin care in line with our mission. 


The Impact

We are providing products that are very thoughtfully crafted in a way that preserves the integrity of the natural world and the conscientious consumer. It is our mission to make sure that everything we do is beneficial, not only to the people who use our products, but also those involved in the sourcing of the materials we use at every level. We live in a critical time, where caring about the environment is more important than ever. We are not about following a "green" trend, but rather about making a meaningful impact on our environment, both in our immediate surroundings and the larger world. We wish to promote a respectful and sustainable connectivity, recognizing that our actions do not just affect us, but all of those involved, from our customers to our purveyors to those who grow, forage, and make the ingredients we use. 

We have been very diligent about educating ourselves not only when is comes to aspects of this particular industry, but also practical principles of ethics, particularly when it comes to making holistic and natural products in this global economy. 


Risks & Challenges

There are many companies that are making very similar products. One of our greatest challenges in achieving our goal is educating people about how we are different and unique, particularly when it comes to the conscientious decisions we make for packaging and sourcing our ingredients, all of which is in line with our philosophy and mission. 

All business ventures have risks, but we have faith in one another and in our dream to have an impact beyond the beauty industry, and help people become more thoughtful and tender consumers by inspiring an awareness of the connectivity of our world, especially concerning the products we buy. 

We are constantly researching and learning everything we can about sourcing, creating, and marketing. We are always open to new ideas and changes in the face of challenge, but we always hold fast to our core mission to uphold high ethical standards. 


Other Ways You Can Help

It's okay if you can't financially contribute to our cause, but that doesn't mean you can't help! Spread the word! Follow us on Instagram, Twitter, Facebook, and check out our blog on our website, kalonbotanicals.com. And share all this information with your friends, not just about Kalón, but about mindful consumption and the benefits of choosing ethically sourced and sustainable products. 

Thank you for spending time to get to know our campaign!!!!
