story:
"We  need to come together and support our seniors. They are not a burden but an asset. As soon as we recognize that WE are the author of change in our communities we can start healing each community one at a time "


Please meet my mother, Betty Smith and hear her story.

In 2013 my mother Betty Smith was a victim of violent crime. She was approached by a person at her own place of residence at gunpoint demanding her money. When my mother explained she didn't have any money to give him, he pointed the weapon at my mother and pulled the trigger. Fortunately the gunman's weapon malfunctioned, the bullets fell to the ground and the punk simply ran off. As you can imagine she was extremely terrified. Can you imagine this happening to your mother? I can tell you it's not a welcoming feeling! Instead of getting angry I started working towards some goals. It's been nearly 4 years now but the feeling still hurts my heart to the core. I vowed I'd take a stand against crimes of this nature as soon as I was in position to do so. I'm now the new owner operator of my own Private Protection Agency. I strongly believe I have what it takes to make a difference in my community. I'm sure we all have elderly people that we love and cherish. I'm talking about our family members, our friends and our acquaintances, we want the best for them especially in regards to their safety. They play a big part of each and everyone of our lives. Let's be honest people, when someone we care about is victimized we all feel victimized. Crime doesn't come with a manual and it definitely doesn't discriminate. I wasn't able to be there for my mother that terrifying day, but I want to make sure I'm there for someone else's loved one. No one should have to live in fear or be taken advantage of because they're considered weak. My questions to a potential contributor is "What if this was your mother or someone you loved?" or better yet"What would you do to help prevent this from happening to your loved one?"

I ask these questions because it really never really seems to hit home until it affects you directly. This is not just the victims problem, its all of our problem. We need to get a plan in place to show our seniors we understand the frustration and were here to give our support. No one knows what tomorrow will bring. If 1.8 million seniors are victimized each year, how long will it be before this problem reaches someone you love? Now that's the true question. It hit home for me in a huge unexpected way already, that's why I'm so passionate about this campaign.  

Talking about it won't change a thing, but strapping up your boots and hitting the ground running will, I'm a strong believer in action speaking louder than words and honestly, I think we've talked about it long enough!  My primary target for this campaign is addressing the issues of property and violent crimes against the elderly community.

Your donations will not only help us provide private patrol services in the community, it also helps us send a message to our local senior citizens saying "we recognize the problem and we care". 

I've completed the steps to acquire the necessary license and city permits to operate in the state of California, City of Bakersfield. I also exhausted all my funds in doing so. That's why your support will be greatly appreciated. I believe if we all look into our hearts and support this campaign the sky is the limit.

Contributions :

If we reach our goal of $50,000 here's the breakdown of what the funds will be used for:

$18,000 = 4 Patrol vehicles $4,500 Ea.

$15,000 = Build a team

$5,000  = Radio Communications

$4,000 = Required Armed guard Insurance

$3,000 = Fuel expense

$2,500 = Uniforms and equipment (Belts, badges, utility belts, batons, mace, handcuffs, etc.)

$2,500 = Safety, prevention, awareness and self defense classes will be offered to local residence. The instructor is a retired LAPD officer of 25 years, who will conduct continuous education and support.

My goal is to expand throughout Kern County and surrounding areas. Please join us and be apart of something special. If you can't donate money that's okay! There are plenty of things you can still do to help, like sharing this campaign using Indiegogo's share tools to inform friends and family to increase notoriety. You can even get motivated and start campaigning  in your own community and help out. I want this to spread like wildfire. This is a much needed service and an asset to the people of Bakersfield. We're dedicated to improving the quality of life for senior citizens one community at time.


Statistical reality:

According to the National Crime Victimization Survey (NCVS)
  • 1,796,740 senior citizens are victimized every year
  • 84% of the crimes against seniors go unreported
  • 59% of elderly violent crimes are reported near or at their own homes. According to the Department Of Justice (D.O.J)
  • The US Government estimates 5 million seniors are victims every year
  • Property crimes against seniors are an estimated 13-1.
  • The vast majority of crimes against senior citizens total 93% in the areas of robbery, auto theft, burglary and property damage. 7% are victims of violent crime.
Additional compelling stories:
  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=PDzI6CiPdVQ
  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=xQGz1GT7JsE
  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=85I0Q00uRfw
  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=2Kig8kFMrNQ
  https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=Fb5zKIqrYLo

Help us bring back the smiling faces and a safe sense of security in the community. I believe they deserve it don't you?

story:
People with disability in Latvia... Latvia is a part of the European Union, but people with special needs don’t get sufficient governmental support, there is not any common culture or social center for people with special needs in Riga. One does not see a problem until the problem meets one face to face. So that’s why we have founded the volunteer organization MOTUS VITA to provide support for people affected by neuromuscular diseases and their families. Many social projects have been implemented and now we have a new common big dream and goal – to build a culture center to provide MOTUS VITA members wider possibilities for personality development: to have a place to meet friends, to study, to create. We want to feel needed, to brighten our lives with colors, to show our talents. We know how to make this dream come true, we are ready to act for a long-term perspective, and we just need financial support to start.

Why Do We Need It

The fact is that the majority of people with special needs in Latvia stay at home almost for their whole lives. Those people feel embarrassed about their disability, find themselves outcast. They are not able either to develop or to apply their skills, to make their dreams come true, though every one of them deep inside wishes desperately to live a full life. There are over 20 000 of such persons in the city of Riga, and in real world it is very difficult for them to find a place where they could feel right and useful member of this society.

Our organization has gained enough experience in solving specific problems of people with disability. There is wonderful, highly qualified teamable to solve tasks quickly and successfully. We need one hub within which our staff should be able to react with most efficient way to satisfy the needs of disabled people. A club which will provide possibilities for all-round development and unite people.

What Will We Do in the Club?

The experience has shown that involving disabled persons into creative, positive, and easy work is the most efficient way to solve the majority of their material difficulties, as well as social and psychological problems. That is why we wish to make regular the following programs in the implementation of which we have already gained know-how:

 Physiological support group 

Occupational training's in available professions.

Arttherapy. Trainingsinartcrafts. Exhibitions of own hand-made art objects.

Bibliotherapy. Literary creation. Literature readings. 

Music therapy. Concerts, events.

Meetings with interesting personalities. Personal experience exchange.

Drama group.

Ideas bank. Small entrepreneurship school.

What Advantages Will Bring the Club to the Disabled People?

The implementation of the idea of the club will mean a moral awakening of the society.

Every person has got an intellectual and creative potential, a need to be useful and important. So we want to give disabled people a possibility of personal development. We want to help those who are in difficulties, thus increasing their professional and creative potential. The club will make possible that the disabled people feel rightful members of the society, that they can work, show their talents.  

About Me

My name is Valeris Rakovs. Several years ago I was diagnosed with muscular atrophy. Doctors told me that it was a rear, incurable disease, and that my situation would just get worse with time. And there was nothing to do, just to take care, to avoid overwork.

How it comes, I thought, why it is not possible to do anything? That couldn’t be true! And I started collecting information about the disease, treatment and rehabilitation possibilities. People who faced the same problem in one way or another started to enter into my life: medical staff, patients and their families, goodhearted people who help persons like me. Thus, we decided to take problem solution into our own hands and founded in 2009 a non-governmental organization MOTUS VITA.

We understand our problems more than anyone else. We really want to solve them, to find real, not formal solutions, since those are our lives and our health. There are enough dynamic, creative, well educated persons in our organization.

During the 6 years of existence we managed to do a lot, our organization is constantly growing: we count about 130 members now and the majority of them are people with serious functional disability.

How Will Be Your Money Spent

  • Rental of premises
  • Purchase of equipment
  • Repair works of premises
  • Operating assets
  • Car 

We plan to attain self-sufficiency in one year after the launch of the club.

name is Valeris Rakovs. Several years ago I was diagnosed with muscular atrophy.
Doctors told me that it was a rear, incurable disease, and that my situation
would just get worse with time. And there was nothing to do, just to take care,
to avoid overwork.
How
it comes, I thought, why it is not possible to do anything? That couldn’t be true!
And I started collecting information about the disease, treatment and
rehabilitation possibilities. People who faced the same problem in one way or
another started to enter into my life: medical staff, patients and their families,
goodhearted people who help persons like me. Thus, we decided to take problem
solution into our own hands and founded in 2009 a non-governmental organization
MOTUS VITA.
We
understand our problems more than anyone else. We really want to solve them, to
find real, not formal solutions, since those are our lives and our health.
There are enough dynamic, creative, well educated persons in our organization.
During
the 6 years of existence we managed to do a lot, our organization is constantly
growing: we count about 130 members now and the majority of them are people
with serious functional disability.

How
Will Be Your Money Spent



Rental
of premises


Purchase
of equipment


Repair
works of premises


Operating
assets


Car 


We
plan to attain self-sufficiency in one year after the launch of the club.

story:
Dear friends and patrons of Teance,

Join us in helping us grow!

For nearly 14 years, we at Teance have had the pleasure of your patronage and support. We have been humbled by the enthusiasm and genuine joy of our shared experience. With your participation, we accomplished our original vision: to introduce to our community an authentic and unique tea experience. We only sourced directly from the best artisanal tea farmers in Asia and their thousand-year-old craft of making tea. Our goal was “from farm to cup”; to bring the sublime scent and exquisite taste of the perfect tea-leaf to your cup. One part of our business has been a teashop that embraced simple elegance as an anecdote to the day-to-day hurly-burly in the hopes of enriching all of our lives. From your feedback, the teashop is a welcome sanctuary, a source of education and a refuge –– the go-to shop for the finest teas and gifts found in few places in the country. Many people have told us how their lives have been touched positively by this experience, and we are very grateful to be part of such a wonderful community.

It’s time to grow. There are still many exciting stories we want to tell, great teas we want to introduce. We have ideas and plans on improving and elevating our experience even more. We would like to upgrade the teashop now to bring yet another level of experience to you. We need your help if we are to stay in Berkeley, and staying means upgrading. 

This current location in Berkeley does not provide enough profit margin for us to manage the upgrades without your help. In order to serve our current community and grow, we must expand our retail selection, develop our marketing initiatives, and upgrade the teashop (scroll down to see our planned upgrades).  These improvements require capital.

We are looking to raise $100,000 for the following uses:

1. $25,000 to upgrade fixtures and increase shelving space for more merchandising

2. $5,000 for improved signage and communications

3. $20,000 for operations (during remodel)

4. $25,000 for additional PR and marketing

5. $10,000 for videos and website improvements

6. $15,000 for new inventory

 Without adequate support, however, we may need to downsize, close the current shop in Berkeley, and simply sell on-line and wholesale until an opportunity arises for another more viable location  to open up. We have plans for other ventures (bringing our expertise to the current beverage market and elevating it as we have with tea), including possibly relocating to San Francisco in the future.

Your investment in the teashop, however generous or modest, could enable us to keep this tea icon in our community. Any donation is welcome, and we have some perks for those who would like to support us with more.

If we are able to raise only part of the funds, we will make a decision to either keep the store open with improvements or reinvest the funds into the company in general (as the market is rapidly changing and we need to keep up).  Note that if you elect to support us through one of the incentive programs, you will be able to receive your goods online even if we do not keep our Berkeley shop open. No matter what, we will continue to provide the best curated teas possible online or at another location. We hope that you can make a decision to help us no later than March 15th!

Please know that we would love nothing more than to be able to stay open and continue serving the community in Berkeley that we have come to know and love! Thanks to all of you who have shared your love of tea and your lives with us over the last 14 years. We appreciate your support and friendship and we hope to be able to continue serving all of you for many years to come!

Sincerely,

Winnie, Fu-Tung, and the broader Teance family

P.S. if you have trouble with Indiegogo, please email us at winnie@teance.com

story:
We are for Scottish Independence but we are a rainbow of nations when it comes to volunteers and supporters. Me myself is English, we have an american, canadian, polish, romanian, finish and a load of Scots trying to improve the way of life. We collect massively for Foodbank, a uk disgrace. We support and understand our refugees. We need now to concentrate on moving forward. We support the Catalans, we support the Greeks who the EU has let down very badly. Come on those expats in USA and Canada this is a project you can support, you might even get a crest on our wall.


Break it down for folks in more detail:

  • Explain how much funding you need and where it's going. Be transparent and specific-people need to trust you to want to fund you.
  • Tell people about your unique perks. Get them excited!
  • Describe where the funds go if you don't reach your entire goal.

The Impact

Feel free to explain more about your campaign and let people know the difference their contribution will make:

  • Explain why your project is valuable to the contributor and to the world.
  • Point out your successful track record with projects like this (if you have one).
  • Make it real for people and build trust.

Risks & Challenges

People value your transparency. Be open and stand out by providing insight into the risks and obstacles you may face on the way to achieving your goal.

  • Share what qualifies you to overcome these hurdles.
  • Describe your plan for solving these challenges.

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Ask folks to get the word out and make some noise about your campaign.
  • Remind them to use the Indiegogo share tools!

And that's all there is to it.

story:
The Swag Is In The Building!
Beer Swag Monthly is excited to announce the official launch of our monthly subscription box service. We are a fun and very affordable monthly box! We partner directly with craft breweries across the country to bring you truly unique beer swag each month. Your box will always consist of a craft brewery tshirt, a write-up about the featured brewery and 2-3 craft beer items such as koozies from craft breweries, stickers from craft breweries, beer soaps, bottle openers and more. We will never send generic merchandise, it will always come from craft breweries and craft beer companies!

Father and Son Combining Interests!
We are a team led by Father and Son, whose combined interests led to the creation of Beer Swag Monthly. One is an avid craft beer fan, trader and festival goer and the other is one who truly loves e-commerce and particularly the subscription business model. Together, we believe we have created a service we are not only passionate about, but that our subscribers will truly love.

Striving For Profit and For Purpose
As said in our video, we are not only striving for profit, but also purpose. My father has served in the military for over 30 years, so we value the service our military members have provided us. To show our respect and support we have decided to donate to the Wounded Warrior Project. We also believe in helping the youth of America, so we've decided to support The Kids in Need Foundation. 


How Will We Use The Funds?
We Have The Workplace Covered! We have already setup warehousing and a team dedicated to partnering with new breweries, packing and shipping, as well as working festivals and trade shows. Now we need your support, Indiegogo, to help market our service to the rest of the country. The majority of funds raised will go directly to marketing our service. We will be focusing on online/social media marketing and established craft beer publications. 

Follow Us On Instagram For Campaign Updates

CLICK HERE - Our Instagram Page

Risks and challenges

We understand there are various risks and challenges related to each business category. We have done extensive research and planning to limit the risks we encounter. We are fortunate enough to own our very own screen printing company, which will limit our risks in the tshirt area. Also, we have created numerous relationships with various suppliers to limit the risk of any accessories setbacks. We see our main risk as being able to sustain an adequate number of subscribers to keep Beer Swag Monthly running. With your help, Indiegogo, we can jump start this growth process, mass market our service, and devote ourselves to keeping our subscribers satisfied with our wide variety of craft beer products. Cheers!

story:
What is Steve Buresh's Cheesecake Store & Sandwich Shop all about?

After losing my job in 2011 I felt I was going to lose everything. I started the Cheesecake Store to help to support my family while I looked for a new job. Jobs were hard to obtain with such a high unemployment rate, at the time. So, I strapped on my boots and walked and talked The Cheesecake Store to anyone that would listen. With help from my friends I kept going. On my own, I built a website to sell my products.  In order for me to sell to the public, I used a community commercial-rental kitchen.  I transformed my family vehicle into the the Cheesecake mobile, which then became a certified mobile vendor vehicle! The rental kitchen I used was far away from home, so I really needed a closer shop so everyone in Chicago can stop and have a cheesecake jar ,an awesomely fresh meal and a place to sit and chat. This place is now my home in Plainfield Illinois, but there's so many people that want a Cheesecake Store and Sandwich Shop in their neighborhood. I focus on my fan's needs, my staffers well being, and the entire community surrounding my shop. I want to keep building and helping more communities in the Chicagoland area. 

Since I've exhausted most loan options with the banks and the Small Business Administration, I'm looking to all my great fans for help building the next store. You will forever be a part of my cheesecake family. 

What We Need & What You Get

The $75,000 that I am seeking will help me buy the basic equipment I need for the kitchen and chairs and tables for the dining area. I will have to find a location that is already health dept. certified and needs just paint and cleaning. It will cost over $150,000 to build a place from scratch. 

  • My plan for this funding is to purchase commercial kitchen equipment, retain a new location, painting and supplies, permits,tables, chairs, and supplies.
  • Even if I don't reach my funding goal, every little bit helps to get a step closer to making another store a reality in your community.
  • I've made some awesome perks for you helping me, and those are just the starting points. You will always be remembered as a part of my cheesecake family. with many more perks after these.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even if you can’t financially contribute, there are other ways to help:

  • Please help me get the word out and make some noise about my campaign.
  • Please use the Indiegogo share tools and Facebook share!
  • You can also message me if you would like to discuss helping out at fairs and events.

story:
Mead (n): a fermented beverage made of honey, water, yeast and sometimes fruit.  Nectar of the Gods. Floki’s fave.

While there are many great microbreweries and wine bars across the country, there are few that serve mead. Here in Santa Fe, a.k.a. “The City Different,” we’re living up to our city’s reputation by creating a taproom and gastropub that serves locally sourced mead, local micro-brewed beers and ciders. The local Falcon Meadery, which we are in the process of purchasing, will be the primary source of the mead we serve and, honoring mead’s history as the first fermented beverage made by man, we are creating The Root Cellar taproom to make you feel as though you've traveled back in time to drink your mead with the vikings... or Tyrion Lannister.

When you visit The Root Cellar we know you're going to want some delicious, expertly prepared food to accompany your mead, beer, or cider. The Root Cellar taproom will serve a new high-end gastropub menu created by Chef Greg Menke. 

Our Story

Chef Greg Menke owns The Beestro (open for four years now, a popular lunch spot with both locals and visitors) and The Hive Market in downtown Santa Fe.  Greg loves anything that has to do with honeybees and has successfully started and sold honey bee-centric businesses in both Santa Fe and Hawaii. He also holds a degree in culinary arts and his skills will be prominently on display in the new gastropub.

The Hive Market, which has been open for almost a year, sells artisan and craft items as well as unique local foods from New Mexico. We are committed to sustainability and selling goods that are made here. We believe it’s important to support other local businesses and most of the honey we sell is from northern New Mexico.

We’ve already raised a majority of the money required for the commercial kitchen, but we need a bit more to complete the build-out for that and for The Root Cellar. Our goal is to open by November 1, 2016.

What Will We Do With the Money You Give?

  • Buy equipment for the commercial kitchen:  walk-in freezer, refrigerator, convection oven, range:  $30,000
  • Build a refrigerated chill room for the mead: $11,000
  • Renovate the restrooms: $5,200
  • Furnish the bar – tables, chairs, bar equipment: $11,300
  • Plates, glasses, silverware, POS system, server station: $7,800
  • New lighting: $2,100
  • New floor: $8,000
  • Buy tables and chairs:  $8,000
  • Signage: $1,900

What You Get

We have many more perks than most campaigns. Here’s why: unfortunately we cannot ship mead everywhere in the United States yet, and some of you may prefer your honey straight up rather than in a beverage! For these reasons, in addition to our mead we are offering our local honey as a perk along with other honey related items that make for an attractive gift basket for the upcoming holidays.

 

We are also bundling a custom drinking horn and holder with several of our perks. These are custom made so the one you get may look slightly different than the one shown here.

 

For those who wish to sample Chef Greg’s gastronomic skills, we are offering custom dinners in the Root Cellar.

If you want to learn how to make mead, our head meadmaker at Falcon Meadery, David, will personally show you how it’s done.

If you are a mead hobbyist and think you have a killer recipe, submit it and David will recreate it. The Hive Market team will sample and select the two best recipes and those drinks will be named after their creators and served in the Root Cellar.

Possible Risks

The opening of the taproom is contingent on us getting a liquor license. The location was previously home to two bars so we are confident we will receive the license. We have already applied and should have a firm answer in mid-September.

Medieval Fun

For locals and out of town visitors who may be in Santa Fe on September 17 and 18th, come see us at the Santa Fe Renaissance Fair, a celebration of all things medieval at Los Golindrinas. Stop by the Falcon Mead booth and enjoy a glass of mead!

Please help us reach our goal of creating a world-class mead taproom and gastropub, the only one in New Mexico. And if you know of anyone who might be interested in our project and perks, please send them to this Indiegogo campaign and share the love!

story:
What's it all about?

Let's face it, there are very few people that haven't craved a Greggs sausage roll but lacked the Sunday morning motivation to walk to the nearest bakery, or how about those times you wish you could have a McDonalds at 2am but don't have a car - or perhaps you've ran out of loo roll, juice or cigarettes and can't get to the local shop.

That's where MyLocalShop.co.uk comes in, a brand new service that enables anyone to order what they need online, pay in one simple step and have it delivered within 90 minutes of ordering by a friendly, chirpy delivery expert.

  • We pick up orders from multiple shops and combine them in one delivery.
  • Operating 24/7 to bring customers what they want, when they want it.
  • Whether it's groceries, beverages, fast food or party supplies, we'll deliver it.
  • We need your help to enable us to launch on a running start with comprehensive advertising campaigns, delivery networks and retailer partnerships.

The big supermarkets may offer home delivery - but they certainly don't offer same day delivery for those much needed items - we aim to help people to shop local from their own home, supporting local retailers, customers and delivery jobs.


What We Need & What You Get

To enable us to hit the ground running and offer a truly great service, we need your help in raising vital marketing and working capital funds, spreading the word and attracting Joe and Josephine Public to our service. 

Here's how it breaks down:

  • £2,000 working capital (This is the funds our drivers will use to initially purchase items for customers on specially formed company prepaid purchasing cards.)
  • £1,500 on legal, production and creative fees.
  • £1,950 on Phonebox advertising, including production & VAT.
  • £8,900 on Bus Shelter advertising, including production & VAT.
  • £6,500 on Prime Billboard advertising, including production & VAT.
  • £2,500 on Leaflet production & distribution to households & VAT.
  • £2,000 on Local Radio advertising, including production & VAT.
  • £3,650 on Local TV advertising, including production & VAT.
  • £2,000 on Local Newspaper advertising, including production & VAT.
  • £2,500 on Digital advertising (Google Adwords, Gumtree etc)
  • £1,000 on Driver Recruitment and background vetting.
  • £500 on an automated SMS notification system & Virtual SMS number.


We have worked out a strong plan of attack for our advertising campaigns with a team of marketing professionals, we also have our own in-house web and creative professionals which helps us to save costs on these areas and software.

We are strongly confident that all of our marketing spend will result in a greatly inflated return in service take-up and usage from local consumers.

Your Contribution

By contributing to this campaign and helping us to fund a comprehensive launch marketing campaign, you will be part of a growing revolution of local shopping services, helping to launch what we intend to be the market leader in the UK for local grocery and fast food delivery.

Risks & Challenges

No business comes without it's risks and challenges, but it's how you manage and control them that matters. Our team have over 25 years combined experience within the catering, logistics, hospitality and marketing industries - meaning that we're confidently ready to handle any challenges and make the service a real success.

We plan on launching in major UK cities in the first instance, in which we will take our learning, knowledge and experience to cultivate a highly successful service which will later be rolled out to almost every corner of every nation within the UK. 

Other Ways You Can Help

We understand that not everyone can afford to help fund our campaign, but don't worry, there are plenty of other ways you can help us deliver a first class service.

  • Share our campaign on social media and tell your friends about us.
  • Sign up to receive email newsletters and keep up to date with developments.
  • Become a loyal customer when we launch in August 2016.
  • Become one of our friendly, swift delivery drivers with your car, van, motorbike or cyclebike.

Email us at indiegogo@mylocalshop.co.uk.
Visit us at www.mylocalshop.co.uk

We are a Registered UK company:

Registered Company Number: SC537187
VAT Registration Number: 242 0495 30
story_txt:
What's it all about? Let's face it, there are very few people that haven't craved a Greggs sausage roll but lacked the Sunday morning motivation to walk to the nearest bakery, or how about those times you wish you could have a McDonalds at 2am but don't have a car - or perhaps you've ran out of loo roll, juice or cigarettes and can't get to the local shop.That's where MyLocalShop.co.uk comes in, a brand new service that enables anyone to order what they need online, pay in one simple step and have it delivered within 90 minutes of ordering by a friendly, chirpy delivery expert.  We pick up orders from multiple shops and combine them in one delivery. Operating 24/7 to bring customers what they want, when they want it. Whether it's groceries, beverages, fast food or party supplies, we'll deliver it.
We need your help to enable us to launch on a running start with comprehensive advertising campaigns, delivery networks and retailer partnerships.  The big supermarkets may offer home delivery - but they certainly don't offer same day delivery for those much needed items - we aim to help people to shop local from their own home, supporting local retailers, customers and delivery jobs.

   What We Need & What You Get To enable us to hit the ground running and offer a truly great service, we need your help in raising vital marketing and working capital funds, spreading the word and attracting Joe and Josephine Public to our service. Here's how it breaks down:  £2,000 working capital (This is the funds our drivers will use to initially purchase items for customers on specially formed company prepaid purchasing cards.)

story:
Hello and welcome to the Burl MFG campaign, we are Dailon and Liam Checkler. We are brothers born and raised in Columbus, Ohio and we have formed a small design and fabrication company focused on home goods and furniture. Through this campaign, we are raising money to help grow our company. With the nature of our work, we have an endless list of machinery that we hope to purchase to further our ability, from a fabrication standpoint. Your contribution will help us reach that goal, and allow us to purchase each resource we need to expand our ability and our company.

Our goal is to reach $10,000, which will aid in the purchasing of machinery. We are small, but we are diverse in our ability and can work with a wide range of material- from wood, to concrete, to metal. Because of the diversity in our ability, we are able to create a range of products, but this diversity also requires a range of machinery. Regardless of how much you can give, or whether we reach our goal, all of the money we raise will go toward this goal, and provide us with the resources necessary for success. 

Our priority is to bring Columbus, Ohio products designed and fabricated with local material that is responsibly sourced. We want to bring a special experience to each customer purchasing our products. We love working with our customers to create custom products. Recently, we worked with the Webber family on a massive table, with the strength to endure the wear and tear of children, and can be the home to huge gatherings for holidays in the years to come. 

With your support we can bring these experiences back to Columbus, and back to America. If you can't donate that doesn't mean you can't help. We ask that you spread the word about this campaign, and our company Burl MFG.

story:
About Us and Our Philosophy

The Gypsy Rose Boutique is a mother-daughter small business committed to protecting the environment as we educate through art and connect with our community through nature by our sales of handmade natural products and art, such as jewelry, photography and more.

Our Mother, Carol, was born with a gypsy soul. In her past life, she traveled the country with other like-minded people by helping with their adventures and turned to making her own wares on the side. She eventually tamed her traveling spirit to settle down and start her family. She continued her sales career full time for the next 30 years and earned a Master's Degree of Education in Curriculum and Instruction.

Our daughter, Kristen, was born with the same kind of spirit and was always "on the go," as her mother and even grandmother were before her. Kristen gained inspiration from her elders to create her own wares and began selling them to friends throughout her time in school as a child. As she began her sales career at 16, she started learning more about business and her retail sales career progressed over the next 14 years. During her college years, Kristen began focusing more on business and learning about the environment and nature through Natural Science study.

As our Mother was nearing retirement and our daughter suffered a tragedy that stopped her retail career suddenly in 2013, an idea was born. They went back to their traveling, ware making roots. Though successfully selling their products online and in the community individually, they realized they were replicating their efforts and needed more efficiency. 

In May 2016, they combined their ideas and efforts to create The Gypsy Rose Boutique. Currently, The Gypsy Rose Boutique has reached out to the community more than ever through pop-up markets, online markets and social media to sell their natural products and to educate others about the importance and beauty of our environment. The Gypsy Rose Boutique was welcomed with open arms and invited to sell their natural products at local artist markets and the Galveston Art League for display of their nature, topography and other landscape photography. 

The Gypsy Rose Boutique has grown substantially over the last few months online. Website and marketplace traffic and sales have increased, social media following and engagement continues to grow, and the community is not only becoming more aware of the boutique, but also what we stand for.

The Gypsy Rose Boutique is about promoting the conserving and admiring of nature through our natural handmade jewelry and other products. We believe in supporting other small businesses by ensuring we are purchasing natural materials from them that are made or sold in the USA. We carefully review the regions where our materials are mined or imported and do our best to choose local suppliers that are as conscientious about their products as we are about ours.

The Gypsy Rose Boutique's philosophy is to be as environmentally-friendly as possible and to minimize our carbon footprint. We not only hand make our products and use natural materials, we also find vintage items to resell or repurpose. We keep our operations as efficient as possible. We are nearly paperless and completely mobile. We ensure are trucks are in good repair to minimize mobile emissions, only use as much electricity as necessary for our mobile community sales to do our part to help reduce point source emissions and follow the nature-respecting philosophy of "leave no trace."

We want to continue our philosophy and take The Gypsy Rose Boutique to the next level, but we will need some help from you.

  • We are requesting assistance with covering the purchase a cargo trailer and its set up as a truly mobile boutique. 

​

We believe this addition of the cargo trailer will help us reach out to more people in our community, further educate about the importance of preserving our environment and improve our efficiency by:

  • Allowing us to display more items that need protection from the Gulf Coast weather.
  • Including more educational type items with the additional protected space.
  • Easing the strenuous physical setup and take down efforts required for a mobile pop-up boutique.
  • Further reducing our impact on the environment by reducing the need for multiple vehicle trips to load and unload equipment and products for pop-up market shows.

The Gypsy Rose Boutique will be able to focus more on our community with this addition of a cargo trailer. Your contributions will not only help us achieve our business goals, but will help make our community more nature savvy and environmentally aware by helping us demonstrate that environmentally-friendly business is possible and natural handmade products are also budget-friendly for consumers.

Our Goal is to Raise $12,500 for Our Trailer

We're aiming to raise enough funding, with your help, to assist with our purchase a cargo trailer and its setup as a mobile boutique trailer. Everything will cost approximately $12,500 total. This will help us get on the road with a fully functional, well planned and designed mobile boutique trailer.

What $12,500 will help us achieve:

  • $3,334.10 for the Covered Wagon Brand 6x12 Cargo Trailer w/o Living Quarters 
    • Includes taxes, title, license and other fees.
    • Purchased through a local small business Texas Trailer Country.
    • Covered Wagon is a small business, USA built trailers, in Fitzgerald, Georgia.
    • This model is made of a lightweight aluminum shell, steel tube framing, plywood interior finishing and has a solid metal roof without skylights (prone to leaking) to better protect the interior. It is a base model without extras.
  • $300.94 for an EAZ-Lift Sway Control Bar w/ Weight Distribution Hitch
    • Includes sale price and taxes.
    • PPL RV Parts Superstore is a local small business.
    • Helps increase the vehicle control of the trailer while towing on the road.
  • $350 for 36x72 Magnetic Boutique Trailer Signs (if possible)
    • Estimated price only.
    • Sign Quick is a local small business. (We love Larry!)
    • Helps identify our boutique when at local shows and markets.
    • Removable magnetic signs help protect the identity of contents inside trailer while not in service.
  • $6,000 Budget for Interior Mobile Market Build
    • Provides a budget for a functional mobile retail design setup.
      • Shelving, seating, work/checkout space, retail displays, mobile anchoring of fixtures, apparel vanity fixtures, educational additions and other items that may be needed to complete the design and setup for the mobile boutique trailer.
    • This amount is flexible. It may be more or less, depending on the actual cost of other priority items.

  • $500 for iPad Mini 4 Wi-Fi Only for Retail Point Of Sale (POS) System
    • Tax is included with estimate. Apple.com offers free shipping.
    • Used as a dedicated retail POS system for Mobile Boutique.
    • To be used with the Square Windfall Retail POS Kit only.
    • Will be registered and activation locked to the boutique's Apple ID.
  • $828 for the Square Windfall Stand Kit for iPad 3 or iPad 4 and Accessories
    • Includes free shipping and tax isn't charged.
    • $626 Windfall kit includes: (Price included in the $828 total.)
      • Square contactless and chip reader
      • 25 rolls of bluetooth receipt printer paper
      • Bluetooth receipt printer

      • Heckler Windfall Stand for Apple iPad 2, 3 or 4

    • Accessories added for additional customer convenience, payment security and retail card chip regulation compliance: (Prices included in the $828 total.)
      • $109 for 14 inch cash drawer (APG VP320-BL1416)
      • $49 for security lock, wire + anchor point (Kensington ClickSafe Lock)
      • $29 for square contactless and chip reader dock
      • $15 for recommended rating Belkin USB wall charger

  • $686.96 to help with additional natural materials to increase our inventory stock.
    • This amount will help us purchase additional natural materials to create more products to add to our current inventory.
    • We currently have 161 active listings in our online market at The Gypsy Rose Boutique.
    • We have close to 50 additional vintage items in our inventory that are not online.
    • We are currently creating more items with the materials we have, but will need a boost to help purchase more materials to complete a mobile boutique trailer.
    • This amount is also flexible. The amount may be more or less, depending on what is left after everything else is covered.
  • $500 to help cover the fees assessed by Indiegogo and PayPal.
    • This amount will be dependent on contributions raised, since it's a percentage.
    • If we reach our funding goal, great! Thank you!
    • If we don't reach our funding goal, the fees are less. Thank you!
    • If we exceed our goal, the additional fees will be covered by the excess amount raised. Thank you a lot!!!

Finally, The Perks!

We're offering an assortment of cool perks to you, our Gypsy Angels! All contributors will be added to our Gypsy Angel list in which we'll display inside our boutique trailer, anonymously or by name!

  

 

 

What Happens If We Don't Reach Our Goal

We're grateful to have the opportunity to reach out to the crowdfunding community and connect with backers. It's an amazing and exciting experience for us!

We realize many businesses and ideas never make it past conceptualization. We're grateful and appreciative to our customers, friends and support group (our men behind our boutique) that we've made it this far as an online and local pop-up mobile boutique. 

If we don't reach our entire goal, we'll put what funds we do receive towards the purchase of the Covered Wagon Cargo Trailer at Texas Trailer Country (it's the best deal in our greater metropolitan area).

Anything additional we may receive will go towards what we absolutely need to get the mobile boutique trailer up and running. We have some items and systems from our pop-up mobile boutique that we will convert to the trailer, as we plan to use anyways.

The Impact

Your contributions will impact the community and the environment in so many little ways that will help inspire others for generations to come.

You will be helping:

  • Educate others about our environment.
  • Inspire others to focus on environmentally-friendly businesses and lifestyles.
  • Show the affordability of natural and USA made products to communities.
  • Demonstrate support for local, environmentally-friendly, small businesses.

Local Economics and Our Deliverance of Your Impact

The mobile truck sales industry has made a comeback over the last decade and is still growing. Businesses are enjoying the freedom and affordability mobile sales offers, consumers love the benefit of mobile purchasing and are beginning to demand the convenience mobile shopping and dining offer them. The mobile fashion and food trucks of today are increasing consumer buying and trust!

Read: Fashion Trucks Takeover Downtown Houston

We have a strong small business and artist community in the Greater Houston/Galveston area. Houston has become major hub for the arts, shopping and dining which spans to the suburban and outlying areas. More markets and festivals are popping up each weekend all over the region, year round, which is starting to position the Greater Houston/Galveston area into competition with our Austin neighbor.

We understand our online and community market. We're confident that we can live up to the expectations and demands mobile shopping consumers desire. We just need a little of your assistance to help us reach out to them in the most environmentally and economically friendly way possible.

Overcoming Challenges

Everything comes with risks and challenges whether money is involved or not. We have assumed a lot of the major risks so far just by returning to our ware making roots and it did come with some unique challenges as well.

  • We weren't sure if our current friends and neighbors would be as receptive as the ones prior were.
    • We tried and succeeded!
  • We had to learn the challenges of internet systems and other technology to sell online and through social media organically.
    • We are continuing to demonstrate our ability to do so on:
      • Etsy
      • Our website (Powered by Etsy)
      • Facebook Page
      • Facebook Group
      • Twitter
      • Instagram
      • and more to come!
  • We had to research how to reach out to the community through artist and boutique markets. 
    • We found them and are friends with market and festival organizers!
  • We overcame the challenges of avoiding plastics and other environmentally harmful man-made materials which are cheaply produced through outsourcing to foreign countries.
    • We found genuinely natural suppliers locally and in the USA by researching online and learning from our community. Now, they are our suppliers!
  • We need to be more readily available to our community market in desire and we don't have a storefront.
    • We're reaching out to you to help us raise enough funding for our cargo trailer and mobile boutique setup!

The entire process of establishing an environmentally-friendly, handmade boutique resulted from personal challenges we overcame. Our mother retired and our daughter was injured in a major, not at fault, auto accident with an on-duty State of Texas employee which left her without work, limited her ability to work because of spinal injuries and no transportation in 2013.

Our daughter sought to keep working by returning to her ware making roots combined with her education in natural sciences and retail experience. She carefully planned her next vehicle to keep in line with our mobile boutique trailer goals by purchasing a more environmentally-friendly truck and she is now working the boutique full-time.

Together, our Mother and Daughter overcame personal challenges which resulted in the successful creation of The Gypsy Rose Boutique.

There will always be challenges and risks. Going forward, we will tend and adjust to them as we have in the past. We know what our abilities and limitations are and we're savvy enough to find resources to help overcome obstacles. 

Reducing Risks by Maintaining Our Philosophy

We're very conscientious about finances and do our best to not over budget for what we absolutely need. We reduce your risk by reducing our risk - all naturally and in environmentally-friendly ways that are affordable to us, you (our contributors) and consumers! That's the beauty of The Gypsy Rose Boutique.

Other Ways You Can Help

We appreciate you taking the time to learn more about us as a small business and your consideration to contribute. Every penny and every effort from all of us counts towards educating and helping our environment.

We understand if you are not able to financially contribute, we've all been there. We would like to request you to contribute some of your efforts and time by:

  • Using the Indiegogo share tools to help us reach out to your network online.
  • Following and engaging with us online at the links above.
  • Telling your friends and family about The Gypsy Rose Boutique and where to find us online.
  • Supporting us through sales on our website or Etsy. 

We'll Keep You Updated

You can continue your journey with us through our social media links previously mentioned and right here. We'll keep you updated with our journey to becoming an environmentally-friendly, handmade mobile boutique on wheels!  So, stay tuned! It's going to be an amazingly fun ride!

Finally, The Perks!
We're offering an assortment of cool perks to you, our Gypsy Angels! All contributors will be added to our Gypsy Angel list in which we'll display inside our boutique trailer, anonymously or by name!
  

 

 
What Happens If We Don't Reach Our Goal
We're grateful to have the opportunity to reach out to the crowdfunding community and connect with backers. It's an amazing and exciting experience for us!
We realize many businesses and ideas never make it past conceptualization. We're grateful and appreciative to our customers, friends and support group (our men behind our boutique) that we've made it this far as an online and local pop-up mobile boutique. 
If we don't reach our entire goal, we'll put what funds we do receive towards the purchase of the Covered Wagon Cargo Trailer at Texas Trailer Country (it's the best deal in our greater metropolitan area).
Anything additional we may receive will go towards what we absolutely need to get the mobile boutique trailer up and running. We have some items and systems from our pop-up mobile boutique that we will convert to the trailer, as we plan to use anyways.

The Impact
Your contributions will impact the community and the environment in so many little ways that will help inspire others for generations to come.
You will be helping:


Educate others about our environment.

Inspire others to focus on environmentally-friendly businesses and lifestyles.

Show the affordability of natural and USA made products to communities.

Demonstrate support for local, environmentally-friendly, small businesses.


Local Economics and Our Deliverance of Your Impact
The mobile truck sales industry has made a comeback over the last decade and is still growing. Businesses are enjoying the freedom and affordability mobile sales offers, consumers love the benefit of mobile purchasing and are beginning to demand the convenience mobile shopping and dining offer them. The mobile fashion and food trucks of today are increasing consumer buying and trust!

Read: Fashion Trucks Takeover Downtown Houston
We have a strong small business and artist community in the Greater Houston/Galveston area. Houston has become major hub for the arts, shopping and dining which spans to the suburban and outlying areas. More markets and festivals are popping up each weekend all over the region, year round, which is starting to position the Greater Houston/Galveston area into competition with our Austin neighbor.

We understand our online and community market. We're confident that we can live up to the expectations and demands mobile shopping consumers desire. We just need a little of your assistance to help us reach out to them in the most environmentally and economically friendly way possible.


Overcoming Challenges
Everything comes with risks and challenges whether money is involved or not. We have assumed a lot of the major risks so far just by returning to our ware making roots and it did come with some unique challenges as well.

We weren't sure if our current friends and neighbors would be as receptive as the ones prior were.We tried and succeeded!

We had to learn the challenges of internet systems and other technology to sell online and through social media organically.
We are continuing to demonstrate our ability to do so on:
Etsy
Our website (Powered by Etsy)
Facebook Page
Facebook Group
Twitter
Instagram
and more to come!



We had to research how to reach out to the community through artist and boutique markets. We found them and are friends with market and festival organizers!

We overcame the challenges of avoiding plastics and other environmentally harmful man-made materials which are cheaply produced through outsourcing to foreign countries.We found genuinely natural suppliers locally and in the USA by researching online and learning from our community. Now, they are our suppliers!

We need to be more readily available to our community market in desire and we don't have a storefront.We're reaching out to you to help us raise enough funding for our cargo trailer and mobile boutique setup!


The entire process of establishing an environmentally-friendly, handmade boutique resulted from personal challenges we overcame. Our mother retired and our daughter was injured in a major, not at fault, auto accident with an on-duty State of Texas employee which left her without work, limited her ability to work because of spinal injuries and no transportation in 2013.
Our daughter sought to keep working by returning to her ware making roots combined with her education in natural sciences and retail experience. She carefully planned her next vehicle to keep in line with our mobile boutique trailer goals by purchasing a more environmentally-friendly truck and she is now working the boutique full-time.

Together, our Mother and Daughter overcame personal challenges which resulted in the successful creation of The Gypsy Rose Boutique.
There will always be challenges and risks. Going forward, we will tend and adjust to them as we have in the past. We know what our abilities and limitations are and we're savvy enough to find resources to help overcome obstacles. 
Reducing Risks by Maintaining Our Philosophy
We're very conscientious about finances and do our best to not over budget for what we absolutely need. We reduce your risk by reducing our risk - all naturally and in environmentally-friendly ways that are affordable to us, you (our contributors) and consumers! That's the beauty of The Gypsy Rose Boutique.

Other Ways You Can Help
We appreciate you taking the time to learn more about us as a small business and your consideration to contribute. Every penny and every effort from all of us counts towards educating and helping our environment.
We understand if you are not able to financially contribute, we've all been there. We would like to request you to contribute some of your efforts and time by:

Using the Indiegogo share tools to help us reach out to your network online.
Following and engaging with us online at the links above.
Telling your friends and family about The Gypsy Rose Boutique and where to find us online.
Supporting us through sales on our website or Etsy. 

We'll Keep You Updated
You can continue your journey with us through our social media links previously mentioned and right here. We'll keep you updated with our journey to becoming an environmentally-friendly, handmade mobile boutique on wheels!  So, stay tuned! It's going to be an amazingly fun ride!

story:
Vision

Our vision is to create a collaborative online spiritual community hub where one can find and give inspiration, services, connect with others, learn and educate. Evolving Binghamton or EvolveBing for short, will be such a place and we want you to be a part of it.

 

Spiritual Definition

We use the term spiritual broadly to be anything that enhances the experience of life. Religion can certainly be spiritual but spirituality does not have to be religious. Spiritual may mean meditation to some, a yoga class to others, reading a book can be a spiritual experience. Evolving Binghamton is for any and all of these and more. If it inspires you to share it is spiritual.

 

Experience

To the individual end user of the site it will be a place to check in daily for inspiration and opportunities to enhance their life through meaningful connection and spiritual community.

 

Details

The site will function as a blog, a directory and a resource of local events that are all spiritually inclined.

The setup will be to become financially self-sustaining only. There is no intention to become a for profit enterprise.

Anyone can contribute their article to be considered to the volunteer editorial staff. 

Posting of offerings within directory will be available for free and also paid for enhanced format and placement. Cost of enhanced listings can be mediated through contribution of articles.

Contributions will be used towards cost of procurement of domains, hosting, publishing platform and implementation.

story:
The Food

“Soul Food” is a term used for an ethnic cuisine, food traditionally prepared in Southern United States. The style originated during American slavery and has been passed down from generation. Molly’s Soulful Café looks to build on this tradition by continuing the recipes that Big Mama passed down to Marlo “Molly” Stroud.  

 

Meet Marlo 'Molly' Stroud

 

I love cooking! I love seeing my family and friends comforted by my cooking.  The biggest compliment is when they ask for seconds. I’ve been cooking as long as I can remember.  By age  9, I was cooking entire meals…from fried chicken with smothered potatoes and collard greens to homemade pancakes, waffles, and biscuits. 

Growing up I spent a lot of time with my grandparents and remember watching my grandmother, Big Mama prepare meals for our entire family. Basically, she taught me everything I know, and it's her recipes that I will be using at Molly’s Soulful Café.  

When she passed away in 2002, I took the lead in preparing family dinners, and seeing how much my family enjoyed the meals I realized just how well I could cook. They constantly told me my cooking reminded them of Big Mama’s and that I should open up my own restaurant so they could have the food all year long.  I loved the idea…I just knew I wasn’t moving back to Chicago, so I put the idea on the back burner. For the past 14 years I’ve focused on my career as a financial controller; however, my passion for cooking has not waned.  While my career has been fulfilling, it has not provided the pleasure and passion I feel when I'm in the kitchen and serving friends and family.  This is why I’ve decided to pursue my dream of opening up Molly’s Soulful Café. 

The Business

Molly’s Soulful Café is more than a passion project of Marlo “Molly” Stroud. Since relocating to Studio City, she has searched for a good soul food restaurant and has been unsuccessful which is why she plans to open Molly's on Ventura Blvd.  

Sherman Oaks has a population of over 60,000 people.  It is a family community with 51% reporting to be married.  It is an economically sound population with a median income of $69,651 and over 60% college graduates. It also has a thriving dining community but lacks the options for soul food cuisine. Add to this the growing diversity in the community and you have a recipe for success.

Molly’s Soulful Café looks to fill this gap in service. 

The Money

We project that the restaurant start-up costs will be $250,000 overall. These funds will cover the costs of formation, legal, accounting, furniture, fixtures, equipment, personnel, training and miscellaneous costs.  This will also help with continuing costs of salaries, rent, and insurance.  

Since incorporating earlier this year the team has been working hard to secure the funds required.  Our current commitments from friends, family, and Marlo herself have us at about 40% of our start-up costs.  We are in negotiations with investors that should help us reach 70 - 80% of our goal.  Your generous support will help us reach our ultimate goal and make Molly's Soulful Cafe a reality.  

Your donation and investment through this campaign will help us acquire equipment, permits, and licenses.  We feel confident, that with your support we will be able to reach our goal and open the doors to Molly's Soulful Café in January 2017.  

The Menu

 

Molly’s Soulful Café will host beer and wine tasting and serve up soul food staples like:

  • Baked macaroni and cheese
  • Roasted Chicken
  • Red beans and rice
  • Fried Chicken
  • Fried Catfish
  • Grilled and baked salmon
  • Collard greens with smoked turkey
  • Cornbread dressing
  • Candied Yams
  • Potato Salad
  • Fried Shrimp
  • Cream Cheese Pound Cake
  • Sweet Potato pie
  • Banana Pudding
  • Bread Pudding
  • Cornbread cakes
  • Homemade dinner rolls
  • Gravy
  • Blackeyed Peas
  • Coleslaw
  • Mashed potatoes
  • Beef ribs (smoked)
  • Corn on the cob
  • Baked yams/potatoes

Molly's Team

Owner/Cook: Marlo “Molly” Stroud has been cooking authentic soul food since she was a little girl. From hosting soul food Sundays at her studio city apartment for several years, catering for a 65 person worship team at her former church, to small movie sets Molly knows her way around the kitchen.  With over 14 years of corporate finance experience, she is well versed in financial management.

Restaurant Manager: Having graduated from The Hotel School at Cornell, with a major in Restaurant Entrepreneurship Rebekah has over 10 years experience in hospitality that includes: Hotel Management, Restaurant Management, and Human Resources.  She is well versed in California Labor laws based on her background in Human Resources and is also familiar with union working environments. Food is her passion and delivering excellent customer service is her niche.

Kitchen Manager: Mark has over 5 years of hotel and hospitality supervisory experience.  Winning Employee of the year from one of the top hotel companies in the world, we are happy to have him on our team.

 

    How You Can Help

    Thought you'd never ask! Please take advantage of one of our perks and help us spread the word.  We appreciate you sharing this page via any social media platforms (Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, Snapchat etc...), email, text and worth of mouth. We are grateful for your support and look forward to breaking bread with you!

story:
Short Summary

            Hi My name is Robert Jackson I am 24 years old and I am the extremely proud owner of a marketing firm known as AdGlass. In 2010 I graduated from Lahser High School in Bloomfield Hills Michigan and went on to attend Saginaw Valley State University. After a semester I returned home to attend Oakland Community College and to work to help provide for my family. I am the third oldest child of 7 and the oldest of the males. Upon my return I worked 3 sales jobs that were able to open my eyes and save me from becoming another deadbeat. These jobs taught me what it meant to work smarter and not harder. They also kept me in front of consumers who in a lot of cases had similar financial issues that I had. Seeing this I began to brainstorm ways to get my clients paid. Almost 2 years later the idea of AdGlass came to me. After a lot of research and hard work I was able to find a way to benefit businesses and consumers all at the same time.


         I grew up in a strict Christian home in the city of Detroit. My dad was a  painter and my mom stayed at home. My dad was fortunate enough to obtain work that was able to move our family to one of Michigan’s most prestigious areas, Bloomfield Hills. I went from going to school with the children of low income households on free lunch to going to school with children who get the newest gadget as soon as it came out while ordering carryout for lunch. This was frustrating. The thing that frustrated me the most was that I couldn’t afford those things and neither could my family. fortunately, I did not let the story end that way.


            Now I am up everyday at 5 am working to push this business through. I spend hours a day cold calling and canvassing for business and developing the brand. I am my own marketing manager, sales manager, salesperson, custodian, brand ambassador, account manager and accountant. I wear a lot of different hats for this company. I am looking to obtain capital to help build the brand image by effectively placing AdGlass Custom Decals on passenger vehicles across Metro Detroit. There are two main purposes of this business and they are:

  1. Increase the brand awareness of campaigning companies.

  2. Get consumers paid for helping build the brand.


Right now I am offering my drivers between $100 to $300 per month for allowing an AdGlass decal to be on their vehicle. This extra money may be helping a family to eat, keep the lights, heat or water on or simply go on vacation. Whatever the purpose is, they want or need the money. The driver should be compensated for advertising for a company who is making money off of the ad PERIOD. AdGlass is a company designed for the people. Without people to sell to, businesses would not exist. Therefore I feel as though my part to humanity is to be able to give back to those people who shop businesses. To be able to help them stay on top of their bills. Ultimately it will only boost our economy.

What We Need & What You Get

We need your support! 

In order for me to get 90 drivers on the road and paid we need to raise $130,600.00.

Here is where the money will go:

$40,500 will be paid out over the course of 3 Months to 30 different drivers for allowing 3 LARGE decals on their vehicle.

$31,500 will be paid out over the course of 3 months to 30 different drivers for allowing 2 LARGE decals on their vehicle.

$22,500 will be paid out over the course of 3 months to 30 different drivers for allowing 1 LARGE decal on their vehicle.

$18,000 is the total cost of printing and installing the LARGE decals.

$1500 will go towards the development of 3 animated AdGlass Commercials for advertising.

$600 will go towards perfecting our current website. (www.theadglasscompany.com)

$1000 will go to obtaining ALL the proper legal documents for the campaigns to operate smoothly and in order.

$15,000 will go to the development of the AdGlass APP which our drivers will use to show routes taken and times the routes were taken. This will make proving the value of the AdGlass campaign easier.

The grand total amount needed is $130,600.00

For those that live in the Metro Detroit Area and are interested in becoming a driver, your donation will put you on the list to become a driver if you are interested.

Be sure to check out some of the cool things you get once you donate!

All items ship at the end of the campaign.

 

The Impact

The main component to this campaign is to get AdGlass drivers on the road with the custom decals. We are trying to help 90 people make extra income while advertising for us the way we know best; on our vehicles.

This could be the difference between someone's bills getting paid or them not getting paid. AdGlass has a deep concern and truly cares about the condition of Metro Detroit and its communities. We make conscious efforts to support local businesses, charities, non-profits and most importantly the individuals that make up the communities. Your contribution is helping us change lives.

Risks & Challenges

Here are the challenges. 

Big companies don't need us...

Since it is not currently a popular form of advertising and is seen as innovative, a lot of the more conservative companies will shy away from it. So to over come this we must stay focused on our targeted market which is start ups to businesses 3 1/2 years old that are in retail, food, hospitality, the service industry and law and real estate firms. Once they begin to do it the larger companies will follow suit.

People aren't perfect...

There are risk with every venture. By hiring (1099) drivers to drive around with a company's name on their vehicle is a risk. We have set up protocol to maintain the image of our company and the company participating in an AdGlass Campaign. One way we do this is by clearly labeling the car as independently owned and operated. We DON'T hire people to drive, we rent adspace from them.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you find yourself in a position where you like the concept and like that we can get people paid but you can't donate thats okay. Share this page! By you sharing the page your friends, co-workers and family will see this. You never know they may become a driver and buy you something nice!

story:
Hogswatch in July

You'd better watch out - the Hogfather is back! 

Hogswatch in July is a community fundraising event held annually to celebrate Sir Terry Pratchett's Discworld.  Hogswatch is the Disworldian equivalent of Christmas, which we choose to celebrate much like Christmas in July with a family friendly and very festival village fete.

This year, the event is raising funds for the Dutton Park State School's P&C Association; as well as encouraging literacy and raising awareness for The Orangutan Project and Alzheimer's Australia.

What We Need & What You Get

We are crowdfunding to provide for upfront expenses, ensuring we can host some of the event's most memorable attractions, like the Petting Zoo!

Contributors to the campaign have the opportunity to snag some exclusive merchandise, be granted a little extra fun on the day or even a GOLDEN SASH to wear with pride. You can even snag free snags from the C.M.O.T. Sausage Sizzle. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you're interested in becoming an event Sponsor, please contact us via our website www.hogswatchinjuly.com for more information or to request a special package of perks for your generous contribution.
We look forward to seeing you at HOGSWATCH IN JULY on 30 July 2016!

Hogswatch in July is a community fundraising event held annually to celebrate Sir Terry Pratchett's Discworld.  Hogswatch is the Disworldian equivalent of Christmas, which we choose to celebrate much like Christmas in July with a family friendly and very festival village fete.
This year, the event is raising funds for the Dutton Park State School's P&C Association; as well as encouraging literacy and raising awareness for The Orangutan Project and Alzheimer's Australia.   What We Need & What You Get We are crowdfunding to provide for upfront expenses, ensuring we can host some of the event's most memorable attractions, like the Petting Zoo!
Contributors to the campaign have the opportunity to snag some exclusive merchandise, be granted a little extra fun on the day or even a GOLDEN SASH to wear with pride. You can even snag free snags from the C.M.O.T. Sausage Sizzle. 
    Other Ways You Can Help
If you're interested in becoming an event Sponsor, please contact us via our website www.hogswatchinjuly.com for more information or to request a special package of perks for your generous contribution.We look forward to seeing you at HOGSWATCH IN JULY on 30 July 2016!

story:
Okay. So you think you can't have beer on Passover. Actually, you're wrong! Now, for the first time since the Jews left Egypt and their beer behind (there's a theory that the Hebrew slaves were actually paid in beer), you can enjoy beer on Passover. 
We at Meadan Brewery in Karmiel Israel have brewed the first Kosher-for-Passover beer in Israel and with your help we're excited to send it out to the world.

The Story

The Meadan Brewery was founded to provide a solution for thirsty folks with gluten intolerance looking for a hoppy, tasty beer to help them get through the day. Our beers contain no barley, wheat or gluten whatsoever, making them perfect for all gluten-intolerant beer lovers.

I am Bryan Meadan, the founder of Meadan Craft Brewing.

In 2006, I was diagnosed with celiac disease, which forced me to go on a gluten-free diet. In the beginning, beer was not the thing I missed most (that would be pizza, beer's best friend). But I soon realized how much I wanted a good, cold glass of brew while watching a game, socializing with friends, or lazing on a sunny afternoon. Unfortunately (make that fortunately!), I couldn't find any gluten-free beers that I really enjoyed.

So I started brewing my own.

Bryan the brewer

I have worked as senior management in small start-ups as well as middle management in larger companies, in addition to working as a web programmer and consultant. I am a Sociologist and view the world through both those and technical eyes.  I had reached a certain level of expertise in web programming until I got tired of it. 

Then I started brewing beer and founded the Meadan Brewery in Karmiel.  

But 7 years before that, I was a homebrewer.  I found a basic recipe for gluten-free beer; but since I couldn't find all the ingredients I needed, I started using buckwheat. After a few mediocre batches and hundreds of bottles, I honed in on the taste I was looking for. A few liters later I had something that beer lovers in general and celiacs in particular would like.

In 2012, I decided to begin producing my beer commercially. In November 2012, Meadan Buckwheat and Quinoa Ales started being sold in limited edition brews.

In December 2013, we dropped the quinoa beer and started brewing Chickpea Ale (hummus beer).

In May 2015, we opened our new brewery in Karmiel, a growing city in the beautiful Galilee region. That same year we began production of our Date Ale, which would soon become our kosher-for-Passover beverage of choice.

The Project Meadan Brewery produces the first kosher-for-Passover beer in Israel. Now we want to bring it to beer lovers in the US.

For Passover 2016, Meadan Date Ale hit the local Israeli market with great success. As a small brewery in our first year of operations, we couldn't keep up with the demand – something we plan to avoid next year. International interest was generated as well, and we received requests to ship our beer to the Jewish community in the States.

http://www.timesofisrael.com/this-passover-wash...

http://www.hadassahmagazine.org/2016/04/04/beer-kosher-passover/

For Passover 2017, we would love to offer our beer in the US. In order to do that, we need special funding for repackaging, permits, distribution, marketing and minor recipe tweaking for the American palate.

We currently have two types of kosher-for-Passover Date Ales that will be sold in Israel. We are confident that the same brews can be highly successful in the US market.

Supporting this project will not only allow you to put quality beer on your table during that famous week in spring, but will help us get our beers to thousands of good people forced (or choosing) to go on a gluten-free diet.

Funding Needs

Exporting our brews to the U.S. is a complicated and expensive endeavor.  We will need $25000 in order to do the following:

  • Get additional Kosher certifications to reach the largest target audience possible.
  • Get GMP certification in addition to what we have now.
  • Repackage the product, including 4-packs, new cartons and labelling. 
  • Send samples prior to export.  
  • Attend events in the U.S. (like Kosherfest).  

Risks and Challenges

Producing beer in Israel and then exporting to the US presents a number of challenges including logistics, permits, distribution, and reaching target markets. 

We plan on working with highly experienced importers and distributors to help us get our Kosher-for-Passover beer to the US Jewish community in as many states as possible. This will require serious planning and marketing. We plan to get the word out through as many channels as we can, and in the fall of 2016 we hope to attend Kosherfest, the world’s largest and most attended kosher-certified products trade show.

In addition to getting our Kosher-for-Passover brews out to the world, we invite you to join in and help us make the world a better (and tastier) place for people with gluten intolerance.

Other Ways You Can Help

We know that not all of you can help financially -- and that's totally all right.  And some of you may never be in Israel to take advantage of some of these perks.

There are other ways that you can be a part of this cool project.

  • Pass it on!  Let people you know know about our project. 
  • Share this page on Facebook, Twitter, Instagram, and anywhere else you can.  Use Indiegogo's share tools to give you a hand.
  • Like our Facebook page.  It's our main form of ongoing communication with our friends and supporters.
  • Come visit the brewery if you're in Israel.  We have tours, tastings and enjoy a cold one in our Visitor's Center.

Perk Pics
