Short Summary My husband grew up in North Carolina and I worked in NC.  We love the state, the people, the food, and the drink.  We want to focus on combining southern cooking with great draft North Carolina beer.The plan is to feature North Carolina brews.  North Carolina is home to 132 breweries and brewpubs.  We will be featuring a different NC brew every week, with discounts, and activities surrounding the brew during the on season.  We will also be showcasing southern cooking for all you folks that like a little grub in your belly while you enjoy the refreshing taste of local beer.  We would also like to increase the number of taps to accommodate for the local brews that our patrons take a particular liking to imbibe upon.We will continue with many of the local favorites such as a full menu until closing, Tuesdays whole menu half price as well as the daft beers. Small sample of what we intend to carry
Menu 
 AppetizersShrimp Boil Skewers Buttermilk Chicken and Waffles Boiled Peanut Hummus Crab Cake Hush PuppiesFried PicklesFood Fried Chicken with Sweet Potato fries BBQ Sandwich with coleslaw Crawdad and fried corn on the cob Chicken Wings SteakburgersCheesy Bacon friesWrangler cheeseburger with egg
 
 
Daft Beers
Natty Green Buckshot - Greensboro, NC
Duck Rabbit Milk Stout - Farmville, NC
Broomtail Acerbic IPA - Wrightsville Beach, NC
Broomtail Bucket List Blonde - Wrightsville Beach, NC
Foothills Hoppyum - Winston - Salem, NC
Mother Earth Sisters of the Moon IPA - Kinston, NC
Triangle IPA - Durham, NC
Triangle Habanero Pale Ale - Durham , NC
Lonerider Sweet Josie Brown - Raleigh, NC
Beer Army Fire in the Hole - Trenton, NC
Highland Gaelic Ale - Asheville, NC
Good Hops Reservation Wheat - Carolina Beach, NC
Good Hops Hopless Amber - Carolina Beach, NC
 
  What We Need & What You Get Right now we would like to purchase the Taproom in Carolina Beach.  It currently offers 30 taps, a great kitchen, 1000 sq feet of deck and a 1 block walk from the beach.We are currently asking for $75,000 for the restaurant and taproom as a turnkey operation.  We intend to utilize our savings for operating expenses after the opening.  Leaving our 401k investments intact. Who are we?We are a husband and wife that  have been married for 9 years.  I grew up with a family that owned and operated a small town grocery store, café, and bar.  I have a degree in Business Administration / Finance from the University of Missouri and have worked as a Project Manager for the past 5 years in Information Technology.   My husband grew up in Charlotte, NC and graduated from Tusculum College in Tennessee.  He worked in multiple restaurants putting himself through college (including dishwashing).  We both understand the hard work and hours that will be required, but are extremely committed to creating a place where everyone feels welcome and safe, as well as giving back to Carolina Beach.

story:
Specsport is a shop of sports and leisure equipment which specializes in selling products from world-renowned brands. The aim of this project is to provide our customers with a large variety of products from the best brands in one place. We analyze the needs and expectations of our clients thoroughly and we provide detailed consulting and help them to choose the product they were dreaming about. We have a very specific business model, at first we only encourage people to try new sports such as roller skating or skiing. Then if they like the sport, we sell them related products.

This small business was created two years ago. At the beginning, everything was done by Martynas. He was paying taxes, creating shop interior, negotiating with suppliers, doing marketing, consulting customers and selling products at the store.  After one years of hard work, one bright morning, he hired 2 new employees, with  the capital profit created only by his work. This morning was something amazing, because he started from zero and now there is a small team working with him.

   

Our main goal for this project is 75000 euros.  We need these funds to create additional jobs in Lithuania, with a clear vision of what specialist positions are necessary to carry out further development.  In addition, the development plan involves investment into a new attractive shop interior as well as enriching the shop's offer with selected categories of goods which would allow us to increase sales and at the same time pay salaries for the new staff. Also we are planing to open internet stores in others countries where we will advertise, promote and sell new innovative active sport product.

Flexible funding goals:
1000eu – we will invest this money into a new attractive shop interior

5000eu – we will hire one new additional worker, and we will use this money to pay the salary for 3 months. He will be our future expert with clear goal how to increase our concept effectiveness.

10000eu – we will hire two additional workers, and we will use this money to pay them salary for 3 months. One will be an IT specialist who will increase the pace of our company, and present our idea to the costumers. The other employee will be a designer, they will develop concepts, graphics and layouts for product illustrations, company logos, and websites. Because of them we will be able to present our ideas to costumers in best possible way.

25000eu – we will be able to order new categories of goods from our distributors, which will allow us to increase sales. If you have something new and innovative we are very interested in cooperation with you.

50000eu – We will bring the Baltic states' active sports leisure community together.  We will open special internet shop for the active leisure sports community in all of the Baltic states: Latvia, Estonia, Finland, Sweden, Norway, Denmark. In our new page we are planning to promote and sell new innovative products. Also every year we will connect the community together, we will organize and sponsor active sport competitions.

                                       

75000eu – We will open an international, world wide internet shop, where we will advertise, promote and sell the best sports products. Also we will be providing free sport instructions and lessons.

                         

The most popular sport in Lithuania is basketball, and the majority of government funding is directed to the basketball community. This is a big problem, because other types of sport are forgotten. And we as a specialized sport shop want to promote other types of sport to people. We want people to try various sport activities.  We want that our customers' dreams come true.

We rent our inventory for free and organize free rolling skates lessons, ski lessons, and introduce people to extremes sports, such as parachute jumping, gliding, paragliding.  How can you know what you like, if you have never tried it :)

CEO. He creates, communicates, and implements our organization's vision, mission, and overall direction. Leads the development and implementation of our organization's strategy.

His story: At first, he found suppliers and started his own business in Lithuania with only 300 euros. He found the right brands and products suitable for Lithuanian climate, leisure activity habits and the mentality of the people which filled a niche in the Lithuanian market. But the story doesn't end here...


Manager. She communicates with clients, works in marketing. Her goal is to ensure that the shop runs smoothly, and that the clients leave our store happy.

Manager/Teacher. He teaches clients how to use sport inventory safely, he also helps clients to select suitable products, provides free lessons etc. If clients don’t know how to skate, he will teach them, and all lessons are free.

Active leisure activities such as biking, roller skating and skateboarding are currently gaining popularity in Lithuania, because of increasing number of skating parks and bicycle paths. When winter starts, we grab warm clothes and go skiing to Liepkalnis, Kalita hills or on other equipped mountain trails. There is also an indoor ski slope in Druskininkai, so we can go skiing all year long. There aren't many specialized summer and winter sport shops in Lithuania, where employees have tested the equipment themselves.

Our world is one big place, where everyone has dreams, and we think that there is always reason for dreams to come true.  So we are inviting everybody to join our journey.

At this point our project expansion is only progressing from the funds, which are generated in our shop. However we want to accelerate this progress so we are asking for your help.

There are 3 types of assistance that you can provide:

1.  Invest funds in this project. As a thank you we will give you gifts: T shirt, socks, wristband, mix-tapes, helmets, trips to Lithuania and more!

2.  Become a supplier. We always searching for new suppliers, contact us so we will sell and promote your products.

3.  Become our team member: if you know how to improve our project we are always inviting you to join us, we will surprise this world together, and without a doubt, we will share our success with you.

story:
Hello Family & Friends! 

I have recently been selected to participate in the 2015-2016 Dallas Mayors Star Council leadership program. Through this program I will have the opportunity to learn more about the inter-workings of the community of Dallas under the direction of the office of Dallas Mayor Mike Rawlings. We will pinpoint exactly WHERE and HOW we can create initiatives to promote a better city within. Aside from the leadership program, some of my personal goals are to bring progressive ideas and strategies to the City of Dallas that make an impact in economic and small business empowerment, professional development and job creation, and overall raising the standard of how business and relationships are conducted/managed in the DFW Metroplex among the African-American community.  

I have created a Purpose Funding campaign based off of one of my favorite slogans, "Think Global - Act Local" I believe having this mentality in everything that we do will help us make immediate impacts on what we do on a micro level while keeping in mind the bigger picture of how it impacts the bigger picture. We should always keep in mind the bigger picture here in Dallas specifically when it comes to how we govern our laws and policies to ensure we do not stifle the potential of our youth simply because we "Act Local" or from a place of self. We simply cannot advocate for one without impacting the other Globally. Having this mindset with everything that we do gives us the perspective that we can make a global change starting locally. 

With your generous donations, you will be providing a once in a life-time opportunity for me to collaborate with some of Dallas's brightest emerging leaders to begin our quest for change. Under the council of the office of Mayor Rawlings, I will not only have the opportunity to first learn the structures and formalities of this great city, but also the opportunity to bring fresh progressive ideas to those with a heart and mind to listen.

What We Need & What You Get

Let me break it down in more detail:

  • $500.00 is needed to go towards class materials and costs to go through the Mayors Star Council leadership program. I've decided to reach out to the people in my life that have shaped, molded, and inspired who I am today. i chose to do this because I want to give back to the people who may have not been blessed with the opportunity to truly be raised by a village. Also, I wanted you, my friends and family to be the people who were responsible for allowing me accept and follow through with this opportunity. YOU are my WHY when I feel like what so many of us strive to do everyday, feels like a lost cause.
  • I've created this purpose funding campaign for you to donate however, I must not only earn your donation but earn your trust that every dollar donated will be felt, cherished, and put to good use over the course of this upcoming year.
  • I have created #ThinkGlobalActLocal duties that I will be performing over the course of July leading up to August 14th and after if need be. Also during my time with MSC I will document and blog about my experience learning about the city of Dallas and my quest to make a positive impact on this City. 
  • If you'd like to join in this cause use #ThinkGlobalActLocal on your social media platforms when you perform a deed that empowers, inspires, or uplifts someone in your very own community. Start with your home, workplace, place of worship or gathering, then out into your community. My hopes is that this frame of mind will become embedded into how we live our lives daily.
$500/$25 = 20 people or at every $25 increments.
If 20 people would find it in their hearts to donate $25, I will carry out one of the following small acts of #ThinkGlobalActLocal. You are also welcome to donate any amount that you would like to give to help further my mission to make an impact in the City of Dallas. Your donations will go directly to Mayor's Start Council Non-profit organization and are valid as a tax write off.  

Thank You

To those who have taken the time to read this, I would like to personally thank you for inspiring, shaping, and influencing my life in a way that can only be appreciated by giving what was given to me, to someone in search of their own purpose or calling in life. Thank you for the wisdom, constructive criticism, lessons taught directly and indirectly by watching your every move, and everything in between. I hope this purpose funding iniative finds you in good spirits to give to a cause that will give back and more. I pray many blessing of peace and prosperity to you and yours.

Your Servant Leader,

Benjamin J Vann

For more information about the Dallas Mayor's Star Council visit: www.mayorstarcouncil.org

story:
Hello Cocktail & Cupcake Lovers!!!


I'm Tai Prince of Houston, Texas. I'm an Engineer by day and a Baker by night & weekends with a dream of owning my own business! 


What is this business you say?!?!? 

It's Cocktails & Cupcakes!! The perfect combination of my two loves "A Sweet Treat and a Good Drink!"

I fell in LOOOOOVVVVE with baking from watching my Southern Belle Grandmother aka The Pie Lady make homemade pies from scratch in her kitchen. I started to experiment on my own; especially during Thanksgiving and New Years when my HUGE Southern Family would get together for laughs and good eats! Thanks to their stamp of approval, I gained the courage to start baking for my Church and Small Parties. Now I'm ready for the next step!!!


So how does Cocktails come into play?

Well...while studying Engineering I needed a fun outlet that also brought in some MULAH. Bartending was the perfect answer! However, my studies did not allow me to immediately pursue my dream. So what better time then NOW to get it started!

This blossomed into my vision of Cocktails & Cupcakes!

So why do I need help from YOU?

Well...I am an up and coming Small Business Owner looking to serve people with inventive & unusual cupcakes and cocktails! This all requires staff (who would love to be paid); a website (to spread the Cocktails & Cupcakes vision); and supplies for a mobile unit (so I can serve any and every event with my inventive Cocktails & Cupcakes). 

Below are highlights of what I plan to do with your contributions:

  • $5000 is needed for development and maintaining my website
  • $2000 is needed for commercial kitchen rental, storage space, and mobile unit
  • $2500 is needed to employ the initial bartenders and services
  • $2000 is needed for baking and beverage supplies
  • $3000 is needed for incentives and shipping

Guess what there are PERKS too!!!

  • A $5 contribution will receive a Cocktails & Cupcakes Koozie
  • A $10 contribution will receive a Cocktails & Cupcakes coaster set & koozie
  • A $20 contribution will receive a Cocktails & Cupcakes Stemless Martini Glass
  • A $25 contribution will receive a Cocktails & Cupcakes Tote Bag
  • A $30 contribution will receive a Cocktails & Cupcakes Stemless Wine Glass Set
  • A $40 contribution will receive a Cocktails & Cupcakes T-shirt
  • A $50 contribution will receive an Cocktails & Cupcakes "On the Rocks" T-shirt
  • A $100 contribution will receive a One of a Kind Cocktail Glass Set
  • A $100 contribution will receive a Cocktails & Cupcakes Long Island Tote Bag
  • A $1000 contribution will receive a Cocktails & Cupcakes Event
I have provided services to Church events, Birthday Parties, and even a Nonprofit Art Show! I am proud of my current accomplishments with Cocktails & Cupcakes and I am so excited for what's ahead!
Alas, please spread the word for me using Indiegogo's share tools or a good Southern conversation!!! 

Thank you all!


Always Smiling,

Tai 


Shout - Outs  

Main Logo designed by Ian Johnson of IMJ Works (johnson.ian.m@gmail.com)
Tagline/Business Card designed by Vogue Wilborn of Moderna Images (modernaimages@gmail.com) Portfolio: http://modernaimages.wix.com/portfolio
Custom Cocktail Glass Set designed by Billisha Hastings of Collage Gifts (collagegifts@gmail.com) Website: http://collagegifts.weebly.com/
T-Shirts will be designed by Gibbs Hightower of Shadow House Productions (gibbs@shadowhp.com) Website: http://shadowhp.com/

story:
Hi There !

I am Bianca and together with Adrian we want to show you a little piece of heaven, the place we call it home now.

# the view up the hill


Almost two years ago we moved from the big capital city of Bucharest to a small village called Cașva. Dating from 1453, Cașva is situated in Eastern Transylvania, surrounded by hills, mountains and plenty of nature. It's the place where Adrian's parents and grandparents grew up , lived and definitely fell in love with it.

Shortly after moving here we started feeling a need to give something back to this place and its people. We wanted to express our gratitude for what they had offered Adrian as a child and also for the wonderful times still to come. We want to start an initiative to put into practice the knowledge gained so far , supplemented by those acquired in villages everyday activities . Currently , with support and help from relatives and friends especially with tips and lessons , we raise poultry , rabbits and cultivate vegetables on an 150sm garden.

Our project consists in relocate, recondition and improve this traditional old wooden house, donated by a local who wanted to demolish it, and transform it into a small guesthouse with three rooms for accommodation.

The house was build by her parents in 1961 and wasn’t inhabited for almoust three years, that’s why it will need a lot of recondition and repairs.

# the wooden house dating 1961

# old location of the house vs. new location of the house

Cașva Guesthouse - Where Is the Money Heading To?

Because our resources are not enough to develop this project by ourselves, we need  your help to transform this house into a guesthouse. This process is planned with respect to the area's specificity and according to the original project and house plan. We will use the same materials as the ones used when the house was first built, preserving as much of its architecture as possible. We will keep the stone foundation, and recuperate as much as we can from the walls, beams, floor ,roof tiles, windows and doors.

# the original project of the house

The house will be relocated approximately 50m from its current location, on our own domain, conveniently located next to the main road and Cașva river.

# This is the new location. On the right side is Cașva river and the place where the hammocks will be , and on the left side is the access to the main road.

The house will be entirely made of wood and features :

  • three bedrooms
  • three bathrooms
  • a large hallway
  • a kitchen with a dining area
  • a porch

# a simulation with the house on our domain. On the left side is the road and on the right side is the river.

# a simulation with the house towards the river.
From 6 to 8 people can be hosted here. Each bedroom will have its own bathroom , with double or twin beds.


There is literally a lot to be done and we want to make this as best as we can, while keeping everything as an environmentally friendly project.

Here are the steps that we have to take in order to be able to receive tourists starting october 2016:

  •  take all the permits and authorizations issued by the authorities in law ( Urbanism Certificate, Sanitary-Veterinary Certificate, permit to buid a guesthouse from Ministry of Transport , Constructions and  Tourism )
  • electrical connection
  • water connection
  • make the fence
  • arrange the land
  • dismantle the house
  • rebuild it on the new location
  • make the interior design according to the planes posted
  • do the electrical wiring and sanitary pipes
  • mount the boiler and radiators for heating
  • instal solar pannel
  • make a vegetable garden to be used by guests
  • arrange a playground for children
  • arrange chill out area with hammocks by the river
  • arrange three parking spaces
  • buy four bicycles

We will try to do as much as we can with the amount of money we hope to gather, and , if we are not going to obtain the whole sum, we will start cutting from the back of the list. :)

We want to create a cosy and comfortable interior , as the romanian peasant houses are. We already have old furniture for the dining area and two bedrooms, furniture donated also by a local.

The Culinary Experience

We know that a journey means visiting new places, meeting new people but also tasting good food.  We guarantee a pleasant dining experience with local seasonal dishes using vegetables from our garden and local products like cheese, milk, and meat, all grown free range. They will be cooked by a local cook and accompanied by an appropriate drink.

The vegetables to be grown in the garden are from traditional, non-GMO, seeds,   which we will receive from our friends from Eco Ruralis, a grassroots association created by small farmers  who practice non-industrialized sustainable agriculture, based on environmentally-conscious principles. 

# we cultivate tomatoes, cucumbers, onions, beans, radishes, lettuce, spinach, kohlrabi, strawberries

The house will also host a pantry with a lot of traditionally produced goodies, like jam, syrup or pickles. The products will be manufactured by us, our friends and neighbors, products which you can also buy, if you find them irresistible and want to take some with you back home.

Beside the vegetables from the garden which everyone can use, you will find local products such as cheese, eggs, honey, wine, palinka, but also locally provided meat. We assure you that these products taste incredible and you will have an unforgettable culinary journey along your travelling here.

# cheese with dill and pepper

Activities Around The Guesthouse

Depending on the time of the year during which you will visit us , there are different activities to be done :

  • in the springtime we will prepare the land and plant seedling

# working the land in march

  • in the summertime you can help us take care of the garden and prepare seasonal syrups and jams such as dandelion , elderflower or raspberry syrup, black cherry or strawberry jam

  • during autumn you can help us harvest by picking up apples pears,plums and nuts , produce the wine and prepare for winter consequently by: preparing jam, syrup, tomato juice or pickles
  •  wintertime is when we produce palinca

Things To Be Done & Places To Be Visited

There are a lot of opportunities available for you to discover around here, and we assure you that your only regret will consist of not having time to experience them all.

  • tracking in the area - walking through Cașva is a must as you can see the  old peasant's houses, their lifestyle and everyday activities and listen to their story.  You can also find many walkable trails on the hills and we can also provide you some lunch to go for longer trails.
  • take a walk in the oldest forest in Romania, having an area of 569 hectares. About 300 trees are between 650 and 720 years, and about half of oak trees almost died of old age , but not yet disturbed by human intervention .

    # Mociar forrest – photo source http://anadeveanu.blogspot.ro

  • cycling or exploring the area in a cart / sleigh - the road to Idicel Padure village is great for a journey and you can admire the entire view from the area up the   mountains. For  this trip we provide you a detailed map, insights and tips of what to visit or where to have a meal  or prepare you take-away lunch.

  • mushrooms workshop - you can also participate in our workshop during which you can learn to recognize and cook local mushrooms# learn to recognize local mushrooms / take a walk in the forest / join us picking up blackberries and help us to make syrop and jam

  • sheepherding - you can visit a sheepfold in the area , watch the milking process  and taste the incredible " boț” - a ball of polenta filled with local  cheese, cooked by the fire

    # eat "boț" at the sheepfold / visit Bornemisza Castle / visit the 100 years old steps,painted by students from Art High School in Târgu Mureș

  • partake in local festivals such as "The Ploughman", "Girls Fair", "Gurghiului   Valley Festival"

      # "The Ploughman Festival”

  •  visit workshops of craftsmen in the area -Ms. and Mrs. Sandu  from Gurghiu (wood sculptor / costumes craftsman), Grigore Covrig from Idicel   Pădure (vests and coats craftsman)
  • visits to the castles in the area - the castle and the arboretum of Gurghiu,   Bornemisza (4km) , Teleki Castle in Gorneşti (27km), Kemeny Castle in Brâncoveneşti  (25km)   

    # Kemeny Castle from Brâncoveneşti
  • city tours - Reghin city tour (15km) ) including visit at Györkös Francis, one of the most   famous luthiers in  the city, Târgu Mureș city tour (50km) ,Sighișoara city tour (100km) , Cluj Napoca city tour (120km)

  • visit Sovata and Praid ( 55km) - you can catch a ride on the Mocănița, an old   steam train that takes you through the beautiful wilderness during a three hour round trip ,  have a swim in the biggest salt water swimming pool or visit the salt mine

How do you get here ?

There are various ways to reach Casva and the ride down is very pleasurable. You will pass through a varied landscape from plains to hills to mountains and back to hills again. Plenty of rivers and streams will adorn your path and the surrounding forests and animals will fill you up with life.

  • by plane – if you fly here, we can pick you up from Târgu Mureș or Cluj Napoca Airports
  • by car – it's easy to get here as the village is close to Reghin ( 14km) and the   guesthouse is at the main road. You can find a detailed map on our Facebook page.
  • by train - you can come with local transport from Reghin train station or we can  pick you up

The Impact

We are trying to encourage rural tourism around this area, to involve local people in our project and to show them that the inheritance from their ancestors can help them even in these modern times when technology seems to overtake everything.

By restoring the house and working the land, we protect our architectural and cultural heritage, integrate the villagers in this project by working with local craftsmen and gardeners and show them that tourism is a reliable alternative for them. 

The economic situation of the last decade and inconstant income have led to people leaving for seasonal or long-term work in other countries and cities , so creating jobs here will have a positive impact on the community, which he already expressed support for starting the company by the desire to be directly involved in the activities of the pension ( restoration house , cooking , garden care , workshops for tourists) or being collaborators (producer dairy products and meat, local craftsmen ) .

Currently Cașva village is inhabited by 780 people, but no employer has a registered office in the village. A job in the village or a contract with a company headquartered here is an aggregate of advantages both for employees and for collaborators.

We want to make local arts and crafts known and revive forgotten traditions. In the future we want to save as many houses as we can and transform them into guesthouses,  and a barn, to transform it into a restaurant.

Rewards for your contribution

We are very grateful for every little help and thank all our supporters in advance! We have thought about some great perks to offer you in return for your help.

  • for 5 USD - you will receive,  an electronic card from us with a special thank you. ​Donations of any amount are received with immense gratitude and appreciation!

  •  for 20 USD – we will send you, the printed card of the future house, painted by a good ​friend of ours, with a special thank you

  • for 40 USD – we will send you, a beautiful wooden spoon, made by Mr. Sandu, a local craftsmen + a printed card of the house with a special thank you

    # Mr. Sandu making a wooden spoon / types of spoons  [ please keep in mind that all products are handmade and they are all unique in their own way and may differ slightly from the ones in the images ]

  • for 75 USD – Mr. Sandu will write your name on a wooden board that we are going to hang in the dining area.
  • for 100 USD we will send you, a beautiful wooden bowl, made by ​Mr. Sandu + a beautiful wooden spoon + a printed card of the house with a special thank you

    # types of wooden bowls / wooden bowl detail / wooden bowl back [ please keep in mind that all products are handmade and they are all unique in their own way and may differ slightly from the ones in the images. i will send a picture with the bowl before sending it ]

  • for 250 USD you will receive, a beautiful traditional Romanian blouse, an "ie" , ​handmade by Mrs. Sandu + your name on the wooden board + a printed card of the house with a special thank you

    # Mrs. Sandu and her creations / "ie" for women [ please keep in mind that all products are handmade and they are all unique in their own way and may differ from the ones in the images. i will send a picture with the blouse before sending it ]

    • # "ie" for girls

    # "ie" for men

  • for 200 USD book your accommodation package for two persons, a one night stay with two meals ​included (breakfast and dinner) + a goodbye present + your name on the wooden board.
  • for 300 USD book your accommodation package for two persons, a two nights stay with two meals ​included (breakfast and dinner) + a goodbye present .
  • for 400 USD  book your accommodation package for two persons, a three nights stay with two meals ​included (breakfast and dinner) + a goodbye present
  • for 500 USD  book your accommodation package for two persons, a four nights stay with two meals ​included (breakfast and dinner) + a goodbye present
  • for 600 USD book your accommodation package for two persons, a five nights stay with two meals ​included (breakfast and dinner) + a goodbye present

* Perks can be offered as a gift, in case you want to surprise somebody. We will pack it nicely and add a personal note from you .

* Shipping charges are included

Other Ways You Can Help

We are very enthusiastic about this project and we hope we made you come and visit or help us by spreading the word about our project.  Here you can find more info about the Cașva Guesthouse :

https://casvavillageguesthouse.wordpress.com/

https://www.facebook.com/casva.village

https://www.pinterest.com/casva_village/

https://instagram.com/casva_village/

By clicking the links above you can find more info about our project, images of the Cașva village and its inhabitants, surroundings and activities available here.

Thank you very much for spending the time to read about our project and we hope we aroused your curiosity and determination to visit us.

We are planning to start the project in January 2016 and you can visit us starting October 2016. On the bottom of the page there will be a calendar with the dates booked so far. It is updated each time somebody picks up a date.

If you have any question please feel free to write to us and we'll get back to you as soon as we can.

Special Thank You

We would like to bring special thanks to our friends who helped us so far and we can't wait to celebrate together when the project will be done:

  • Radu for the video   https://www.facebook.com/raducul?fref=ts
  • Argatu for the music   http://subcarpati.com/argatu/ 
  • Dani for the painted card  https://www.behance.net/DanielaGheorghiu
  • Mara, Andreea, Luiza and Dana for helping us with the text, advice and support
  • Cosmin, Adi, Raluca and all our friends who supports us and helps us spread the word

If you have any questions please email at

casva.guesthouse@gmail.com

               Thank you all and we hope to meet soon!

     Bianca & Adrian

Hi There !

I am Bianca and together
with Adrian we want to show you a little piece of heaven, the place we call it
home now.







# the view up the hill


Almost two
years ago we moved from the big capital city of Bucharest to a small
village called Cașva. Dating from 1453, Cașva is situated in
Eastern Transylvania, surrounded by hills, mountains and plenty of nature.
It's the place where Adrian's parents and grandparents grew up , lived and
definitely fell in love with it. 
Shortly after moving here we started
feeling a need to give something back to this place and its people. We wanted
to express our gratitude for what they had offered Adrian as a child and also
for the wonderful times still to come. We want to start an initiative to put into practice
the knowledge gained so far , supplemented by those acquired in villages
everyday activities . Currently , with support and help from relatives and
friends especially with tips and lessons , we raise poultry , rabbits and
cultivate vegetables on an 150sm garden.
Our project consists in relocate, recondition and improve this traditional old wooden house, donated by a local
who wanted to demolish it, and
transform it into a small guesthouse with three rooms for accommodation. 
The house was build by her parents in 1961 and wasn’t inhabited for 
almoust three years, that’s why it will need a lot of recondition and 
repairs.







# the wooden house dating 1961
# old location of the house vs. new location of the house



  Cașva Guesthouse - Where Is the Money Heading To?



Because our resources are not enough
to develop this project by ourselves, we need  your help
to transform this house into a guesthouse. This process is planned with respect to the area's
specificity and according to the original project and house plan. We will
use the same materials as the ones used when the house was first
built, preserving as much of its architecture as possible. We will keep the stone foundation, and recuperate as much as we can from
 the walls, beams, floor ,roof tiles, windows and doors. 


# the original project of the house
The
house will be relocated approximately 50m from its current location, on
our own domain, conveniently located next to the main road and Cașva river. 


#
This is the new location. On the right side is Cașva river and the place where
the hammocks will be , and on the left side is the access to the main road.

made of wood and features :

three bedrooms 

three bathrooms
a large hallway 

a kitchen with a dining area 

a porch

story:
We have a right to a cannabis farmer’s market!

We have a right to defend this cannabis farmer’s market from attacks by the police using non-violent arrest resistance tactics – “hug power”.

For more information regarding the events of July 1st, 2015, please see this link here: 

http://www.cannabisculture.com/content/2015/07/...


We are prepared to go to court to argue that the steps we took are required to force the rest of society to include the poor growers and poor dealers and stigmatized users into the new “legal marijuana” model.

The current “legalization” of medical marijuana leaves much to be desired. In terms of the users, it excludes and/or stigmatizes and/or creates unnecessary barriers for access to cannabis to teens, the poor, and those who would choose to use cannabis for preventive medicine. It also creates unnecessary economic barriers for participation in cultivation and retail.

Prime Minister Steven Harper’s “MMPR” system prevents all but millionaires from participating in the supply of cannabis, while Vancouver Mayor Gregor Robertson and his council have made it nearly impossible to participate in dispensing cannabis unless one is in possession of 100 thousand dollars in infrastructure and another 30 to 35 thousand dollars in licensing.

To activists, throwing 50% to 70% of users and 70% to 90% percent of the growers and dealers under the bus is unacceptable. To keep the math simple, activists in Vancouver have adopted the “no smoker/dealer/grower left behind” rule – we want our economy to be as inclusive as possible, and leave no harmless people as targets for the police. That means everyone gets a seat at the legalization table. Everyone is legit.

We are demonstrating how well the farmer’s market model works by holding it twice a year and defending it with our arrest resistance tactics – 30,000 people attend and the medical problems are less serious than Prime Minister Steven Harper’s son’s alcohol-drenched 18th birthday party! If only the Senate Report’s recommendation of 16 years old as a legal age to buy cannabis were heeded, nobody would have to risk death to participate in our Prime Minister’s son’s happy celebration! They could have a non-lethal euphoric option!

But we need your help!

A good lawyer costs money. We need a minimum of 7500.00 just to get started. With your help, we can defend the right to fight for an inclusive cannabis legalization market, to make sure everyone can take advantage of pot peace.

We have a right to a cannabis farmer’s market!
We have a right to defend this cannabis farmer’s market from
attacks by the police using non-violent arrest resistance tactics – “hug
power”. For more information regarding the events of July 1st, 2015, please see this link here: http://www.cannabisculture.com/content/2015/07/...
We are prepared to go to court to argue that the steps we
took are required to force the rest of society to include the poor growers and
poor dealers and stigmatized users into the new “legal marijuana” model. 
The current “legalization” of medical marijuana leaves much
to be desired. In terms of the users, it excludes and/or stigmatizes and/or
creates unnecessary barriers for access to cannabis to teens, the poor, and
those who would choose to use cannabis for preventive medicine. It also creates
unnecessary economic barriers for participation in cultivation and retail.
Prime Minister Steven Harper’s “MMPR” system prevents all
but millionaires from participating in the supply of cannabis, while Vancouver
Mayor Gregor Robertson and his council have made it nearly impossible to
participate in dispensing cannabis unless one is in possession of 100 thousand
dollars in infrastructure and another 30 to 35 thousand dollars in licensing. 
To activists, throwing 50% to 70% of users and 70% to 90%
percent of the growers and dealers under the bus is unacceptable. To keep the
math simple, activists in Vancouver have adopted the “no smoker/dealer/grower
left behind” rule – we want our economy to be as inclusive as possible, and
leave no harmless people as targets for the police. That means everyone gets a
seat at the legalization table. Everyone is legit. 
We are demonstrating how well the farmer’s market model
works by holding it twice a year and defending it with our arrest resistance
tactics – 30,000 people attend and the medical problems are less serious than
Prime Minister Steven Harper’s son’s alcohol-drenched 18th birthday
party! If only the Senate Report’s recommendation of 16 years old as a legal
age to buy cannabis were heeded, nobody would have to risk death to participate
in our Prime Minister’s son’s happy celebration! They could have a non-lethal
euphoric option!
But we need your help!
A good lawyer costs money. We need a minimum of 7500.00 just
to get started. With your help, we can defend the right to fight for an
inclusive cannabis legalization market, to make sure everyone can take
advantage of pot peace.

story:
Your Kitchen

I am a busy working mother and grandmother.  There has been times in my life when I have worked three or four jobs at a time to make ends meet. I am a qualified chef but I have worked in many industries and one thing they all have in common is that your job takes up most of your time.

When you get home from work there is always work to be done at home, and usually the first thing you hear when you walk in the door - "Hey Mum, What's for Dinner?" (its enough to drive you crazy).

It got me thinking what there needs to be place to get a good old fashion family dinner, hot and ready on the way home. The options are not good! Greasy fast food loaded with salt, supermarket pre-packed food that looks nothing like the picture or expensive "gourmet" meals for special occasions.

I thought to myself I can do something about this, I need to create an option for healthy quick family meals that can be picked up quick, even through a drive thru. So i came up with :

Your Kitchen.

So my research began:

Being a Chef i already have the knowledge and recipes.  I will need find a property to lease in a good location to accommodate my customers that will allow for a drive thru window as well as some car parking, kitchen equipment, marketing fund and a few months of expenses to get going:
  • $50,000 secures building for lease, business licensing, kitchen equipment and expenses for the first 6 months

The Impact

One of the biggest drivers for me has to be giving healthier options in food choices for families.  We are all so busy nowadays so I want to give people some extra time in their day.

I will also be catering for specific dietary requirements including food allergies, food intolerance and lifestyle choices(low fat, high protein etc.)

The future holds so many possibilities for this idea, franchising based on the franchisees passion for the concept is one of the possibilities.

I have surveyed people within my area asking them about their purchase of fast food and an overwhelming number agree that if they had a choice between fast food or good food fast they would buy from Your Kitchen.

The answer to one of the survey questions that may surprise you is that a large number of people in the survey said they felt guilty about feeding their family fast food. I want to get this business going not only to make changes in my life but to make a difference.

Risks & Challenges

It wont be easy entering the take away market, the big guys have more marketing, they are established and they are cheap.

I will be tapping into the power of the people - my strategy is to do some direct marketing in office buildings, factories and schools, using flyers and yummy samples as well as Social media campaigning and community markets.

Another approach will be to market within fitness centers and gyms as well as health food outlets and clinics.

Other Ways You Can Help

Tell people about it, share on social media, feed back is always appreciate and please use the Indiegogo share tools!

story:
Jamboo is our community in paradise.

Greetings and hugs from our community!

We're group of friends enjoying  design, art, sports, self-improvement, cooking, dancing and dj'ing, biking, sailing, yoga and many many more. 

That's our way of living, exploring the world and improving ourselves. 

Luckily this year we've found a fabulous place where we can live together doing stuff we like. 

It's a little camp in one of the most amazing places in the world. 

We call it - Jamboo, a space which brings happiness and sunshine to our souls.

Our dream now is 

to make visiting Jamboo possible for 

literally everyone.

Yes, you can come here and stay for free for a while. We'll accommodate any traveller who lost ticket or left without money.

Or you can order one of our special trips (see in perks) and spend amazing time with us.

We really want you to visit Jamboo and feel that amazing energy.

Join our movement and make our community grow!


What's so special about this place?

First of all it's on the beach on fabulous tropical island. It's an opportunity for everyone to spend time in paradise and feel the unique Jamboo spirit.

We've preciously gathered best activities 

for your joy and self improvement. 

We can already offer:  yoga, sky-surfing, chakra centre, alfa gravity, human design and freelifing centre, kayaking, massage, acoustic moon sauna, open air gym, photo studio, beauty salon, elephant trapping, bike rides, boat trips, jeep rides, snorkeling and diving, jungle parties, fool moon party, DYI workshops (furniture, lamps and illumination, jewelry), art studio, bike and car driving school.
You can never get bored in Jamboo!
We also have a restaurant with thai, american and european cuisine in our camp.
Check our perks!
Our best proposition is 4 special vacation trips: 

10 days of amazing health, party, extreme or romantic experience. 

Just make a choice how you want to spend your time - going to chakra center and yoga sessions to feel better and explore your soul or visit the best night parties in the world and meet crazy people, go extreme or spend the loveliest and fantastically romantic time with your beloved one.
It's not a boring hotel vacation it's something you'll never forget!
Welcome to Jamboo!

Support Jamboo community by getting yourself our fancy t-shirts.

Or get our special Jamboo Girls 2016 Calendar.

Please contribute to Jamboo!


Location.

Jamboo is situated on the Koh Phangan island in amazing Thailand.
Koh Phangan (pronounced KOH pa-nGan with G as in mango) is an island in southern Thailand known as a land of coconut trees and the world famous Full Moon Party (electronic dance music event for around 30,000 party-goers). 

Today Jamboo is a camp where we live. It's capacity is up to 10 people but we're looking to extend it to 50. 

Since we're creative and hardworking friends we're building it ourselves. Our local supporters joined to help.

Meet the team.

My name's Max, I'm 28 and I do interior and illumination design in Contora Customs. I travel, explore the world, get new and share experiences. I'm driving teacher. I love life and my aim is to help people improval both spiritual and physically.

Here's Koh Phangan's mayor and I.


I'm Sam Jamboo co-founder, previously was professional football player. Now I'm working in fashion industry. Owner of the fashion brand MFB.


I'm Vitaly, digital marketer and designer. 


In Jamboo I'm boat captain and cocktails inventor.


Already with Jamboo.

Local kids' football team.


Japanese moto team.



Yoga master.


Our friend, Anna Z.


Our jewelry master. He made Jamboo silver coulomb.



The kindest dog on the island.


What We Need to Make it Happen.

As we're looking to increase Jamboo's capacity and gather more exciting activities we'll need a lot of materials and equipment.

The more money we raise the more we'll be able to add and build. We have unlimited room to improve. And everything is for our visitors of course.

Now we're looking to add:

Building and equipment: dock for diving, bamboo for building, kitchen and bar equipment, beach equipment, sport inventory.

Transport: truck for beach cleaning, speed boat to meet guests in airport and trips to national park, quad bike, 4 bikes honda zoom, 1 kawasaki, 1 jeep, 10-12 bicycles, 5 beach segways, jet ski.

New spaces: sports area (tennis, basketball, football, workout space), gardening space, coworking (so you could stay with us and keep working remotely. We'll also have lectures and educational sessions here), spa, souvenir shop.

Electricity: electrics (lamps and illumination), radio sets, we also looking to install sun batteries and wind turbines to gather electricity.

Tech: TV, cooling systems, Xbox, fridges.


The Impact.

Our mission is to make visiting Jamboo possible for everyone. 

We want to share experiences and open new horizons for people.

We really want you to visit us and become our friend!

Join Jamboo community! Spread the word!

Please help us to make it happen and to add more happy people to this world!

We promise to share photos, videos and feedbacks of our guests so you could see it happening.


Up To Help?!

Help us to spread the word and make noise about Jamboo Project!

Take a pause and think when and with whom you'd like to visit us. Need any help or advice? Feel free to contact us. 



We can't wait to meet you in Jamboo!

Thanks everyone who already supports us!

Follow us:

Jamboo!

Happiness in freedom.

P.S. Special thanks to video producers whose video helped us in our promo.
http://www.xinalaniretreat.com
Douglas Stratton
http://www.rodgotfried.com
http://www.toonfish.tv
Oliver Astrologo
www.christophehamon.com
Trevor Owsley
Andreas G Fiskeseth
The Music Bed
Duke Dumont
Kacpowsky
One two trip. Sasha Tikhomirov.
http://www.perspectives.co.nz
Virgin records.
Miami dolphins.
Captain Jo boat charter.

story:
I am not going to lie, I am starting an Indie GoGo campaign because I need your help! I have a blog that  I really take as my pride and joy but to be honest, I have not been able to really blog in the past couple of weeks because I have hit a major snag financially. Which is not good considering a part of the reason I started my blog is because of the fact that I love saving money, and couponing, however I haven’t done much couponing. I lost my job which was supposed to bring in an income to have on a weekly basis to work around my modeling and blogging, clearly that didnt happen because they fired me. My Bank account went in the negative by $635 and I am still in debt more than what I can fathom and it sucks! So I am reaching out to you guys for help to get my blog to where it should be. hire a business success coach, work on marketing, redesign my blog and really give it the attention it needs also do the below! so please helping me out with this to accomplish my goals will greatly be appreicated. 

With all of that said after talking to my friend yesterday I decided as a way to keep me motivated to fix this situation that I am going to put together a full complied list of all of the possible ways that I can make money and write goals and deadlines. Consider this my Bloggers Income Report Plan, I am going to show where I am at as of today (debt included) where I would like to be in the next few months.

What else do I have to lose when I really have nothing.

I am even going to research and look into Financial budgeting programs such as

PersonalCapital.com

Mint.com

LearnVest.com

I figure by me looking into programs like this it will help me to create goals and stick to them and get to it.

with this being my current income and being in debt IT Just goes to show you I have work to do.

Current Debt May 28,2015

Medical bills: $882

GE Bill: $1,098

Verizon Wireless: $402

Capital one: $762

Paypal Credit : $331

Student Loans: 21,000

Total Debt: $62,400

Now If I stick to promoting and build my traffic to my blog and find another part time job continue modeling and use the above streams of income and start coupoing again and add the below to my plan. I believe that I can truely pay off my debt and grow my net worth to at least $200,000 by the end of the year. Its high goal but IT doesnt hurt to try especially if you follow a budget and stick to it.

What I would like to add to my streams of income.

Consulting program

Model classes

Ebooks

blogging classes

social media management

I wrote this post because I wanted to show you guys I am human, and that yea it may look like everything is okay on the outside its actually not okay on the inside. I wrote it for someone to see the struggle and say if they are going through it and making it, I can get through it as well. So I hope that this inspires someone. 

What do you think of my plan is there any thing that you would add? What are suggestions in terms of getting out of ebt and what are the other ways to make money blogging? Comment I would love to hear what you have to say.

story:
We are now live www.sendabox.co

What is Send a Box?:


Send a Box is super easy way to send a collection of beautiful gifts, for any occasion. We are unique, in that we are not a subscription box. Send a Box is all about sending a one off gift to a loved one. The business is 100% online, so whether you’re sat at home on your computer or out and about on your mobile it’s so easy to access , very simple to use.

Quite simply the ideal modern day, gift giving platform...well, we certainly think so.

(Please note that currently we can only deliver within the UK.)


Our Boxes:

Our initial offer will be 5 themed boxes. To start we will have a:

  • Love Box (Subject to change)

  • *Thank You Box (Subject to change)

  • *Take a Minute Box (Subject to change)

  • *Bloke Box (Subject to change)

  • *Sunshine Box (Subject to change)


But the possibilities as we are sure you will know are endless. Pre-ordering means, once launched you will be amongst the first in the UK to be able to send one of these amazing boxes. Our Perks have no expiry, so if you would rather help us now, and save your Perk until we have released a Baby Box, or a Coffee Box etc, later in 2016, great, there’s nothing to stop you.
 

Our Suppliers:

We are working with some amazing suppliers to make our boxes extra special. Here's a list of some of them:

Duffy's Chocolate: Handmade artisan chocolate maker in Cleethorpes

Kent Brushes: Handmade brush manufacturer in Hemel Hempstead, established in 1777.

Made Lovingly Made: Handmade personalised gifts made out of ethically sourced wood.

Poppy Treffy: Handmade quirky homewares and accessories

Teapigs: UK high quality online tea business “come this way tea lovers”…

The Dandy Gent: UK manufactured high quality men’s grooming products for fine English gentlemen!

The Ginger Duck: Delightful handmade soaps and candles from Northumberland

Wise Owl Tea: Simply the tastiest and finest quality herbal organic teas

Boozy Body Care: Delectable cocktail themed body care products.

Gnaw Chocolate: Handmade chocolate from Gnawwwfolk!

Kiss-Air Candles: Soy wax candles, hand poured in Cambridgeshire

Re-Uz: Environmentally friendly, reusable bags, designed in the UK.

Urban Fresh Foods: Just 100% fruit, gently baked to create delicious snacks.

Cottage Coppicing: Handmade craft products from the Welsh sustainable woodland

Joma Jewellery: This UK based business offer a selection of beautiful themed jewellery products

Lilibets Larder: Totally unique selection of Jams, Butters, Preserves & more, made in Lincolnshire.

Smokey Carter: Award winning dry rubs, sauces and spices, all made in the UK.



Our core values:

1) Sourcing really high quality products

2) Supporting local and UK businesses.

3) Keeping the boxes affordable

The Team:

Lisa

Hi, I'm Lisa. With a degree from London College of Fashion, various styling and promotional jobs (even a stint on Harry Potter), my background has been eclectic and fun packed! With children now in the mix I want to continue my creative work by paving a future with an online business that we can nurture and grow! I enjoy giving gifts and believe our balance of useful, fun, unique and edible products makes our boxes not only desirable but something you will want to share.

Nikki

Hi I’m Nikki. I am originally from Lincolnshire but I moved to London to attend drama school where I trained in musical theatre. My early career saw a mixture of acting work and a variety of jobs including many in retail where I learnt to appreciate well made products by companies that really care about their customers. Last year I launched Pluhoo, a web based app for freelancers and the self employed but my passion really lies in products and ecommerce. The idea for Send a Box came about earlier in the year and I haven't looked back since. I am excited to be able to help and feature UK brands and I'm looking forward to getting the boxes out to people in the new year.



How we came about the idea:

A friend of Nikki's was having a tough time and she wanted to send her something just to cheer her up, that was a little bit different. After searching long and hard, there wasn't really anything available currently in the market, so we both talked about the idea and started to think about the business that we could create. Whilst looking for products for our boxes, we realised there was a wealth of amazing brands in the UK, that you can't find on the high street.



Our Indiegogo Campaign - What are we trying to achieve:

We are launching an Indiegogo campaign to generate enough revenue through crowdfunding, to enable us to launch our business -

In total, we are looking to raise £4,500 to buy all of the stock we need and get it off the ground and as a way of incentivising these donations, we are essentially offering a number of "Perks” as a type of pre-ordering system. So if you like the idea and want peace of mind that you have your gifts sorted for the year, keep donating because we will keep giving you boxes.


We wanted to make sure that everyone gets a reward no matter how much they donate. So anyone who donates below £30 gets a percentage off their first order when we launch our online store (for more info, see our perks section).

If we are lucky enough to get more funding we would use this initially for marketing and to introduce more box themes.


Risks:

Our main risk is that we don't receive all the funding needed to reach our goal. However we guarantee that everyone who has chosen a Perk will receive it no matter if our goal isn’t reached.

Disclaimer:

"Delivery of rewards/perks are subject to best efforts and not guaranteed."

PayPal needs the above disclaimer to be displayed on the page. Please be aware that we are very, very, very confident that we can deliver all orders to you. It is a very straight forward process and something that obviously doesn't faze us as it is what our whole business is based upon.

Please note that currently we can only deliver within the UK.
story_txt:
We are now live www.sendabox.coWhat is Send a Box?:Send a Box is super easy way to send a collection of beautiful gifts, for any occasion. We are unique, in that we are not a subscription box. Send a Box is all about sending a one off gift to a loved one. The business is 100% online, so whether you’re sat at home on your computer or out and about on your mobile it’s so easy to access , very simple to use.Quite simply the ideal modern day, gift giving platform...well, we certainly think so.(Please note that currently we can only deliver within the UK.)Our Boxes:
Our initial offer will be 5 themed boxes. To start we will have a:


Love Box (Subject to change)



*Thank You Box (Subject to change)




*Take a Minute Box (Subject to change)



*Bloke Box (Subject to change)



*Sunshine Box (Subject to change)

story:
The Maker Faire is a celebration of local maker culture and community. It is a gathering of fascinating, curious people who enjoy learning and who love sharing what they can do. India is yet to host such a celebration on a grand scale as a Maker Faire but is headed for one in 2016. As a precursor to it, Workbench Projects in collaboration with NASSCOM is hosting the first ever “Mini Maker Faire” in India.

This year we really want to inspire our youth and support their passions in science, technology, engineering, mathematics and the arts. Part of the STEM+A inspiration comes from bringing together other makers from the community: professionals from multinationals, local business leaders, educators, schools, colleges, universities, hacker spaces and other independent organizations. We aim to make Bengaluru Mini Maker Faire 2015 a community-based learning event that inspires anyone and everyone to become a maker, an event which is engaging, active and above all fun! We encourage any organization who wishes to be a part of fostering new innovations and furthering the maker’s spirit in India to come forward and work with us to make this event a success and spearhead it towards the prestigious Maker Faire next year!

story:
A little about Us

We are a highly motivated and driven team of individuals. Our goal is simple, be as convenient as possible and we have been working very hard to make that clear in What’z on. Our passion is making something from nothing, while always growing in business and as individuals.

Our main challenge   is to get enough content on What’z on to make it meaningful to everyone. As we are going to be a global application it makes it that much more of a challenge for us to get content to you as soon as possible.

The Contributions received will help us a great deal with marketing and with the exposure from the campaign will be invaluable to us. All we can ask is Help Us Help you. The more people know about us the more events we can get to you.

Ultimately what What’z on needs most off all is content and exposure. These are the 2 biggest challenges we face.

This is the main reason behind  launching this campaign. The campaign will Give the event host and event seeker the opportunity to grow and evolve with us into something Great. We know if we are able to achieve our goal, What’z on will completely change the way we View the entertainment sector.

With What’z on you will have a convenient and well executed Platform on which you can view an enormous amount of events in an easy, well defined UI.

With this campaign we are looking at broadening our exposure and give event hosts an Indiegogo perk as a way for us to say thank you for supporting us.

Take advantage now and show the world what you have to offer.

What makes us different is also the reason What’z on was created.

For this we will have to go back to the start. some friends and I was thinking of what we were in the mood for that evening. All of us agreed that we are not in the mood for doing the same old thing we usually do on the weekends.

So I was asked to see if I can find something new and exciting for us to do that evening. The only method We knew of was either to have a look on social network or search on-line. 

After about 10 minutes of Searching we gave up as we found nothing on

social networks and for on-line well despite being Re-directed from one page to another we found that it is really difficult and highly frustrating to get a hold of the basic Information needed to see what events are happening Around you.

When you look at advertising from the clients point of view, whether it is a post on social network, banner adverts or external outreach, your advert in most cases is an unwanted distraction. The clients are using those platforms for a completely different reason.

Thus current forms of marketing have a negative aspect before the client even sees what it is about. This is where What’z on stands out from the rest. 

The client uses What’z on specifically to see what event you have to offer and  by doing so they are already viewing your advert in a much  more positive manner.              




Event host

We have designed a very easy to use Dashboard for the event host where advert can be published In a matter of minutes.

First you will log in to your Dashboard and arrive at the main page. Here you can edit your contact information and see all the events you have published in the past.

to start a new event, first you upload a cover photo. This will be your first introduction to the event seekers.

Then you edit your event either by adding a picture or video. Next can preview your advert, select date, category, location, basic information about your event and finally select the package of your choosing. Now you are ready to publish your event to a wide audience with minimal effort and cost.

Event seeker.

Very easy to use web an UI design. We have made What’z on in such a way that you can view multiple types of events almost anywhere in the world.

First you will arrive at the featured screen. From here you can select in what location you want to view your event by simply clicking on the near me, national or browse icons located above the events displayed.

On the right side of the screen you can select the type of events you want to view by selecting one of our categories which consist of: Festivals, Film, Food, Bars, Coffee house, Comedy, Concerts,  E-Sports, Attractions, exhibitions, Live performances, Markets, Nightlife, Sport and theater.

Next you can either share the event that caught your attention on Facebook, Twitter, Google + and Whats App for your friends and family to see.

You can follow your favorite event host and stay up to date with all the up and coming event they have to offer.

story:
<<TRAVELIVING>>

 

A guide for SUSTAINABLE NOMADS, TRIBAL HACKERS &  TRAVEL SERIES from the roads of Latin Amerikua.

 My name is Maia Balam, Im a Mexican traveler, pro-Indigenous activist and multidisciplinary artist, I have been writing this travel guide for more than 4 years and today its more than ready to be shared with the world. At this point I just need the final push & support from my friends and global community to be able to print the first edition of this Travel guide and share with you my most precious possesion, which is: The maps, codes, stories and hacks that I have been creating and collecting along 10 years of traveling solo through the contienent. 

For many years I´ve been wanting to share my knowledge upon many subjects related to travel, Indigenous people, camping hacks and self-emancipation, and it is today in a world that is being remodeled by Global warming, menaced by corporate violence and political instability, that I know its THE right time to activate and train other people into activism, sustainable traveling and self emancipation.  I know that many of my friends and followers want to learn how to travel in the most sustainable and affordable way, very often people ask me where to go and what to do in Latin Amerikua, so in this book I will share all that knowledge with you:

  • How to travel on a budget  
  • How to prepare for camping like a pro
  • How to be of service to Indigenous communities
  • Volunteer at diverse projects in different countries
  • How to take care of yourself, nature and others while creating your income on the road,
  • How to feel confident and successfully integrate into every country and culture that you want to visit, support or live with. 

After printing the book in December and shiping it to my supporters in January I will also give the project a continuity by producing a Travel show in February with my Partner Jordin Stallman who is my best best ally in this quest and enterprise, and who will help me co-produce & film the travel series in the next  months where we will be traveliving Across Latin Amerikua visiting Ancient Tribes, places of power, sustainable projects, and Indigenous Ecological causes in Mexico, Costa Rica, Peru, Colombia and Ecuador.

          

By acquiring this book you will be able to design your own journey across Latin Amerikua, prepare and activate yourself into a more sustainable lifestyle, travel hacks to save money,  learn all you need to be a sustainable nomad, visit the most unbelievable and pristine paradises, learn how to cultivate and offer your tools and skills along the way, and as an extra perk you will also be able to follow our journey through social media and get new ideas and inspiration to visit new places and join certain cutting edge projects and communities that we will be showcasing along the way.

 In this book you will find the following content>>

 

 What you will get by Helping us::::

  • A signed copy of TRAVELIVING including printed maps for 5 different countries.
  • Different special edition boxsets containing:
  • Marco Polo Boxset:  Vintage Compass + maps + book + postcards in a wooden box.
  • Von Humboldt Boxset:  Vintage Compass + maps + book + postcards + stainless camping knife w mini lamp in a gorgeous hand made wooden box.                                                          
  • Unique Jewelry pieces from my Mayan Fair Trade collection of jade, amber, obsidian, beads and silver. 
  • Private Travel coaching video call sessions with Maia Balam to help you design the travel of your dreams through Latin Amerikua`s hidden gems.
  • Private Business coaching video call session with Maia Balam to help you design and implement your micro business and investments. 
  • Private Life coach video call with Maia Balam to help you overcome any kind of doubts, insecurities or problems in your daily life. 

The Mayan Fair Trade Jewelry Line:::::

   

:::::About the Video coaching sessions::::

Meet Your personal Travel Coach:::: 

You will get access to a video call meeting to answer your travel questions + I will help you design a successful and safe trip +  will tell you my hacks to save money and will give you the motivation  to take that leap of faith into your next travel destination or home. 

Meet Your personal micro Business Developer & importations coach::::

 Are you interested in developing a sustainable business? I will teach you how to maintain your business while "on the road", and how to multiply your investments and importations while creating a fair trade brand that helps people in undeveloped countries. 

Meet Your personal Life coach:::
Do you need guidance and support taking decisions with your next step in life?                               Having worked as an advisor for several different leaders and non profit organizations, experienced dozens of fields of work in my life, plus having the skills to interact with diverse cultures has given me a broad experience in human relations. You could ask me anything and I will answer with my highest intuition and logical mind to guide you through several solutions.

 

<<<<THE TRAVELIVING TOOLS>>>

 

<<<The impact and goals of TRAVELIVING>>>

 

I want to be able to share with the global conscious community of travelers the tools that allowed me to have a successful nomadic lifestyle, so I will give to you the codes and hacks that had saved me thousands of dollars in every trip and expeditions I have done around the world, but first and foremost: I want to help other people to become a self emancipated and productive member of the human family, because I know a lot of people are breaking their heads into figure out ways to migrate into other countries either for vacation or residence.  Through this book and online travel series we want to help motivate other people to jump into the world and explore what it is to feel free, confident and self assured that the world is a more friendly place that what we have been shown in social media and mainstream news.  

             Ç

 

>>>> TRAVELIVING IS NOT ONLY A LIFESTYLE BUT ALSO A SOCIAL CAUSE >>>>

With TRAVELIVING we want to change the perception of the world around us, and make it into a more friendly and accesible place, a world where we can re-create the reality that we want to see, rather than repeat what we have been programmed to believe. 

*  For that reason, and because we believe in sharing abundance with the people that most need it, for each 2 Books, box sets or any piece of jewelry sold we will give a box worth of one week of food and clothes to an unprivileged family in Mexico.

         

             

 

The Online Nomad video series:

  For 2 years I have been writing a travel blog and producing a few pilot chapters of an online series and interviews that I want to build up around the places that I visit every year. The last 2 video chapters where made around Envision Festival costa rica, and on February 2017, I will embark on a new series of chapters with the help of my beloved, Jordin Stallman (who is also a great story teller, artist of all sorts, sound engineer and camera man) and together we will share on video and blogs the exotic locations that we will discover in our journeys, the lessons and travel hacks that we have discovered. We want to share our adventures with our friends, family and community at large, to prove that we can live a different reality and become our own bosses while living our dreams every day if we really place all our efforts, resources and focus into being sustainable, in service to the world around us and free.  "A new world is possible."

 

  •  You can see some of my previous video series and read some of my articles and blog at:          www.maiabalam.tumblr.com

 Other ways to support our project & my book 

If you cant buy something for the time being you can still help us by reposting this campaign in your social media, or even better, you can send private messages to friends sharing our campaign.

          

<<< Thank you so much for your time and interest in this quest,  I hope that this book and online series will help you to design the journey of your dreams + empower yourself to travel self-sustainably through Latin Amerikua and help us make the world a safer and more generous place for everyone. >>>>

How to feel confident and successfully integrate into every country and culture that you want to visit, support or live with.
