By acquiring this book you will be able to design your own journey across Latin Amerikua, prepare and activate yourself into a more sustainable lifestyle, travel hacks to save money,  learn all you need to be a sustainable nomad, visit the most unbelievable and pristine paradises, learn how to cultivate and offer your tools and skills along the way, and as an extra perk you will also be able to follow our journey through social media and get new ideas and inspiration to visit new places and join certain cutting edge projects and communities that we will be showcasing along the way.
 In this book you will find the following content>>








 
 What you will get by Helping us::::

A signed copy of TRAVELIVING including printed maps for 5 different countries.
Different special edition boxsets containing:

Marco Polo Boxset:  Vintage Compass + maps + book + postcards in a wooden box.

Von Humboldt Boxset:  Vintage Compass + maps + book + postcards + stainless camping knife w mini lamp in a gorgeous hand made wooden box.                                                          

Unique Jewelry pieces from my Mayan Fair Trade collection of jade, amber, obsidian, beads and silver. 

Private Travel coaching video call sessions with Maia Balam to help you design the travel of your dreams through Latin Amerikua`s hidden gems.

Private Business coaching video call session with Maia Balam to help you design and implement your micro business and investments. 

Private Life coach video call with Maia Balam to help you overcome any kind of doubts, insecurities or problems in your daily life. 

The Mayan Fair Trade Jewelry Line:::::
   

:::::About the Video coaching sessions::::
Meet Your personal Travel Coach:::: 
You will get access to a video call meeting to answer your travel questions + I will help you design a successful and safe trip +  will tell you my hacks to save money and will give you the motivation  to take that leap of faith into your next travel destination or home. 
Meet Your personal micro Business Developer & importations coach::::
 Are you interested in developing a sustainable business? I will teach you how to maintain your business while "on the road", and how to multiply your investments and importations while creating a fair trade brand that helps people in undeveloped countries. Meet Your personal Life coach:::Do you need guidance and support taking decisions with your next step in life?                               Having worked as an advisor for several different leaders and non profit organizations, experienced dozens of fields of work in my life, plus having the skills to interact with diverse cultures has given me a broad experience in human relations. You could ask me anything and I will answer with my highest intuition and logical mind to guide you through several solutions.
 
<<<<THE TRAVELIVING TOOLS>>> <<<The impact and goals of TRAVELIVING>>> I want to be able to share with the global conscious community of travelers the tools that allowed me to have a successful nomadic lifestyle, so I will give to you the codes and hacks that had saved me thousands of dollars in every trip and expeditions I have done around the world, but first and foremost: I want to help other people to become a self emancipated and productive member of the human family, because I know a lot of people are breaking their heads into figure out ways to migrate into other countries either for vacation or residence.  Through this book and online travel series we want to help motivate other people to jump into the world and explore what it is to feel free, confident and self assured that the world is a more friendly place that what we have been shown in social media and mainstream news.  
             Ç
 
>>>> TRAVELIVING IS NOT ONLY A LIFESTYLE BUT ALSO A SOCIAL CAUSE >>>>
With TRAVELIVING we want to change the perception of the world around us, and make it into a more friendly and accesible place, a world where we can re-create the reality that we want to see, rather than repeat what we have been programmed to believe. 
*  For that reason, and because we believe in sharing abundance with the people that most need it, for each 2 Books, box sets or any piece of jewelry sold we will give a box worth of one week of food and clothes to an unprivileged family in Mexico.
         
             
 

The Online Nomad video series:  For 2 years I have been writing a travel blog and producing a few pilot chapters of an online series and interviews that I want to build up around the places that I visit every year. The last 2 video chapters where made around Envision Festival costa rica, and on February 2017, I will embark on a new series of chapters with the help of my beloved, Jordin Stallman (who is also a great story teller, artist of all sorts, sound engineer and camera man) and together we will share on video and blogs the exotic locations that we will discover in our journeys, the lessons and travel hacks that we have discovered. We want to share our adventures with our friends, family and community at large, to prove that we can live a different reality and become our own bosses while living our dreams every day if we really place all our efforts, resources and focus into being sustainable, in service to the world around us and free.  "A new world is possible."
  You can see some of my previous video series and read some of my articles and blog at:          www.maiabalam.tumblr.com

 Other ways to support our project & my book 
If you cant buy something for the time being you can still help us by reposting this campaign in your social media, or even better, you can send private messages to friends sharing our campaign.
          
<<< Thank you so much for your time and interest in this quest,  I hope that this book and online series will help you to design the journey of your dreams + empower yourself to travel self-sustainably through Latin Amerikua and help us make the world a safer and more generous place for everyone. >>>>

story:
Amanecer Counseling Services : Feminist Psychotherapy 

Hola! I'm Amelia Ortega, the founder of Amanecer Counseling Services. Amanecer is a small Feminist psychotherapy practice in New York City.  Individual and family sessions  at Amanecer include building tools and learning techniques to heal from trauma that include somatic approaches ( attention to and use of the body in the healing process).  Amanecer is a new practice that is transitioning in 2017 to become a Worker Owner Cooperative business.  Amanecer is a community based practice- treatment includes connection to community wellness programs and introduction to managing mental health symptoms through mind and body care. 

This campaign is important to me as both a queer woman of color provider of mental health care and as someone who has been healed by this work.  I've had profound experiences as a witness to hundreds of individuals' movement toward change and liberation centered lives. I've been in social work practice for 13 years and have worked to increase access to meditation, somatic awareness, aromatherapy and expressive arts therapy within communities traditionally not included.  My work has occurred in residential housing, psychiatric hospitals, shelters, and public high schools.  As a radical social worker I am now using my training, experiential knowledge and social justice framework within community mental health services. 

As a contributor to this campaign you are supporting mental health practice for queer people of color and health work that acknowledges the impact of systemic oppression on the wellness of our communities.  Your contributions will support our initial Community Therapy Scholarship, which will be provided to clients who are living at or below poverty level, and will ensure that weekly sessions are accessible for free or reduced out of pocket costs.  Your contributions will also support the initial 90 days of overhead to launch this new practice model and to support the transition towards becoming a Worker Owned Cooperative office in 2017. 

The wellness of our collective health community will be directly supported by your contributions!

What Amanecer Needs & Community Benefits

I am seeking to raise $5000 to cover the start up costs of this Feminist Psychotherapist Practice.  The funding will be distributed in the following ways:

$2000 will be allocated to cover rent for 2 months. While I have located a low cost space, the landlord is requiring a total of 4 months rent for signing.

$2500 will be placed in the Therapy Scholarship fund. This amount will provide one and half months ( 6 weeks) of weekly sessions or 12 weeks of bi-weekly sessions for 5 low income clients who are not currently covered by insurance for mental health treatment.

$500 will be used to purchase therapeutic tools such as books, children's developmental games and somatic experiencing tools ( stress balls, bi-lateral brain stimulating games and educational resources for our resource library). 

As a THANK YOU for supporting this woman of color practice and supporting mental health liberation, contributors will be recognized on a designated wall celebrating community supporters ("This Community supports Feminist practice and Mental Health Liberation") AND will receive: 

$1-$25  A personal thank you card

$26-$50  Above items, plus 3 inspirational pocket cards for daily meditation

$75- $100  All Items above, plus healing herbal teas for relaxation and calming

$ 101-$200  All items above, plus an Amanecer tote bag and a relaxation tool kit

$201- $500 All items above, plus a Supreme Self Care and Relaxation package featuring works by local artists 

The Impact

The impact of your contribution cannot be overstated.  This is a challenging post-election season with many struggles ahead.  Communities of color, queer communities and Muslim communities are being targeted with increased violence . Sustaining community and sustaining ourselves as health workers requires a new approach to building economic and social supports.  Amanecer Counseling is committed to meeting the growing need for accessible, affordable, holistic and non pathologizing treatment in a culturally relevant and anti-oppressive environment. 

Please consider contributing to building this new therapeutic space and a new opportunity for community healing.

Other Ways You Can Help

I appreciate any forms of support you can provide - not only direct funding support. 

Please share this campaign with your friends, families, allies and health professionals in your lives.  There are many of us working together right now to increase services during this post-election month when many communities are being targeted with increased violence.

  • You can reach out to me personally if you have questions or suggestions for ways to share this campaign- you can also use the Indiegogo share tools here.

story:
Loadapp  is the first and the only flat rate freight shipping platform connecting shippers with carriers instantly. No rate quote, no rate haggling, no load alerts, no backhauls, no multitiered middlemen and no load boards.

 

We really believe Loadapp will be the future of logistics.

Find out why,..

 

Just a few weeks ago the The American Trucking Associations stated that the trucking industry revenue hit a record  726 billion dollar.

After reading this article some people might think that carriers or owner operators in the trucking industry are making very good money. But that is not the case here. After working within the industry for many years and having to speak with too many truck drivers, carriers and owner operators, its sad to say that most small carriers and owner operators are struggling to make ends meet.

 

The Problem

Most of the money goes to the big name freight brokerage firms, and another big chunk goes to freight brokers and freight agents and the rest pocket change goes to the owner operators or carriers.

 

The way the trucking industry operates now is that most shippers or freight brokers will negotiate a shipping rate with shippers, then the freight broker or freight agent post the loads on load boards or they will find carriers or owner operators on their own who will be willing to move the load for less money than they got from the shippers.

   That’s when the problem begins. Unfortunately there is no set commission rate regulated by State or federal that we know about.   By the time the load gets to the carrier or owner operators the shipping rare will fall way below $2 a mile, at times it goes under $1 a mile. Do you see where this is going? We have witnessed in many occasions where a freight brokers making more money in one single load than the carrier or owner operator.

 

That’s when the idea of Loadapp came along, instead of sitting back and watch the industry get destroyed, a few owner operators and concerned like minded people wanted to make a change for the better.

 

The hard working men and women who use their own equipment to move the load and pay with their time and money the expenses required to move the load should get a better rate.

 

The Solution

 

Instead of whining, complaining and getting frustrated we came up with Loadapp. Loadapp is a flat rate freight-shipping platform connecting shippers and carriers instantly. Shippers will simply submit their shipping information within their dashboard and one of Loadapp’s dedicated carrier near the pickup location accepts the tender in minutes. No middle man, no rate quoting, no rate haggling.  

 

Loadapp will also pay carriers in two business days. No more waiting for 30 to 60 days for payment. Loadapp will enable owner operators and small carriers to fight with the big name brokerages who are making it difficult to make a living for the smaller guys.

 

We have hundreds of carriers sign up each day. We have a noble idea to fight the current trucking business conditions and we need your help in making this a reality.  We are overwhelmed with the request we get from owner operators and carriers nation-wide, but with limited funding its been hard facilitating with all the requests we get in a daily bases. Loadapp needs your support today. 

 

Lets say NO to rate quotes, load alerts, backhauls and load boards. Support  Loadapp today!

 

If you are not in a position to support today, please help in getting the word go around. Share on social media and tell your friends about Loadapp. Get involved, participate in the forum found on our website. We really do appreciate you!

We are constantly evolving Loadapp, so if you notice a bug or have a suggestion or question please drop us a line at try@loadapp.co, we really want to hear from you!

To stay up to date with the latest development we invite you to follow us on twitter.com/loadapp and also at facebook.com/tryloadapp.

Our ultimate goal is to build a perfect on demand flat rate freight shipping service nation-wide but first and foremost we want every single carrier/owner operator and shipper to be 100% satisfied. And if that requires going beyond just providing our noble service, we will be happy to do so.

So here is our appeal to you, if you need any assistant with anything, be it signing up, how it works or what Loadapp will do for you as a carrier, owner operator, shipper, or you just want someone to bounce your ideas off, please do not hesitate to reach out to us

 

- The Loadapp Team

story:
A truly family affair, Lion & Owl has at its helm Crystal Platt and Kirsten Hansen, a couple whose talents meld as well as their marriage. Crystal brings over 15 years of experience as a chef in Eugene, with a culinary education as a foundation. Her experience as the chef of one of Eugene's most well-regarded restaurants has earned her a following of people excited to be part of her food projects. Kirsten provides the business balance, champagne-loving palate and a warm hospitality to complement the Crystal's creations. Together, they have hosted culinary events and food experiences that people are still talking about; brunch in this super cool environment should be no exception. 

Lion & Owl will be a mini restaurant serving brunch on a daily basis. Located in Eugene, Oregon within a vintage 1977 Airstream with adorable indoor seating and an additional outdoor patio, the location itself is unique and quite unlike any other food truck currently in the US.  Focused on our beautiful local products, we will  be serving a brunch concept unique to the Eugene market. We plan on bringing an internationally innovative twist to the brunch menu, featuring vegetable-centric items within a framework of recognizable, comforting staples, all accompanied by a well-curated sparkling wine selection.

Our Eugene community is important to us and our business plan also includes two days a month dedicated to feeding the needy in Eugene.  We would like to share the beautiful products made by our farmer friends with everyone, and we are committed to sharing the joy of brunch with all the people in our community, including those less fortunate than ourselves. A great deal of people require our help to have a proper meal, and we would like to provide that in a comfortable environment, allowing those in need to have a true dining experience with dignity and class.

Not only is this our dream project (Crystal gets to play with vegetables and great product all day and Kirsten gets to play with bubbles and make people smile all day), but it is what Eugene, Oregon desperately needs.  Brunch is painfully lacking in the Emerald city, and this campaign will help us bring some good eats to many a good people.  The luxurious comfort of brunch brings people together, and nothing could make us happier than providing a space for people to gather and eat. We have the airstream, the space, the talent and the support of many hungry folks in Eugene, we just need the capital to get it going this spring.

 

What We Need & What You Get

We have a great business plan in place (we are happy to share it, if you are interested) and the city of Eugene has been very enthusiastic about supporting us with a loan.  However, our current situation doesn't fit into the confines of the federal requirements. Boohoo. We are now reaching to this more creative source of funding to help us launch this spring and build the foundation for this business.

The $30,000 we are striving for in this campaign will help us cover the cost of running the business for this first year:

  • Rent at our sweet location is $300 month
  • Licensing and permits will be $1000
  • Patio buildout & furniture $5000
  • Starting food inventory $3000
  • Opening wine inventory $2000
  • Cushions for bench seating $2000
  • Tabletop & silverware $2000
  • Kitchen equipment $2500

With your contribution, not only will you help build a brunch spot for the hungry in Eugene, you will get our undying love, eternal respect and a permanent reservation at the hottest brunch ticket in town.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

SPREAD THE WORD

Do you know someone who loves brunch? Loves Eugene?  Loves us? We need your support in plenty of other ways, so if a financial contribution isn't in your wheelhouse, please share this campaign with kind souls that might be willing to help, or simply bring all your friends in for brunch.  

COME AND EAT

We are looking to be open May 1st.  Check out our website, Facebook and instagram for updates, menus and friends and family opening parties.

www.lionandowlbrunch.com

story:
A new beginning

New owner, Felicita Chipak, was saddened like many loyal customers were to hear that Columbia's doors were closing for good at the end of 2016. She shopped there for her supplies for face-painting gigs and costume & beauty needs.  After a meeting with previous owner, Laura Spaey, as Columbia closed, a plan was devised to transition ownership and to continue Columbia for many years to come.

    What your contributions will do:  

    • Secure a new 3,000 sq ft location in Kingston to house the costumes and accessories. 
    • Use the new space to allow artists to shine. Costume makers/designers, special effects make-up artists, cosmetologists and many other experts will be invited to share their talents in classes, events and installations.
    • Build a new website that will catalog costume rentals, allow customers to receive loyalty rewards, and offer shipping and in-store pick up options for all of our products.
    • Hire talented individuals that are waiting for the opportunity to teach and assist you.

    What you'll get

    • VIP access and a mask for the Grand-Opening masquerade ball!
    • Discounts on purchases. 
    • A free costume rental every month for 1 year (start coming up with excuses to dress up now)!

    Risks & Challenges

    Finding the right home is important to us. We've always been an Uptown Kingston institution, however, need the space to expand the business. 

    • Creating two locations: A 900 sq ft retail space in Uptown that will house the wigs and beauty supplies, and a 3,000 sq ft costume warehouse.
    • Developing the costume location by September 2017.

    Other Ways You Can Help

    If you're not able to contribute that doesn't mean you can't help:

    Share this campaign widely:

    • Visit our Facebook page and invite your friends to like us: www.facebook.com/columbiacostumes
    • Sign up for our newsletter and share our site: www.columbiacostumes.com
    • Invite everyone to contribute using this link: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/re-discover-...

A new beginning
New owner, Felicita Chipak, was saddened like many loyal customers were to hear that Columbia's doors were closing for good at the end of 2016. She shopped there for her supplies for face-painting gigs and costume & beauty needs.  After a meeting with previous owner, Laura Spaey, as Columbia closed, a plan was devised to transition ownership and to continue Columbia for many years to come.


What your contributions will do:  

Secure a new 3,000 sq ft location in Kingston to house the costumes and accessories. 
Use the new space to allow artists to shine. Costume makers/designers, special effects make-up artists, cosmetologists and many other experts will be invited to share their talents in classes, events and installations.
Build a new website that will catalog costume rentals, allow customers to receive loyalty rewards, and offer shipping and in-store pick up options for all of our products.
Hire talented individuals that are waiting for the opportunity to teach and assist you.


What you'll get

VIP access and a mask for the Grand-Opening masquerade ball!
Discounts on purchases. 
A free costume rental every month for 1 year (start coming up with excuses to dress up now)!


Risks & Challenges
Finding the right home is important to us. We've always been an Uptown Kingston institution, however, need the space to expand the business. 

Creating two locations: A 900 sq ft retail space in Uptown that will house the wigs and beauty supplies, and a 3,000 sq ft costume warehouse.
Developing the costume location by September 2017.


Other Ways You Can Help
If you're not able to contribute that doesn't mean you can't help:
Share this campaign widely:

Visit our Facebook page and invite your friends to like us: www.facebook.com/columbiacostumes

Sign up for our newsletter and share our site: www.columbiacostumes.com

Invite everyone to contribute using this link: https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/re-discover-...

story:
Who We Are & What We Do---

Two small business owners collaborated to form SPEAR, a full service resource to help our community prepare for, respond to, and recover from any and all emergencies and disasters. From self-defense, martial arts and kickboxing to CPR, First Aid, basic & advanced firearms training and safety & security training, our staff provides common sense, easy to follow instruction that you can understand and apply to your everyday lives. We are committed to increasing your level of training and our new facilities are designed to accommodate you and your family.

 

Our community's safety and security is our passion. Our core group of emergency response and military professionals have over 50 years of collective experience to provide you with high quality, World Class training. Many of us have been directly involved in responding to terrorism, major severe weather emergencies, public health emergencies and wildfires. One issue was glaringly evident in each of these responses.....we, as human beings, are grossly under prepared for any emergency. SPEAR is designed to provide stress-free, friendly and family oriented facilities for training, education, equipment and resources to meet the world's safety & security challenges. SPEAR - for everything Safety, Preparedness, Education And Recreation.

 

SPEAR will be located on an approximately 10-acre campus in Charlotte, North Carolina.  Two buildings are included in the current architectural and business plans; however the campus is large enough for future expansion.

 

One building will house our 2,500 square foot self-defense, martial arts and kick boxing facility. This space will allow us to continue to provide our world class Martial Arts training to our current members as well as welcome additional enrollments. We will expand our services to offer after school programs, which will be a balance of leadership, structure and exercise. SPEAR will pick your children up from school and bring them back to our facility where they will start on homework and enjoy a nutritious snack before they complete their martial arts or self-defense training. 

 

SPEAR's second building, with over 15,000 square feet, will allow us to offer expanded classrooms and retail space. This space will allows us to expand our selection of firearms, ammunition, camping gear and accessories. A lounge, available for parties and private events, will be modeled after a mountain lodge with large windows facing our ponds. This space will be open to all patrons, unless reserved for a private event.

 

Our state of the art indoor firing range will include 10 suites with a distance of 25 yards. The suites will be self-contained and will alleviate the nosy neighbor so you can concentrate on your training and skill development. Have more than 2 people? Our suites have doors to adjoining suites so you can feel like you're all together. And, as we want to provide a safe and secure training facility, a firearms instructor will never be more than 15 feet away to answer all your questions.

 

As we currently serve numerous Law Enforcement Agencies, our expansion would include them as well. Through the addition of a force on force Shoot House, using paint tipped, simulated rounds, this training area utilizes duty weapons and tactics and allows each participant to "train as they fight." This practical learning environment can help operators recognize threats on the fly and make decisions under fire. No other training like this is offered in our area. If we receive enough of a demand for the shoot house, it will be offered. If not, we can make this convertible space into an indoor archery range. So, either way, it's an added resource to our facility.

 

In keeping with the "train as you fight" mentality, on the property surrounding our ponds, we will be offering an area for hunters to sight in their bows.....from a tree stand. Nothing gets you ready for hunting season like an area modeled after your hunting grounds. And, if you like the tree stand you train in, it's for sale in our store.

 

As many of SPEAR's staff are Veterans, our dedication to their service and sacrifice remains the driving force of our Mission. Too many of our Veterans have paid the ultimate sacrifice, whether it was in a conflict abroad or when they return to their home soil, and we want to support them.

 

As mentioned before, there are two ponds on property and we will be improving them with natural landscaping and a wheelchair accessible trail around the shoreline.  Whether disabled visibly or not, the return to normalcy is paramount to the health of our Veterans. Fishing, walking, running or rolling is welcome, and greatly encouraged at our facility. After all, these ponds and the natural space surrounding our property is needed green space in our local community, and we are proud to be able to give back. We will also be offering Community Garden space. If you've always wanted to grow your own vegetable garden, but your neighborhood won't allow it, we encourage you to come stake your own plot.

 

What We Need & What You Get---

SPEAR, as an entire project, requires $2 million. This includes acquiring the property, re-zoning, site work, construction, upgrading the pond shoreline and installing the walking trails, operating expenses and increased inventory. When you think of everything we're going to achieve on this property, this is a small price to pay. Could we go bigger? Of course....but it wouldn't allow us to offer our products and services at the value pricing we offer now. However, the campus is large enough for future expansion.

We plan on using the funds as we progress in the project. The first $25,000 will secure our property. The next goal is approximately $500,000 which would be a down payment on a conventional loan. If we were to raise $1 million, that would be a larger down payment to lower our interest rate on a conventional loan. And, if we raise the entire amount of $2 million through IndieGogo, we wouldn't need a conventional loan.....which means the savings gets passed on to you, our community neighbor.

 

What happens if we don't raise our entire goal amount? SPEAR will still be built. It may be delayed by no more than 5 months, but it will be completed in 2018. And the funds you have backed us with will still be utilized for our project.....and the perks will still be honored. So, there's no losing by backing us now. If you've been a customer of ours since our inception, you know how passionate we are about our Mission......and you know this will become reality.

 

If you're interested in backing our project, you can help by purchasing one of our perks. You'll notice how unique they are. From perks we can deliver upon right now to memberships you can pre-buy now at special discounts, we have something for everyone to be able to help us on this Mission. If you purchase the Second Amendment Supporter or Toast to Freedom perks, you get a double perk. Get your t-shirt or stainless drinking mug now and then, when we open, wear or and bring it to SPEAR for 25% off lane and firearm rentals!!!! 

 

These prices, for those who purchase through this IndieGogo campaign, remain your pricing for the life of your membership. They WILL NOT increase. As long as you stay current (for individual, family and corporate memberships), the price you pay today is the price you'll always pay.

 

We sincerely thank you for your support and we look forward to working with you in the future. You can continue to help us by sharing this campaign and sending it to your friends and family.

story:
Last Tuesday (29/11/16) I was on the receiving end of a raid by the local fuzz who had erroneously been led to believe that my house was some kind of crack-palace.

It is not.

My front door was unceremoniously kicked in, and due to an unfortunate turn of events I have been left to foot the bill!!

I am poor, and therefore taking a punt on the good will of friends, well-wishers,  and bobbies-with-a-conscience to help.

 

Huh, minimum amount is five hundred quid but I only need £180 really... any excess (as if) will be spent judicially...

story:
Our Story:

Delia Valenti Eveland, the Mom of 'The Scratching Post Cat Cafe' and all of the future Kitty residents has dreamed of this day since she was a little girl. "After working in event planning,non-profits in other countries, and many years in the food and beverage industry, I decided it was time to really do something I genuinely cared about and make a difference in our community!With help from my husband Terry, the amazing Wilmington community,friends, and family, I am finally able to peruse this dream! "The Scratching Post Cat Cafe not only will we be able to enrich its visitor's life with the company of sweet, cuddly cats that are adoptable... The Cafe is also planning on having some of the freshest food and coffee in Wilmington. "I am hoping to have a variety of vegetarian/vegan options as well as some fun dishes! Options for everyone!  We are also partnering up with a local coffee shop back home in Lake Atitlan, Guatemala, bringing you the best, boldest, most delicious coffee the highlands of Guatemala has to offer! The BEST part of this whole endeavor is that my cafe will help find shelter cats a new home, and that just makes me so happy!"

 

What We Need:

  • The funds we are asking for will go to the inicial startup costs of the cafe. These costs include: rent, kitty adoption fees, construction of the cat lounge and remodel of the building we find. 
  • We also need to purchase a Food truck/or a container to be separate from the cat living area/oasis to abide to county health regulations! These range from $8-15,000. We are just waiting on the funds to locate the right one.

What Do you get for helping?

Thank you so much for helping us out! We have a few "Perks" available for those that want to see The Scratching Post Cat Cafe Succeed! 

The Impact

The Scratching Post Cat Cafe will not only be a great place for humans to visit, it will be a safe haven for the cats living there! We will be taking in all cats, mostly older shelter cats that usually are overlooked in the adoption process.  

  • Taking in 15+ cats will free up space for other furry friends at the shelters. 
  • Exposing the kitties to the public will give them better chances of being adopted.
  • Giving the people of Wilmington a fun, new experience!

Risks & Challenges:

The cat café business model is new to our community so we are creating our very own blueprint! Your support paves the way for our success.

We will announce an opening date as we get further along in the project. Stay tuned to our Facebook page: https://www.facebook.com/TheScratchingPostCatCafe on  our website at https://wilmingtoncatcafe.wixsite.com/thescratchingpost  

and follow us on Instagram! 

We want you to have a catastic experience so we're working diligently to put together a purr-fect place. Many of you have expressed an interest in being part of our team and we're looking forward to meeting you.

We are very dedicated to this project. A successful Indiegogo will move us along quicker and bring our feline friends to us sooner. We're thankful to live in a community that loves and supports animals, and look forward to a successful and fun project!

Thank you, thank you! ❤️ Delia 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please share  !

story:
Who am I?

My name is Jennifer Hardaway and I am looking to raise money to help my business, KleanSpa, advance to the next level. We have been makers of scrumptious bath and body products and perfumes since 2005. However, KleanSpa is growing! We are excited to announce the launch of Phoebe Peacock. We have already launched the perfumery line Phoebe Peacock Parfums here! The quick synopsis on Phoebe. Two years ago, I came across my Grandmother's death certificate. I saw that her mother (my Great Grandmother) was named Phoebe Peacock. Chills instantly came over me and I knew I was destined to create a beautiful lifestyle brand around her name. The perfumery line is the culmination of my recent study of perfumery and the first product of Phoebe Peacock.

Some of you may ask, why would you leave that marriage made-in-heaven with MINDFULnest? One answer. More space! We currently run our entire business out of 300 square feet. And we are GROWING! And we have used every inch of that space!

SO, about two months ago, I was put on alert that a space across the street was opening up. The time has come for us to claim that space!

Here's where you come in!

While we have some of the cash to get started, (I cashed out a Roth Ira early and moved over some saved profits) we are going to need a bunch more bucks. We are asking for your help to get there! Our goal is to build out a beautiful space that our customers and neighborhood can enjoy.

Here's what we need!

Here's a brief list of the things that need to happen once we take over the storefront.

(Did we mention the new space is 998 sq. ft. That's almost 1000 sq. ft.!):

  1. Take out the drop ceiling $350
  2. No need to pay for the main painting, the landlord covers that. Yay! $FREE!
  3. Electrical & Plumbing (for sink to wash dishes). Drywall for covering the drop ceiling removal. Installing extra plugs, installation of overhead lightening, pendants, tracks, adding extra juice to the electrical panel etc... $4000
  4. Purchase lighting. The shop needs lots of it! Track and pendants $2000
  5. Building of fixtures. One for our perfume line Phoebe Peacock. A cabinet that matches an existing trio of shelves that we used in the MINDFULnest scent bar in Santa Monica. Tops for those bars. A hard or pony wall. $3000
  6. Handy man who can install, hang, paint detailed painting when needed. $1000
  7. Purchase shelving and fixtures. Est. $2000
  8. Order components to stock new shelves with delicious KleanSpa products! $2000
  9. Inventory to get us started with the home items, jewelry, cards etc...for The Phoebe Peacock side. $4000
  10. Things we haven't even thought of! $?? $1000?

TOTAL: $19,350 (with some extra for the Indiegogo percentage 8%)

Here's what you get!

Perks, perks, perks! Depending on the level of donation (lending? Pre-sales?) you get certain KleanSpa products or services. For example:

  1. Want just a little something...

For $35 buckaroos, you will receive a Taste of KleanSpa gift set...(Don't eat it).

A small body polish, small body butter and a small scent mist in one of our over 15 scents...(we have scents for men too!)

  1. OR, want to get a BIG perk?

$750

Imagine creating your own scent...but not only that. YOUR bespoke scent will be added to the KleanSpa menu for at least Three Months!

Together, you and Jennifer will design your custom scent, either virtually (if you are not in Los Angeles) or in person. You will then name your scent and we will add it to our KleanSpa scent offerings for a minimum of three months. You can tell all your friends that you have a signature scent at KleanSpa! Ooh la la!

There are these perks and everything in between! All the perks will be given in the form of a Gift Certificate to our shop or website. That way you can choose the scents you would like!

If we don't reach our goal, we will still be able to use the cashola!

Anything will help us, but getting as close to our goal is important so we can get the space together as quickly as possible!

The Impact you will have on our project!

  • One of our many goals is to continue to show the community how scent impacts our lives and how a beautiful space can add to our quality of life. And, now that we have more space, we can accommodate loads more people for blending bashes, classes, shopping…
  • Your support will help us get the word out about us and lift us up to the next level. Plus, if you are one who lives in the community, you will be able to take advantage of our cool space!

What our potential challenges may be?

What if customers don’t come in the door on the other side of the street?

Here’s the thing. We have been in business for 12 ½ years. We already have an established customer base. MINDFULnest will send them over, PLUS, we are next door to Audrey K, who is busy!

  • What CAN you do if you can’t help monetarily?

Please help us get the word out. You never know who might be willing to help, even if they don’t know us! We need you to help spread the word. And don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools for Facebook etc…

 

If you’ve gotten to the end of this, congratulations! And thank you. We are excited and nervous about this next move and could not do it without you!

 

Xoxo

Jennifer & the KleanSpa Minions

Together, you and Jennifer will design your custom scent, either virtually (if you are not in Los Angeles) or in person. You will then name your scent and we will add it to our KleanSpa scent offerings for a minimum of three months. You can tell all your friends that you have a signature scent at KleanSpa! Ooh la la!
There are these perks and everything in between! All the perks will be given in the form of a Gift Certificate to our shop or website. That way you can choose the scents you would like!
If we don't reach our goal, we will still be able to use the cashola!
Anything will help us, but getting as close to our goal is important so we can get the space together as quickly as possible!
The Impact you will have on our project!

One of our many goals is to continue to show the community how scent impacts our lives and how a beautiful space can add to our quality of life. And, now that we have more space, we can accommodate loads more people for blending bashes, classes, shopping…
Your support will help us get the word out about us and lift us up to the next level. Plus, if you are one who lives in the community, you will be able to take advantage of our cool space!

What our potential challenges may be?
What if customers don’t come in the door on the other side of the street?
Here’s the thing. We have been in business for 12 ½ years. We already have an established customer base. MINDFULnest will send them over, PLUS, we are next door to Audrey K, who is busy!
What CAN you do if you can’t help monetarily?
Please help us get the word out. You never know who might be willing to help, even if they don’t know us! We need you to help spread the word. And don’t forget to use the Indiegogo share tools for Facebook etc…
 
If you’ve gotten to the end of this, congratulations! And thank you. We are excited and nervous about this next move and could not do it without you!
 
Xoxo
Jennifer & the KleanSpa Minions

story:
Short Summary

  • Hey I'm Yatri! I studied Socio-Cultural Anthropology at UC San Diego and have always been caring towards humanity. After running an everything on demand delivery business in college for two years I lost passion as I was not delivering the products I believed in as they did not exactly serve our higher purpose. Now I am extremely inspired by all of the conscious companies and products out there that are dedicated towards helping humanity and decided to collect all of them and make them more accessible via delivery! Being very passionate about business and meditation, I have been inspired to do business in the most conscious way possible, with every element sowed with the seed of good intention. 
  • This campaign is important to me because it will truly help Dharma Delivery become a reality. Not just for our company, but for the many other incredible companies we work with that are making real changes in the world at this very moment. 
  • Contributors will help us achieve the establishment of a new standard of conscious business, be helping small companies, reforestation efforts, healthcare, the distribution of education to those in need and more. You will yourself be weaving a new web of interconnected conscious business models. 

What We Need & What You Get

  • The majority of funds are needed so we can guarantee our drivers a fair wage while we scale our growth, and will also be for inventory for our products, legal expenses, and marketing. 
  • All of our perks are directly from us or the companies we work with so you can experience a first hand experience of our vision of conscious consumerism and experience the true impact you make in the world. 
  • The funds will still go toward all of these expenses even if we do not reach our goal that does not mean we will stop going, so any contribution is of tremendous value. 

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean they can't help:

  • Please tell all of your friends and family about us! 
  • Share on Facebook! Tag your friends or family who you may think would be interested.

story:
This isn't just about teaching tumbling, sport acro or sports training, it's about helping the youth in our community believe in themselves, go for their dreams and become responsible individuals.

We (John and Jill Greenidge) started JG Tumbling in September 2016.  We wanted to venture out on our own to provide athletes in our community with John's unique style of coaching.  We were led to a gymnastics facility where we currently rent from and work out of.  We began with just 2 classes and by January 2017 we started the year off with 11 classes.   We have not done any advertising.  This has all been done by word of mouth and social media.  Only 1 of our classes is during prime time.  All other classes are "off" hours.  We have wait lists for most of our classes and now even for private lessons.  With the time constraints, we have outgrown our current facility.  We have put in an offer to rent a building with an option to purchase in 2 years.  But now we need your help!  Our vision for our complex is built off the many aspects of tumbling; sport acro, acro dance, sport martial arts, cheerleading, parkour as well as functional training for sports; football, baseball, basketball, soccer, etc.  Our current client base is mainly children ages two to college.  We would be able to expand to adult classes and trainings which would make it a family complex.  By raising the $125,000 we will be able to provide our community and surrounding areas with many options for families to stay physically active in a safe environment with top-notch coaching, physically and mentally.  We need our community to get involved!

How Funds Will Be Allocated

Funds raised will go towards the down payment, first 2 months rent, build-out, gym equipment (ex. trampoline, spring floor, tumble track, various mats), furniture for parent viewing area, office furniture, security system with cameras, sound system, and other necessities to start a business (ex. cleaning supplies, vacuum, toilet paper, hand soap, etc.).  We have put into the equation the percentage Indiegogo charges for the funds raised for our campaign.  

The Impact

We have had the opportunity to impact the lives of children and even parents on a small scale.  We would like to do so on a larger scale.  By building up the youth in our community. along with parental support, we will assist children in becoming well-rounded adults who can then impact the lives of others.  All of our athletes, whether age 2 or 20, first learn to "Always Believe in Yourself".  This is one of our core values.  We build athlete's confidence off of this very foundation; Belief!  It's amazing what you can get out of a child's performance once they believe in themselves! 

Risks and Challenges

There are always risks and challenges when expanding into a larger location; the build-out can cost more than expected, the build-out can run behind schedule, delivery of equipment can take longer than anticipated, hiring and training staff that is a good fit, etc.  

We are extremely blessed to have a number of people in our lives that can guide us through this process.  They have been there, done that.  Having people to reach out to during a time of need can be essential.  It gives us comfort knowing we have those people to turn to.

John has extensive experience in acrobatic gymnastics, tumbling, apparatus gymnastics, cheerleading, martial arts and personal training.  His 30+ years of working with children will definitely help us as he teaches classes, we hire coaches and communicate with parents.

Jill has extensive experience in customer service.  Her family has owned a couple of businesses.  She has learned the many ins and outs of business; payroll, accounting, hiring and firing staff, scheduling, customer relations, managing staff, supply orders and advertising. 

We believe our combined skills, along with the proven skills of others, will only lead to success with our business.

Other Ways You Can Help

Can’t donate?

Spread the word to other people. Word of mouth is the most powerful endorsement there is.

Share the campaign on Facebook, Twitter, Tumblr and at conferences.

Learn More About Us

Like us on Facebook!  www.facebook.com/groups/jgtumblingandtraining

Follow us on Instagram!  @jgtumblingandtraining

Follow us on YouTube! JG Tumbling and Training

story:
Farming For The Future

WestSide Tilth Farm is an urban farm in Buffalo, NY. It is operated by Buffalo natives Carrie Nader and Alex Wadsworth. With our combined construction, finance, intensive farming and culinary skills we are confidant in our abilities to run a successful market garden. By using the best of traditional and modern farming technique, and operating with an entrepreneurial approach, we hope to inspire and encourage a new generation of would-be agriculturists.

Most farms are beyond the reach of the community that they serve. Farming in the heart of the city gives us an opportunity to show people who may have never visited a farm before a rare glimpse into where their food comes from.

We grow a variety of vegetables, herbs and fungi without the use of pesticides. We strive to be as sustainable as possible. Our farm is powered by 26 solar panels which power our walk in cooler, seed starting lights and the rest of our daily electric consumption. We use small human or electric powered tools for cultivation and harvest. We deliver goods with our hybrid vehicle. Being in close proximity to our markets gives our farm a unique edge.

Accomplishments

So far, we’ve imported 600 yards of new soil, built a storage shed, walk in cooler, a 350 sqft movable green house and our large 2000 sqft greenhouse.

We’ve provided our produce to local restaurants and grocery stores like Roost, Vera Pizza, Merge, Providence Social & Lexington Coop. We sold at farmers markets throughout the city, including our own farm stand at the farm. We accept WIC and SNAP benefits at all of our markets.

Goals

This season we, not doubt, have our work cut out for us. We look forward to building a wash and pack station, mushroom fruiting chamber, two more movable greenhouses, and, with your help, filling our large greenhouse with new soil for our tomato plants.

What we need

We are asking for $5000 for fresh new soil in our 2000 sqft greenhouse. A portion of that will be used to rent the machinery to move the soil into place. Any extra funds will go directly into the farm for other necessary items.

 

What can you do to help?

Share with your friends, family, co-workers… anyone!

Like us on Facebook and follow us in Instagram

westsidetilth.com

story:
JukeShop

Hi,  since this fundraiser is primarily aimed at JukeShop friends and family, most folks reading this will already know me, but in case you've been referred here by a friend, let me introduce myself and our group:
My name is Patrice Mackey aka Chef Juke.  I am an amateur chef but more importantly a longtime hobbyist and budding machinist. Over the last year and a half I've been working with a group of friends setting up a communal shop here in Eugene, Oregon...The JukeShop - a place where people could come and each contribute tools and expertise for communal benefit to allow all of us to be able to create both personal and communal projects that required more tools or knowledge than each of us had individually.     

Background Until the 1950s it was common for many people to make some or much of their world...furniture in our homes (sometimes the homes themselves) the clothes on our backs, the gifts we gave to to others, etc. Over the last half century, as our culture has embraced the benefits of technology and an ever-shrinking world, an unforeseen side effect is that people have become less and less in touch with the actual making and fixing of the things we use every day. We consume more and more and we make less and less. We have plenty of technical savvy, but have lost and are losing functional savvy.

This loss has not gone unnoticed and has spawned what is called the Maker Movement. A movement of people trying to recapture the skills to make things themselves rather than buying them off a shelf (or more accurately, buying them with a single click of the mouse) and gaining the satisfaction that comes with creating...whether for art, or function, or both.

Our goal for the JukeShop is to create a fully functioning wood/metal/foundry shop that allows us to have a place where we can gather to work on projects big or small....for example...my personal primary project is the JRC - Juke's Rocket Car...an art car that I want to build that evokes the Retro-Futuristic view of the 1930s:


Other JukeShop projects run from the Small (furniture, yard art) to the Not-so-small (treehouses, transforming a 1970's short bus into an RV/tailgaiting mobile, Jeep repair).

The main goal of this fundraiser is to encourage and enable this small group of wanna-be MAKERS to LEARN and MAKE and FIX and more.

What We Are Raising Funds For

Over the last year we've gathered a great starting set of tools that will enable us to weld, rivet, saw, cast metal and more...we've refurbished wonderful older tools including a vintage 1944 South Bend metal lathe, a 1944 Delta Milwaukee Drill press and assorted grinders and polishers, But now we're aiming to step it up to the next level.

To that end, we're looking for a little help from our friends to help us purchase a Vertical CNC Mill. This tool would enable us to make a multitude of parts for projects that are currently well out of our reach to either make manually with the tools that we have, or would not be cost effective to pay someone else to mill our parts for us.

Our goal machine is a Precision-Matthews PM-45-CNC Mill. This Vertical CNC Mill comes highly recommended and will do all of the kinds of milling we anticipate and more. It is hefty enough that it can mill what a larger mill can, but of a size that will still fit in our shop and can (relatively easily) be moved around in the shop when needed.

 

We already have over $2,000 dedicated to the CNC project but need more to be able to get a unit that would truly meet our needs and last for years of communal use and the tooling (vises, end mills, clamps, collets, etc.) to go with it to make it fully functional.

If we don't raise the full amount, we'll aim for a smaller CNC or a manual mill that we can later convert to CNC. If we raise more than the amount needed for the mill itself, we will invest the remainder in tooling for the mill.

What YOU get

Well, first and foremost you get the gratitude the whole JukeShop group....well that and the satisfaction of helping out a group of artists and creators better able to turn the visions of their creations into reality.

In terms of more concrete perks, we've come up with a few that we hope will be of interest:

As I said, I am an amateur chef (studied Culinary Arts back in college) and have a particular interest in traditional Barbecue. I've put together some food related perks that I hope will attract some interest. The big one is basically a catered barbecue dinner for up to 8 folks...(sorry, Eugene area folks only). If you just want a little taste of my cooking, there's a jar of my World Famous (no, really...it's on Reddit, don'tcha know) Raspberry-Chipotle Barbecue Sauce. The $18 jar is for those who need it shipped to them, the $10 jar is for local folks.


At our second group workshop the JukeShop folks learned how to use a plasma cutter....and created the metal sign that hangs on our shop door. each piece was cut by a different person in the shop and when we put them all together, well, we think it came out pretty well. So you can get a custom sign for your shop (or anything else you want to hang a sign on.

Finally, for a $5 donation there is a personalized thank you card signed by the JukeShop Makers.

In addition to the listed perks, if you have a project that you need assistance with, or that would benefit from the use of the CNC mill, once it's up and running, we'd be happy to help out! 

Finally, if you'd like to know more about JukeShop, please email juke@chefjuke.com

story:
We are creating a Custom-Built Jaguar D-Type and attempting a 200MPH+ land speed record record at the Bonneville Salt Flats this summer. The car will feature our innovative XYO Mechanical Balancing Technology, which we believe will make it more powerful and energy efficient.

Our hope is to advance the current sub-170MPH current record and we will run under the Modified Sports, Class H engine, FMS (unblown fuel) or GMS (unblown gas) category.

History of the Jaguar D-Type

In 1954 with limited resources Jaguar, an emerging sports car manufacturer, battled Mercedes (a Goliath at the time) and won the Le Mans 24-hour race in 1955, 1956 and 1957. The D-Type brought an innovative chassis and streamlined body, with a iconic tail plain for superior stability at high speeds; including never before introduced disc brakes. The D-Type brutalized the track with stability, control and sheer speed. It was the fastest car they had ever made, and coined the D-Type to be one of the worlds most respected, most valuable and sought after cars.

Innovation: The Key To Success

Our secret weapon is the XYO Mechanical Balancing Technology. Unlike conventional balancing methods, XYO can automatically and continuously balances rotating equipment to reduce vibration, ultimately making them more ENERGY EFFICIENT.

We want to build the XYO Technology right into the car to help it reach its 200MPH goal. Specifically, we want to install XYO inside the car's DRIVESHAFT.

XYO can improve balancing and allow much more efficient power transmission to the wheels. Lab testing indicates that by improving balance and reducing vibration in the driveshaft, we can significantly increase the performance of the car and help it reach its 200 MPH target.

Speed Week | August 8-14, 2015

Every year, hundreds of teams show up at the 'Mecca of Racing' to try and set land speed records. Here are some facts about the event:

  • Event is run by the Southern-California Timing Association & Bonneville Nationals Inc.
  • Over 500 vehicle entries and 2,500 participants
  • Racing teams come from across the globe to participate at this famous site
  • Speed Week attracts over 12,000 spectators and 150 journalists

Why We Need Your Help

We are a team of innovators and motoring enthusiasts. This project is not just about setting a land speed record; it's about DOING SOMETHING IMPACTFUL. 

The world has precious and limited resources, and burning fossil fuels is having tremendous environmental and health consequences. With over 80 million vehicles produced annually and a billion vehicles on the road today, we are trying to make them more fuel efficient without compromising performance.

We believe the XYO Technology represents a major advancement for balancing rotating systems. It has the potential to minimize vibration to make vehicles significantly more energy efficient, and we want to showcase its abilities at the Bonneville Salt Flats in Utah. 

Installing XYO on the driveshaft is only the first step. In the future we plan to implement XYO for use in vehicle engine fans, wheels and engines. Our ultimate vision is to push the limits for what it means for a car to be smooth, quiet, reliable and fuel efficient, while enhancing performance.

Raising $20,000

This is the minimum budget to get us to our goal. Funds raised will not only be used for building the car, but they will put towards integrating the XYO technology into the driveshaft. Specifically, the funds will cover costs associated with:

  • The Car Build
  • Event Entry
  • Team and Vehicle Transportation
  • Prototype Design, Fabrication and Testing of the XYO Technology in the Driveshaft.

Stretch Goals

If we raise more than $20,000 we intend to apply the additional funds towards building the XYO Technology in the Wheels and making it even faster and more efficient.

XYO Racing is also offering a lucky few candidates a chance to be the driver of this iconic car. Two of the available spots are for drivers looking to set their own World Land Speed Record. The team can be contacted directly for details on how to apply to be a driver for the upcoming event in Bonneville. For more information, visit: 

http://www.xyoracing.com/D-Type-Jag.html


This project is a collaboration between:

  • Perpetual Industries Inc.: an emerging growth company focusing on research, development and industrial design of new and innovative energy efficient products. At its core is the automatic, mechanical balancing technology called XYO, used for balancing rotating parts in machines so that they produce less vibration and operate more efficiently. Perpetual sublicenses XYO to third parties and directly develops and manufactures products containing XYO. XYO Racing is the automotive racing arm of Perpetual Industries.
  • Hurricane Motorsports: a full service motorsports shop that follows a clear objective of providing racing teams the best American made products when “Nothing but the Best” will do. At the helm of Hurricane Motorsports is the revered, lifelong speed addict and 3 time world land speed record holder, Carl Dilley.
  • Vibranautics Inc.: An experienced engineering firm that provides a full range of Research & Development, Testing, Design and Engineering services. They have an experienced engineering team that has in-depth knowledge in vibration testing, 3D modeling, and Finite Element Analysis (FEA).


Carl has acquired many racing accolades throughout his racing career:

  • He has been involved in racing since the mid-70’s. 
  • Served as crew chief for Trevor Boys NASCAR Winston West Team. 
  • Since 2008, has set 3 world land speed records on 175cc and 250cc motorcycle at the Bonneville Salt Flats. 
  • Since 2009, has been racing a 174 R5S class Hayabusa powered GT roadster with 1 win and 5 top-five finishes.  
Current Project Sponsors
story_txt:
We are creating a Custom-Built Jaguar D-Type and attempting a 200MPH+ land speed record record at the Bonneville Salt Flats this summer. The car will feature our innovative XYO Mechanical Balancing Technology, which we believe will make it more powerful and energy efficient.Our hope is to advance the current sub-170MPH current record and we will run under the Modified Sports, Class H engine, FMS (unblown fuel) or GMS (unblown gas) category.History of the Jaguar D-Type Picture credit: Silodrome.comIn 1954 with limited resources Jaguar, an emerging sports car manufacturer, battled Mercedes (a Goliath at the time) and won the Le Mans 24-hour race in 1955, 1956 and 1957. The D-Type brought an innovative chassis and streamlined body, with a iconic tail plain for superior stability at high speeds; including never before introduced disc brakes. The D-Type brutalized the track with stability, control and sheer speed. It was the fastest car they had ever made, and coined the D-Type to be one of the worlds most respected, most valuable and sought after cars.Innovation: The Key To SuccessIn the spirit of innovation, we chose the Jaguar D-Type as an ideal platform to optimize the XYO Technology for the automotive industry. The vision is not just to set a world land speed record, but to prove the benefits of the XYO Technology for automotive applications. Over a billion cars are on the roads today, each one containing multiple rotating parts and components. Imbalance and vibration lead to inefficiencies and vehicles generate significant emissions that have a measurable impact on the environment. XYO could help make these vehicles much more energy efficient while enhancing performance. Our secret weapon is the XYO Mechanical Balancing Technology. Unlike conventional balancing methods, XYO can automatically and continuously balances rotating equipment to reduce vibration, ultimately making them more ENERGY EFFICIENT.




The XYO Technology has undergone decades of Research and Development to mature it into a commercially viable technology. Our Technical Site contains various videos and test reports showing several consumer, industrial and commercial applications where XYO has demonstrated significant benefits.

 We want to build the XYO Technology right into the car to help it reach its 200MPH goal. Specifically, we want to install XYO inside the car's DRIVESHAFT. XYO can improve balancing and allow much more efficient power transmission to the wheels. Lab testing indicates that by improving balance and reducing vibration in the driveshaft, we can significantly increase the performance of the car and help it reach its 200 MPH target.Speed Week | August 8-14, 2015 Every year, hundreds of teams show up at the 'Mecca of Racing' to try and set land speed records. Here are some facts about the event:
Event is run by the Southern-California Timing Association & Bonneville Nationals Inc.
Over 500 vehicle entries and 2,500 participants
Racing teams come from across the globe to participate at this famous site
Speed Week attracts over 12,000 spectators and 150 journalists
Why We Need Your HelpWe are a team of innovators and motoring enthusiasts. This project is not just about setting a land speed record; it's about DOING SOMETHING IMPACTFUL. The world has precious and limited resources, and burning fossil fuels is having tremendous environmental and health consequences. With over 80 million vehicles produced annually and a billion vehicles on the road today, we are trying to make them more fuel efficient without compromising performance.We believe the XYO Technology represents a major advancement for balancing rotating systems. It has the potential to minimize vibration to make vehicles significantly more energy efficient, and we want to showcase its abilities at the Bonneville Salt Flats in Utah. Installing XYO on the driveshaft is only the first step. In the future we plan to implement XYO for use in vehicle engine fans, wheels and engines. Our ultimate vision is to push the limits for what it means for a car to be smooth, quiet, reliable and fuel efficient, while enhancing performance.Raising $20,000This is the minimum budget to get us to our goal. Funds raised will not only be used for building the car, but they will put towards integrating the XYO technology into the driveshaft. Specifically, the funds will cover costs associated with:
The Car Build
Event Entry
Team and Vehicle Transportation
Prototype Design, Fabrication and Testing of the XYO Technology in the Driveshaft.
Stretch GoalsIf we raise more than $20,000 we intend to apply the additional funds towards building the XYO Technology in the Wheels and making it even faster and more efficient. Backer Rewards







Driver Wanted!



XYO Racing is also offering a lucky
few candidates a chance to be the driver of this iconic car. Two of the available
spots are for drivers looking to set their own World Land Speed Record. The team can be contacted
directly for details on how to apply to be a driver for the upcoming event in
Bonneville. For
more information, visit: 
http://www.xyoracing.com/D-Type-Jag.html

About XYO Racing


This project is a collaboration between:



Perpetual Industries Inc.: an emerging growth company focusing on research, development and industrial design of new and innovative energy efficient products. At its core is the automatic, mechanical balancing technology called XYO, used for balancing rotating parts in machines so that they produce less vibration and operate more efficiently. Perpetual sublicenses XYO to third parties and directly develops and manufactures products containing XYO. XYO Racing is the automotive racing arm of Perpetual Industries.

Hurricane Motorsports: a full service motorsports shop that follows a clear objective of providing racing teams the best American made products when “Nothing but the Best” will do. At the helm of Hurricane Motorsports is the revered, lifelong speed addict and 3 time world land speed record holder, Carl Dilley.

Vibranautics Inc.: An experienced engineering firm that provides a full range of Research & Development, Testing, Design and Engineering services. They have an experienced engineering team that has in-depth knowledge in vibration testing, 3D modeling, and Finite Element Analysis (FEA).


 

 

 


 Team Manager
Carl has acquired many racing accolades throughout his racing career:

He has been involved in racing since the mid-70’s. 
Served as crew chief for Trevor Boys NASCAR Winston West Team. 
Since 2008, has set 3 world land speed records on 175cc and 250cc motorcycle at the Bonneville Salt Flats. 
Since 2009, has been racing a 174 R5S class Hayabusa powered GT roadster with 1 win and 5 top-five finishes.

story:
I have been blessed with the gift of creativity.  It is what I enjoy doing.  Creativity excites me.  It calms my moods, helps me to escape, communicates my emotions, and expresses my individuality. Not getting too deep or intellectual:  the word Charisma or Charismatic (the creative rebel in me spelled it with a k) means a compelling attractiveness or charm that can inspire devotion in others; or from its Greek origin, charisma is favor with which one receives without any merit of their own/the gift of divine grace.  I have been given a gift.  It is my passion to spread my gift and encourage others to tap into their creativity and pursue the calling on their life.  

Kharismatic Kreations is a custom apparel printing company that I started 5 years ago while on maternity leave.  My daughter, Kenedi, has been my Kharismatic motivation every step of the way.  Within the last 5 years, I've learned new printing techniques, grown my customer base, received awards, and expanded my product line and brand to include custom gifts and DIY project inspiration on my blog, Crafty Kreations. 

As Kharismatic Kreations continues to grow I'm ready to take the show on the road literally!  By making a financial contribution to my campaign, you will assist me in purchasing a truck that I will transform into the Kharismatic Karavan.  The Kharismatic Karavan will be a mobile boutique that we will take on the road, spreading the gift of Kharisma one community at a time.

story:
Italo's Vision:

Italo's Gourmet is a unique brand of Italian foods with a unique mission. Founded by brothers Wayde and Mark Alfarone, with the idea in mind that business can be self serving and serve the greater good at the same time! Italo's Gourmet is named after our father, Italo Alfarone, who along with our mother Elaine, spent most of their lives giving and helping others. This example gave rise to the idea that business does not have to be selfish, in fact many businesses help the needy, and we think that's the way it should be! By helping fund Italo's Gourmet, you are funding our dream, and also helping feed America. That's the American dream!

Now let's move on to the BIG question. What's so special about these products? For one thing, Italo's Gourmet is 100% natural, no preservatives, there's no added sugar, it's gluten free, and GMO free. The way we make our products in small batches allows us to keep our traditional way of cooking in tact, at every step! We use only farm fresh ingredients, nothing is ever frozen or dried (yuk), and the order of the steps, combined with our ingredients simply make a better product. The bottom line, in numerous blind taste tests, our sauce wins every time against the most expensive "top shelf" sauces! We just taste better.

This is what fresh ingredients look like when they get to us. We process (grate, juice, chop) all ingredients in house. Our sauces, salad dressings, and soups all use fresh ingredients!

Some Fast Facts About Nutrition:

Let's look at the ingredients in our sauces, soups, and salad dressing. Any nutritionist will tell you that your body requires quality food, and if you want to be productive and healthy, you must eat well. So, let's look at our options.

1. Eat cheap food that's bad for you (e.g. fast food or microwaveable dinners)

2. Eat expensive food that may or may not be good for you

Or

3. Eat Italo's Gourmet and get the best of both worlds.

Here's how it works, almost all cheap food is bad for you because almost all cheap food is processed with bad things, or things that have no nutritional value. Or, you can eat expensive foods that may or may not be good for you, because many expensive foods are also high in fat, sugars, and other things that our bodies don't want too much of. However, Italo's pasta sauce for example contains things that are delicious AND very good for you, such as, farm fresh tomatoes (full of anti-oxidants and Lycopene), which the Mayo Clinic says may help people with astma, and help stave off cancer! Or, basil, which research at Purdue University says: can reduce inflamation and swelling, has anti-aging properties, and is rich in anti-oxidants. Garlic is proven to boost the immune system and even combat the common cold, it can lower blood pressure, reduce total cholesterol while increasing "good" cholesterol, (this combination is said to help prevent Alzheimer's disease), and a little known fact about garlic... It was the first known athletic performance enhancing drug used by Olympic athletes in ancient Greece! And let's not forget the health benefits of extra virgin olive oil, if you're not sure what they are, google it, you'll be amazed. Instead of listing every ingredient we use, let's just say, all of our ingredients are good for you, period. 

What We Need:

We are currently expanding our production, and no longer want to rely on outside manufacturers, in the critical phase of our fledgling business. We need equipment, more warehouse space, and inventory. Our plan is to purchase a 100 gallon steam kettle to increase production, along with an automated label machine, and filling line. While most of the process is still hand made in small batches, an increase in production is necessary, and very important for the next phase of our business plan. $50,000 will purchase all the needed equipment, pay for additional warehouse space, and give us an additional 30 day supply of product while we wait to collect from our clients.

We are dedicated to helping feed the needy here in the USA through organizations like feedamerica.org, and local food banks that are affiliated with them. It's not that we don't want to help in other countries, we just believe that you should take care of your own first! With this in mind, all funds donated from profit derived in the USA, stay in the USA. As we expand our distribution into other countries, we will use the profit derived from those sales, in those respective countries.

So what's in it for you? Aside from the warm fuzzy feeling you get from helping, you get some really cool perks with each donation! You could get things like Italo's Gourmet Basil Pasta Sauce, Pasta e Fagioli (bean and pasta soup), The best damn salad dressing on earth (we call it Limone e Olio Fresco). Plus we have things like awesome T-Shirts, and the coolest of all, wait for it... You could even have a product named after you, to be seen in natural food stores and supermarkets nationwide! So, be sure and look to the right for the perk that fits you best.

                                                       

Also, if for some reason we don't hit our complete goal, the funds will not go to waste! They will still be used to bottle more inventory for the masses which leads to more donations for the hungry.

Our Challenges:

The most challenging thing that we deal with at Italo's Gourmet is our small batch price point. In the food industry, until you reach very high volume, pricing will be a little higher than other products in your category. While some companies sell pasta sauce for $3.00 and $6.00 a jar (depending on size), we sell ours for $5.99 and $9.99, but that's okay. Here's why. We understand how to overcome the price objection, we do it with quality, and a little logic. You can feed your family of six fast food, for a cost of about $36.00 if you want, or, you can feed a family of six Italo's healthy, delicious sauce and pasta for $12.00, the choice is yours, but who would ever choose expensive bad over inexpensive good? As sauces go, ours, along with two pounds of pasta will serve six people for $2.00 a person, you could get cheap sauce and get that down to $1.00 per person but then you just have a bad tasting meal and look really cheap!

Italo's Gourmet uses only 100% natural farm to bottle produce, with no stops in between, and never preservatives. We have found that once our customers taste the difference they will never go back to mass produced, low quality foods if they can help it. We also understand that some people can't even afford to feed their families, that's why our business model is what it is, we want to help.

Other Ways You Can Help:

We know that not everyone is in a position to give money, but that doesn't mean you can't help! If you can't donate, PLEASE let everyone know about our mission, help spread the word, and be sure to use the Indiegogo share tools. One last thing, please visit feedamerica.org and Italo's Gourmet and help however you can. We don't want to be the country that helps the world, and lets our own go hungry! Peace, Love and Pasta Sauce!
